loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 48 years old and operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in her community, which she has done for two years. She sells household basic commodities like detergent, seasoning, toiletries, chips, canned goods, and soft drinks.

She is asking for a loan to buy more items to resell, like coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent, rice, cooking oil, toothpaste, chocolate drinks, and seasoning. These items are in high demand and sell well on a daily basis.

With a loan, Narcisa is confident that her sari-sari business will be more prosperous. She will use her profits for the school fees of her two children ages 13 and 16.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent, rice, cooking oil, toothpaste, chocolate drinks, and seasoning.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita hails from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 56 years old and married with four children, with her youngest aged 18. She has been farming rice for 15 years now to provide for her family’s needs.

She wanted to increase her income for her family’s benefit. She applied for a loan to buy fertilizer, and pesticides and to pay for tractor service and farmers helping during planting season. Any additional income will go to her family’s daily consumption and her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for tractor service and farmers helping during planting season.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is a 52-year-old farmer from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have been farming rice since their six children were young. Her youngest now is 18 years old and she continues to work hard for her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay hired farmers who will be helping with the planting activity. She hopes that, through the loan, she can improve her business profit and the life of her family in terms of healthy diet and savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay hired farmers.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 33 years old. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has four children ages 10, 13, and 14, whom she raises alone as a single mother.

In order to support her children, she sells dried fish and steamed rice cake locally known as "puto". She is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish, flour and sugar, and piglets so she can start a hog raising business.

She will continue to work hard so that her children can have a brighter future and can go to school. Her profit will be used to buy a healthy diet for her kids and pay for their school fees.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, flour and sugar, and also piglets.

loans.name: Elsy Yaneth

texts.es:
Elsy, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer joven, es madre soltera, tiene una hija pequeña y vive con sus padres y ellos le ayudan a cuidar a su hija mientras ella trabaja. 

Elsy, trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza por catalogo y por encargo, tiene cinco años dedicándose a ese trabajo y gracias a ese trabajo ha logrado salir adelante con su hija. 

Elsy, necesita el préstamo para poder comprar más producto y poder surtir la gama de productos que ofrece.

Los sueños de Elsy son, poder formar un negocio más grande, con mejores y nuevos productos.- Pero también desea que su hija estudie y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Elsy is 32-years old. She is a young woman who is a single mother. She has a young daughter, and they live with Elsy's parents, who help take care of her daughter while Elsy works.

Elsy sells beauty products from catalogs and by orders. She has been making her living in this way for five years. Thanks to this work, she and her daughter have been able to get ahead.

Elsy needs the loan so she can purchase more products and stock up on the gamut of products that she sells.

Elsy's dream is to create a larger business with new and better products. However, she also wants her daughter to go to school and have a career.

loans.use: to purchase more products and stock up on the gamut of products she sells.

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es:
Ana, de 28 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de tortillas y comida en su casa, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar porque su familia carecía de recursos económicos; está acompañada y junto a su esposo ha procreado dos hijos, todos los días trabaja duro para sacar adelante a su familia y ayudar a su madre y a su esposo con los ingresos del hogar, su esposo se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas y también trabaja en el ingenio de azúcar.

Ana, tiene experiencia sobre las actividades que realiza, porque desde su niñez junto a madre aprendió a ganarse la vida trabajando honradamente, su madre a pesar de su avanzada edad, siempre le ayuda en el negocio todos los días.

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar mercadería para seguir vendiendo comida y tortillas, para seguir trabajando en su negocio y de esa manera generar algunos ingresos.

Ana, sueña con construir una vivienda con mejores condiciones, además desea mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Ana is 28 years old and dedicates herself to domestic work and to selling tortillas and food in her home. She didn't have the opportunity to study because her family lacked the financial resources. She is in a relationship and has had two children with her husband. She works hard every day to get her family ahead and to help her mother and her husband with the household income. Her husband works in agriculture and also at the sugar refinery.

Ana has experience with the work she does, because she learned to make an honest living alongside her mother from the time she was a child. In spite of her mother's advanced age, she always helps Ana with her business, every day. Ana needs the money from the loan to buy merchandise to keep selling food and tortillas, and to keep working at her business, thus generating some earnings.

Ana dreams of building a home in better conditions. She also wants to send her children to school to prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to keep selling food and tortillas.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a 36-year-old mother with three children. She operates a business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Sina requested a loan to buytaro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and a knife to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and a knife.

loans.name: Siisii

texts.en:
Siisii is a 33-year-old mother with six children who has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumbers) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Siisii requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, safety boots, and a chainsaw to assist her in running the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, safety boots, and a chainsaw.

loans.name: Julia Cristina

texts.es:
Julia, de 38 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 16 años de edad.

Julia, ha trabajado en casas, en tiendas en el mercado y actualmente tiene un negocio de venta de comida, el cual inicio hace 2 años con la ayuda económica de un tío, quien le financio todo para poner el negocio, ella considera que el negocio está dando buenos resultados y con eso ayuda a su hijo para que continué estudiando; actualmente se le ha dañado una refrigeradora y eso le ha afectado mucho, porque algunos productos que necesitan refrigeración se le han dañado.

Julia, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar una refrigeradora y comprar productos para el negocio, con la ayuda de este préstamo ella podrá mantener los productos refrigerados y continuar vendiendo.

Sus sueños son comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa, porque actualmente vive en la casa de una tía; también sueña con que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Julia is 38 years old and is the single mother or a 16-year-old son. Julia has worked in houses and in stores in the market, and currently she has a business selling food that she started two years ago with the financial help of an uncle who financed everything for her to be able to start her business. She thinks that her business is giving good results and with these she helps her son continue studying. At the moment her refrigerator is broken and this has affected her a lot, because some products that require refrigeration have spoiled.

Julia is asking for the loan to buy a refrigerator and to buy products for her business. With the help of this loan she will be able to keep the products refrigerated and to continue selling. Her dreams are to buy land to build her own house, because she currently lives in an aunt's house. She also dreams that her son will be a professional.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and to buy products for her business.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб молодой человек из города Душанбе. Ему 24 года. Сухроб воспитанный, интеллигентный и веселый джентльмен. Он имеет не большой продуктовый магазин и сам управляет всем магазином. Сухробу нравится, то чем он занимается и считает, что нашел свою профессию. Сухроб решил расширить свою деятельность. Он собирается привести больше продуктов на продажу и расширить ассортимент товара и привлечь внимание покупателей. Единственной преградой на пути этого джентльмена стоит финансовое затруднение. Сухроб надеется, что с помощью кредита он осуществит задуманное и привезет продукты питания для магазина.
texts.en: Surhob, age 24, comes from the city of Dushanbe.  He is a well-educated, intelligent, and happy young man.  He owns a small grocery store which he manages by himself.  He is happy with his business and believes that he has found the right field of work for himself.  He has decided to expand his activity and would like to bring in more food products for resale.  This will allow him to increase his inventory and attract more customers.  Financial difficulties are his only obstacle, so he's relying on this loan to carry out his project and bring in more food products for his store.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda is a 25-year-old mother with two children. She runs a business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Matilda requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves, and a backpack sprayer to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank,  hand gloves, and a backpack sprayer,.

loans.name: Elisara

texts.en: Elisara is a 58-year-old mother with eight children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Elisara requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a fry pan to assist her to run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a fry pan

loans.name: Senitima

texts.en:
Senitima is a 70-year-old mother with eight children. She is strong and fit to run her business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living with the help of her children. She has been doing this for more than three years.

Senitima requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina is a Samoan citizen. She is a 23-year-old mother with two children. She runs a business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Sosefina requested for a loan to buy a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, and a shovel to help her run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, and a shovel.

loans.name: Zumrat

texts.ru: Зумрат обращается за кредитом уже во второй раз. Первый кредит был успешно профинансирован. Зумрат не может подобрать слова, чтобы отблагодарит Вас. Она очень счастлива и верит, что без Вас она бы не могла значительно продвинуть бизнес. На этот она обратилась к Вам для приобретения мелких скотин (барашек). Она уверена, что Вы ей поможете, и заранее благодарит Вас.
texts.en: Zumrat is now taking her second loan, after having successfully repaid her previous one.  Zumrat cannot find the words to thank you.  She is very happy and believes that, without your support, she could not have significantly grown her business.  She is relying on your help again in order to buy a few head of small livestock (lambs).  She is confident that she will receive your support, and she thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy a few head of small livestock.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman and she has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap, milk and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential for growth and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, milk and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, milk and other items.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita lives Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 11, 16, and 19. Emelita has been running a sari-sari (general) store business for four months now. She would like to improve her inventory level and include buying items in bulk for a better profit.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy items like detergent, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, chips, candies, and seasoning. She hopes that with the help of the loan she will be able to increase her income for her family. It is her priority to let her children finish their schooling someday.

loans.use: to buy  detergent, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, chips, candies, and seasoning.

loans.name: Cecilia Ester

texts.es: Cecilia en medio de las dificultades encontró la manera de ofrecer bienestar a su familia por medio de su proyecto de negocio, esta emprendedora mujer de 37 años es habitante de un barrio de Barranquilla con cercanía al mar en donde funciona su venta de comidas rápidas.  Su iniciativa se dio por la situación de desempleo que atravesaba su esposo que les obligó a buscar alternativas de ingreso.  En la terraza de su vivienda situada en una vía principal los fines de semana a partir de las 4 p.m. instalan su puesto de comidas e inician a promover las ventas con el aroma de las papas fritas, asados, perros calientes, hamburguesas entre otras delicias que preparan. En la actualidad cuenta con 14 años de funcionamiento y está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en carnes frías, harina, queso, salsas y aderezos para la preparación de sus comidas.  Con esta inversión obtendrá mejores precios al adquirir volúmenes de materias primas.  Su meta a futuro es tener otro punto de atención y realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
During some difficult times, Cecilia found a way to provide her family with a sense of well-being through her business project.
This enterprising woman, who is 37-years old, is a resident of a Barranquilla neighborhood that is close to the sea. That is where she sells her fast food. Her initiative came out of a situation in which her husband became unemployed. They needed to find another source of income.
Their home is on a main road, and so on weekends, beginning at 4:00pm, they open for business on the patio of their home. The aroma of the french fries, barbecue, hot-dogs, hamburgers and other delicious foods cooking promotes their sales. Cecilia has currently been in business for fourteen years.
Cecilia is applying for her first "credikiva" through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so she can invest in cold meats, flour, cheese, salsas and seasonings for making her food. With this loan, she will be able to purchase her raw materials in larger quantities and get better prices.
Cecilia's future goals are to have another food stall and to make some repairs to her house.

loans.use: to invest in cold meats, flour, cheese, salsas and seasonings so she can prepare her food.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella shows the pig cage where she raises hogs at the back of her house in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. It has deteriorated in her 10 years of operation. She makes use of old sacks, spare wood and iron rods to somehow protect the hogs. She hopes to repair the cage, this is why she longs to borrow PhP 30,000 from you, kind and generous lenders. She plans to buy hollow blocks, cement, plywood and galvanized iron sheets.

She will also buy feeds, medicines and vitamins to counter the common illnesses of pigs that bring losses to hog raisers during the rainy season. In due time, she aspires to have a big piggery that will give enough profit for her family. This will ensure their everyday sustenance and her children’s education. She and her husband, Romeo, dream that all their children will finish schooling and become successful, not just in their own careers but in their holistic life.

She constantly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through sharing of experiences and Biblical reflections.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her pig cage, and buy feeds, medicines and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals such as maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more cereals. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita, of Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, dreams that her boarding house will become units of apartments for rent and that her “sari-sari” will develop into a complete grocery store someday. For now she can only offer small rooms for rent, and sell small quantities of the usual commodities, like toiletries, snack items, canned goods, and beverages. If she has spare capital, she buys one to two piglets and fattens them for selling.

Unlike a grocery store where customers instantly pay in cash or through a credit card, a community store like Isabelita’s has many debtors. Most of her debtors are her boarders. They request later payment for store items and boarding house rent. At times, they just flee, leaving behind their debts. This bad habit of some boarders minimizes her capital.

Now she wants to avail of additional capital, amounting to PhP 20,000, that she can use to improve her business. She will renovate her boarding house and procure more stock for her variety store. She’s hoping that it will lead to a higher profit that can sustain her and her husband’s everyday needs and savings for their retirement. They were able to provide for their children, who are already grown up and starting their own families.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her boarding house

loans.name: Ilsa

texts.es:
Ilsa está en el tercer año de Licenciatura en Enfermería, sigue sus estudios con mucho sacrificio para así poder mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Trabaja y estudia al mismo tiempo para poder cumplir con sus objetivos, es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad y seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ilsa is in her third year toward earning her Nursing degree. She continues with her education with a lot of sacrifice, so that she can improve her income and improve her quality of life.

She works and studies at the same time to achieve her goals. She is a very dedicated person, who wants to go forward.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay her university fees and to continue with her education as she has been doing.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru: Гулизор милая женщина из Кабадиянского района. Ей 55 лет. Гулизор вежливая женщина. Она очень любит трудиться. Гулизор занимается животноводством в течение многих лет. Она очень любит животных и очень хорошо заботится о них. До сих пор она обеспечивала свою семью молочными продуктами. Теперь она хочет начать бизнес в этой сфере, так как в данный момент у них финансовые проблемы в семье. У Гулизор есть загон и маленький теленок, но этого мало. Ей нужно купить еще несколько телят, чтобы начать свой бизнес. Гулизор с большой надеждой ждет Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Gulizor is a kind woman from the Qubadiyon district of Tajikistan.  She is 55 years old, polite, and very hardworking.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for many years.  She loves animals and takes really good care of them.  Keeping livestock has always allowed her to provide dairy products to her family.  Today, as her family is going through difficult financial times, she's thinking of starting a business selling dairy products. She currently has a small cattle pen and a young cow, but this is not enough.  She needs to buy a few more heifers in order to start her business.  She confidently relies on your support.

loans.use: to purchase a few heifers and start her own business.

loans.name: Las Reinas Del Norte Group

texts.es:
Lenny continúa con su actividad de carpintería. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de madera, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. En esta oportunidad la banca es liderada por; Lucia, que es una joven mujer de 20 años, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos; recién nacido de 2 meses y otro de 4 años y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es independiente, constante y muy comprometida, su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la zona ‘Mutualista’.
Lucia es morena de cabello negro largo y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (la primera de la izquierda, viste pantalón rosa). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de comida como; Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno de papa y plátano),  “con mi negocio alimento a mis hijos todos los días…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina como; carne, arroz, fideo, aceite y otros. Su sueño es establecer su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina para abastecer su negocio y alimentar a sus hijos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Lucia solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para abastecer su negocio y alimentar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The subject of the previous loan, Lenny, continues with her carpentry work. The previous loan was invested in buying wood, and the repayments were punctual.

At this time, the bank is led by Lucia, who is a young, 20-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has 2 children--one who is 2-months old and another who is 4 years old. Her business is selling food. She is independent, diligent, and very committed. She works as a street vendor in the "Mutualista" area.

Lucia has brown skin, long black hair, and a thin physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish. In the photograph, she is first from the left, in the pink pants. She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and with their children, who are still not of school age. They live in a rented room, built from brick and cement, with a metal roof, and that has all of the basic services.

Her business is selling food, such as stuffed napes (a Spanish colonial dish in which a hen's neck is stuffed with potatoes and bananas). She says that with her business, she feeds her children everyday. The advantage of her business is that she makes sales daily; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy cooking supplies, such as meat, rice, noodles, oil, and other things.

Her dream is to set up the business. She wants to buy cooking supplies to stock up her business and feed her children. This is her second sequence of loans with the institution in 5 years. She does her work independently.

It is for these reasons that Lucia requests a loan to buy cooking supplies to stock up her business and feed her children.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies to stock up her business and feed her children.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Other people perceive the task of managing a “sari-sari” (variety) store as a simple “wait and sell” practice. It’s not that effortless. Constancia of Toril, Davao City wakes up very early in the morning and sleeps late at night in order to meet the demands of customers. Sometimes a customer knocks at 4:30 a.m. to buy one sachet of shampoo worth PHP 5. At times, she has to stay until 12 midnight to take the orders of a group drinking beer in front of her store.

Constancia needs to be patient indeed, or else customers will brand her as unfriendly and they will patronize other stores. It’s a good thing that her husband, Jovito, takes turn in looking after the store. She can also rely on her children to watch over the store after school. They share the task because their usual everyday needs are supported by the income from the variety store. However, the profits are unstable and drive her to add rice and dried fish to her inventory. She hopes to take out supplementary capital of PHP 10,000 that she will use to buy sacks of rice and dried fish. May you be God’s blessing to her.

She dreams of a bigger store and completed college education for her children someday. She shares this aspiration with her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and dried fish to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Hollow block (or concrete block) is the primary building material in construction of walls for houses and buildings. The raw materials needed to make concrete blocks are cement, sand, gravel, and water.  The materials undergo a process of mixing, molding, curing or hardening, and then cubing. Isidro, 48, manufactures concrete blocks in the yard of his residence in Toril, Davao City. He pays two helpers to assist him. Many residents in their community use concrete to make their houses more sturdy. Isidro expects larger demand for concrete blocks but he has no means to increase his production due to the lack of capital. He prays for PhP 50,000 additional capital to buy more bags of cement and loads of sand and gravel. He and his wife, Nora, want to improve his business to ensure his children can get a college education. He also dreams of buying another vehicle for delivery and to finish their own house.

He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business.  They also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more bags of cement and loads of sand and gravel

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: El Señor Héctor, tiene 63 años de edad, su estado civil es Unión Libre, tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, vive en una aldea del municipio de Petoa, cerca de Cofradía, Cortes junto a su esposa y su madre. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la ganadería y venta de productos lácteos, pero hace 20 años se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles lo que le genera ingresos para su familia. Esta producción la vende en la misma zona. El prestamo que solicita es por 10,000.00 lempiras y es el séptimo ciclo que ha solicitado a ODEF. Con este dinero va comprar fertilizantes, y pago por limpieza del cultivo de maíz y así podrá obtener mejor cosecha. Su sueño es volver a comprar ganando.
texts.en:
Señor Héctor is 63-years old. He is married and has five grown children. Don Héctor lives in a village that is a part of Petoa and near Cofradía, Cortes. He lives with his wife and his mother.

Previously, don Héctor made his living in livestock and selling dairy products. However, twenty years ago he started making his living growing corn and beans, which generate his family's income. He sells his produce in the same area in which he lives.

The loan don Héctor is requesting is for 10,000.00 lempiras (USD $475). It is his seventh lending cycle with ODEF. With this loan, don Héctor will purchase fertilizers and pay to have his corn crop weeded so he can have a better harvest.

Don Héctor's dream is to purchase livestock once again.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay to have his corn crop weeded.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells mobile phone accessories. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of phone accessories. His business goal is to expand his business to wholesale within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of phone accessories.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es: Verónica tiene 42 años, es casada, tiene un hijo pequeño y vive en la maravillosa Ciudad de México, Verónica estudió administración de empresas turísticas pero además es una mujer emprendedora que siempre busca hacer su mayor esfuerzo para darle lo mejor a su familia, desde hace más de un año ella puso un negocio de confección de moños y adornos para niñas, actualmente ya se encuentra repartiendo moños en otra parte del país como Michoacán, su principal meta a mediano plazo es establecerse en un local y seguir con la distribución a más estados de México, lo más difícil a lo que se enfrenta con su negocio es la competencia, sin embargo ella tiene una ventaja competitiva que es la manera artesanal como están hechos los moños. Su principal motivación para seguir adelante es su familia y la proyección que tiene para su negocio. Ella solicita un préstamo por MXN 12,000 para poder comprar materia prima como: listón, pegamentos, para introducir nuevos modelos de moños en su negocio. Verónica se siente muy orgullosa por el ímpetu que le pone a su negocio y por los resultados que ha visto, ella agradece mucho a todas las personas que puedan ayudarla con este sueño.
texts.en:
Verónica is 42 year old, married, has a young child and lives in wonderful Mexico City. Verónica studied Tourism Business Administration, but she is also an enterprising woman that works her hardest to give the best to her family.

Since over a year ago, she started a business making bows and accessories for girls. She currently distributes bows in other parts of the country, such as Michoacán. Her main medium-term goal, is to establish a stand and continue distribution to more States within México. The hardest thing she faces in her business is competition, however, she makes the bows in a traditional manner, which gives her a competitive edge.
Her main motivation to keep going is her family and the plans that she has for her business. She is requesting a loan for MXN 12,000 to purchase raw materials such as: ribbon and glue, to introduce new bow styles in her business.

Verónica feels very proud of the energy she invests in her enterprise and of the results she has seen. She is grateful to everyone who can help her realize this dream.

loans.use: purchase raw material such as ribbon and glue

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en: Bosco is a resident of Amuca in lira town. He is 45 years old, married and has six children, all of whom are schooling. He deals in the trade of second hand clothes in lira and was motivated by the high demand for the clothes. It's out of this business that he gets the money to support his family and educate his children. He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from Ugafode Microfinace to boost her business by buying more stock of clothes to meet his customers' demands and also raise more income. He is grateful to Ugafode Microfince and Kiva funders for the job well done in supporting microenterpreneurs.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Here is Virginia from Toril, Davao City. She is 50 years old and married to Pepito, a laborer.  They have two children, one of whom is a college student. Her husband’s irregular income cannot support their growing expenses, so she has ventured into directly selling Personal Collection products.
 
Direct selling businesses are common in the Philippines, especially for housewives who want to be productive and are willing to supplement the lack of family resources. Working people who want to earn extra money usually engage in this business also.  It’s easy to venture into this business since it typically requires low capital to begin. Then the entrepreneur or direct selling representative will grow the business by expanding her network of target consumers and properly rolling the capital.

Virginia aspires to enhance her direct selling business. She applied for PhP 20,000 loan that she will use to buy more personal and home care products.  She’s positive that this additional capital will give her more profit to supplement her husband’s income. 

She dreams to build her family’s house someday. She also desires for a good future for her children and a harmonious relationship among her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more personal and home care products

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is a 32 year old mother with five children. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Malia requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube(seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, hand gloves, and a backpack sprayer to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, hand gloves, and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: Marta Sulema

texts.es: Doña Marta, es madre soltera con 56 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Petoa, Santa Barbara con una  hija y su nieto. Anteriormente se dedicaba a prestar el servicio de transporte con un vehículo en la aldea. Hace 3 años se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa, sandalias, productos plásticos como vasos, platos, tazas, panas, tinas y otros. Su negocio está en su casa y a veces vende de forma ambulante. En vista de que tiene unos pedidos de mercadería ha solicitado un préstamo por un monto de 10,000.00 Lempiras para comprar mercadería, blusas, pantalones, sandalias, camisas  y productos plásticos para mantener surtido y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Su plan es seguir invirtiendo y mejorar el negocio.
texts.en:
Marta is a single mother and 56 years old. She has three children and lives in a village of the city of Petoa, Santa Barbara with a daughter and her grandson. She used to make a living providing transport service with a vehicle in the village. Three years ago she started selling clothing, sandals, plastic products like glasses, plates, cups, pans, containers and other items. Her business is in her home and sometimes she sells in an itinerant fashion. 

Because she has some requests for merchandise, she has asked for a loan for 10,000.00 Honduran lempiras to buy merchandise, blouses, pants, sandals, shirts and plastic products to keep stocked up and meet her customers' requests. Her plan is to keep investing in and improving her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, sandals, shirts and plastic products to meet her customers' requests and to stock her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 37 years old and lives in her own home together with her husband and their four children, who are 2, 5, 9, and 12 years old. She is a hardworking woman who has a business selling women's clothing, which is how she generates the income to provide for her children and to provide for her household's basic needs. Betty wants to improve her earnings, which is why she wants to get a wider variety of products to offer to her numerous customers, whom she has thanks to her courteousness. This is why she's requesting a loan from UGAFODE to buy: a new variety of shoes and women's clothing. to diversify her business' products and improve her profits.

Pictured is Betty with her husband who signed the waiver form in her shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia, de 32 años de edad, está casada, junto a su esposo tiene 4 hijos, pero solo dos asisten a la escuela, porque los otros 2 están muy pequeños.

Lidia, desde la edad de 12 años se dedica a hacer petates para camas, este trabajo se lo enseño y heredo su madre y desde que lo aprendió nunca ha dejado de hacerlo, pues en la comunidad donde vive no hay oportunidades de trabajo y atráves de este trabajo ella le ayuda económicamente a su esposo para cubrir los gastos de su casa; ella elabora 1 petate cada 2 días y cada petate tiene un valor de venta de $5 y el costo de producción es de $4 aproximadamente, lo que ella realmente gana en un día es $1.00 por cada petate que elabora.

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar material para seguir elaborando petates (tule) y así poder ayudar siempre a su esposo con los gastos.

Ella sueña con una mejor vivienda y con seguir estudiando hasta graduarse de bachillerato, para poder trabajar de otra manera, pues el trabajo que ellos realizan es muy pesado y es poca la ganancia que reciben.
texts.en:
Lidia is 32 years old and is married. She and her husband have 4 children; only two attend school because the other 2 are very young.

Since she was 12 years old, Lidia has been dedicated to making bedrolls for beds. Her mother taught her this work, and since she learned it, she has never stopped doing it. In the community where she lives there aren't opportunities for work. Through her business, she helps her husband financially to cover the household expenses. She makes 1 bedroll every 2 days. Every bedroll is sold for $5, and the cost of production is about $4, so in a day, she actually earns $1 for every bedroll she sells.

She needs the money from the loan to buy material to continue making bedrolls. Thus, she will be able to always help her husband with the expenses.

She dreams of having a better house and of continuing to study until she earns a degree, so that she can do other work. The work they currently do is very taxing and provides them with little earnings.

loans.use: to buy material to continue making bedrolls.

loans.name: Shanoza

texts.ru:
Шахноза  трудолюбивя женщина. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем и имеет четырех детей. Она с раннего возраста была приучена к труду. Окончив 11 классов школы, она устроилась на работу в магазин, чтобы помогать родителям. Шахноза  никогда не жаловалась на свою работу. В данное время она работает швеёй. Также она занимается дехканством. Её муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Он работает там поваром.  
Шахноза обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Так как её старшая дочь хочет поступить в Университет. Шахноза хочет получит кредит для оплаты договора обучения. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Shanoza is a hardworking woman. She is 37 years old. She is married and has four children. She became accustomed to work at an early age. After graduating from the 11th grade, she got a job at a store to help her parents. Shanoza never complained about her job. Now, she is working as a seamstress. She also works on a local farm. Her husband has gone to work in Russia. He works there as a cook.

Shanoza asked Arvand for a loan. Since her older daughter wants to go to university, Shanoza wants to get a loan to pay for tuition. She thanks you and Arvand in advance for your support.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 69 years old and has four children with two dependents.  She runs a business selling livestock.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  Right now, her monthly income is KSh 10,000.  She is borrowing KSh 30,000 to buy three cows, two for sale and another one for milk production for her  family.  This is her first loan from VisionFund.  She hopes and dreams for future business so she can have dairy cows for milk to sell and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy three cows: two to sell and one for milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost her shoe trade

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica proviene de una familia muy trabajadora, y luchadora, que se está esforzando para poder ser una licenciada en ciencias jurídicas, ella está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Ella está poniendo todo de sí, se aplica en sus estudios y esta luchando arduamente por sus metas.
Pide este préstamo para poder seguir pagando las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con la lucha de sus metas.
texts.en:
Jessica comes from a hard-working and struggling family and is making an effort to be able to get a Bachelor's degree in legal studies. She is putting her best effort into being able to be someone in life.

She is putting her all into it. She applies herself to her studies and is struggling arduously for her goals.

She requests this loan in order to be able to continue paying the fees for her course of study, and in this way to be able to continue to struggle for her goals.

loans.use: to pay the fees for the course of study.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
El Sr. Pastor tiene 45 años, está en pareja con la Sra. María, también de 45 años, comenta que su trabajo consiste en las ventas ambulantes, con el cual l ayuda a su pareja con el sostenimiento de la casa.
Don Pastor se inició en este rubro hace más de 8 años,   aproximadamente desde el año: 2.007, el comenzó con el capital  propio donde fue realizando compra de menor escala para tener productos de fácil venta y así ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
El pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos varios para la venta, como ser calzados, prendas variadas y artículos de bazar para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Pastor is 45 years old, is in a relationship with María, who is also 45 years old, and says that his work consists of itinerant sales, with which he helps his partner support their household. Pastor got started in this business more than eight years ago, in approximately 2007. He started with his own capital, buying things on a smaller scale in order to have products that sold easily, and like that he's been growing little by little. He is asking for the loan to buy various products to sell, like shoes, a variety of clothing and general merchandise. In this way he will be able to continue with his sales as he has been.

loans.use: to buy various products to sell, like shoes, a variety of clothing and general merchandise.

loans.name: Jinneth

texts.en:
“With the grace of God, we will be able to put up a big, profitable piggery and become a dealer of rice someday. We will finish our own house and my children will complete their education, acquire decent jobs, and live sufficiently.”

Jinneth speaks this phrase with faith as she shares her aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT. She has been a dedicated member of the organization for almost ten years.  She continually gains inspiration from Bible reflections and by sharing her life experiences. 

Jinneth is married to Liberato, a sub-contractor, and they have children who are studying in elementary and high school. They live in Toril, Davao City in the Mindanao region. She raises hogs in their backyard and sells rice.  Hog raising, according to her, is quite tiring but she focuses on its sustainability and its contribution for food production in the community. It also provides for their everyday expenses and some savings for the future. 

Now she needs to buy additional piglets and feed, which is why she is requesting a loan for PhP 20,000.  With this money, she can supply more consumers in their community in the next few months. She is praying that you would be one of God’s instruments to help her. She would really appreciate your kind support.   

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.ru: 40 летняя женщина Мукаррам. Она из города Турсунзаде. Мукаррам сильная и трудолюбивая жена и мать. У нее трое детей. Детям 15, 11 и 6 лет. Дети учатся в средней школе, и после школы они помогает маме в работе. Ее дети воспитанные и заботливые. Мукаррам во дворе занимается животноводством. Уже 15 лет она выращивает скота. Ей нравиться ухаживать о домашних животных. Мукаррам покупает скота и откармливает несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Мукаррам обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить несколько скота для увеличения их численность и расширения бизнеса. Она надеется с расширением бизнеса увеличиться доход, и она может улучшить условия жизни детей.
texts.en:
Meet Mukarram, age 40, from the city of Tursunzoda.  Mukarram is a strong and hardworking woman.  She is married and the mother of three children who are now 15, 11 and 6 years old.  Her children all attend school, and they also help their mother with the farm work.  Mukarram's children are well-mannered and caring.

Mukarram is involved in animal husbandry; she's been raising livestock for 15 years already.  She enjoys taking care of domestic animals.  She buys a few head of livestock, feeds them for a few months and then resells them at the cattle market.  She has requested a loan in order to buy a few head of livestock and increase the size of her herd. She hopes that this business expansion will lead to an increase in her income, which will in turn allow her to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a few head of livestock and increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa, de 59 años de edad, creció con sus padres, su papá se dedicaba a cultivar maíz y frijol, mientras que ella y su madre elaboraban petates todo el día, de donde obtenían ingresos para el sustento de la familia.

Tomasa, nunca ha dejado de elaborar petates y al igual que ella algunas de sus hijas también elaboran petates; ellas compran el tule y cortan pedazos del tallo de la planta para luego empezar e tejer y se tiene que hacer en el piso; para hacer un petate se tardan un día completo de 6:00 de la mañana a 6:00 de la tarde y lo venden a $5 y lo que ganan es $1 por petate, este producto llamado petate, se coloca en las camas porque es un material fresco y evita el calor del colchón.

El dinero del préstamo será para comprar tule para la elaboración de los petates, este préstamo le ayudará mucho, pues es de la única manera con la que ella trabaja.

Sus sueños son construir su casa y heredarla en buenas condiciones a su nieta.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 59 years old. She grew up alongside her parents, with her father cultivating corn and beans while she and her mother worked weaving bed rolls all day. From this work they earned an income to help support the family.

Tomasa has never stopped weaving bed rolls, and like her, some of her daughters also make them. They buy the reeds and cut strips from the stalk of the plant, so they can then start weaving, a task that must be done on the floor. It takes an entire day to weave a whole bed roll, from 6:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. They sell them for 5$, and make 1$ of profit for each bed roll. This product called a 'petate' is used on top of beds because the material is very cool and protects from the heat of the mattress.

The money from this loan will be used to buy reeds to make bed rolls. It will be a great help to her since this is the only work that she does.

Her dream is to build her own house and be able to leave it to her grand-daughter in good condition.

loans.use: to buy reeds to make bed rolls.

loans.name: Maria Armanda

texts.es:
María, de 56 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada, su compañero de vida trabaja en la agricultura y también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, tienen ocho hijos, de los cuales solo cuatro viven con ellos y todos juntos trabajan en la agricultura.

María, se dedica a la crianza de aves y cerdos desde hace diez años, este trabajo lo aprendió por su madre, esta actividad lo realiza desde su vivienda y su esposo le colabora todos los días.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para los cultivos, porque también se dedica a la agricultura y también parte de ese crédito lo necesita para la ampliación y mejoramiento de vivienda y con esto mejorara la calidad de vida de ella y de sus familiares.

Sus sueños son tener una granja de pollos y cerdos más grande y bien establecida, ella también sueña con volver a ver a sus hijos que viven en el extranjero.
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and never went to school. She has a life partner who works as a farmer and also raises pigs. They have eight children, of which only four live with them. They all work together to farm their land. 

Maria has been raising poultry and pigs for the last 10 years. She learned this work from her mother, and realises it at her home. Her husband works with her every day. 

They need this loan to buy supplies such as compost, pesticides and herbicides for the crops, because they are also farmers. Another part of this loan is needed to enlarge and improve their house, and in this way she will improve her quality of life and that of her family. 

Her dreams are to have a bigger, well-established chicken and pig barn, and also to be able to see her children who live in other countries again.

loans.use: buy supplies such as compost, pesticides and herbicides for the crops.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en: Julio is 53 years old.  He is a widow with two children of adult age.  He lives in Cangomantong, Lazi, Siquijor. His wish is to send his children to school until they finish college and land a good job. He doesn't want to see his children doing back-breaking work in tilling and cultivating land like he is doing to provide for their needs. Julio is a hardworking farmer and a loving father to his children. As he recalls, everything has been made possible with the financial support extended by Paglaum MPC to farmers like him. To get a head start for the next cropping season, he requests a loan of PHP 11,500.00 to pay for land preparation (like plowing & harrowing) and to purchase of variety of seedlings for more healthier produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation (like plowing & harrowing) and to purchase a variety of seedlings for more healthier produce

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam is a resident of Amach in Lira.  He is 36 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school. He has a medicine and drug shop in Amach, Lira.  He has a large customer base because of the rampant sickness in the rural community. He has been able to earn enough money to support his family, build a family house and educate his three children.  He also supports his community by giving them first aid.  He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance to buy more stocks of medicine and drugs in order to meet his customers' demands. This will grow his business.  Above all, he is grateful to UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva funders.

loans.use: To stock more medicine and drugs for sale

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a resident of Stach in Lira.  She operates a textiles shop.  She is 32 years old, married, and she has three children that are in school. She deals in the business of selling clothes in the Lira market.  She was motivated to join the business because there is high demand from the town residents. From this business, she makes money to support her family and educate her three children.  She even supports her aging parents. She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance to grow her business.  Above all, she is grateful to UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva funders for supporting small entrepreneurs with their big hearts.

loans.use: To buy more clothing material to sell

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a resident of Abutadi in lira district. He is 28 years old and married with one child. He deals in citrus farming where he has planted a plantation of oranges, paw paws (a tropical fruit), and others. It is from this farming that he gets money to educate his siblings and support his family.

Fredrick has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from Ugafode microfinance to boost his farming through buying farm inputs such as fertilizers, which he thinks will boost his yields, sales, and profit. He is grateful to Ugafode and Kiva funders for the great support they have offered to him.

loans.use: to improve agriculture.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: La señora Marcelina vive en la provincia Carrasco,  es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con sus tíos, la clienta es de la provincia José María Linares del departamento de Potosí, uno de los lugares  pobres de Bolivia, vino de su comunidad de Carpa Huata  como la mayoría de las personas buscando mayor oportunidad de vida, en su comunidad la producción bajo debido a los cambios climatológicos, difícil de controlar, cada vez la producción escaseo, por lo que decidió migrar al trópico,  al terreno de su hermano, en la que hoy en día trabaja y se dedica a la venta de piña, cítricos, yuca y palta, de donde tiene ingresos mensuales de esta actividad, lo que comercializa su fruta comprada en el mercado de Santa Cruz, la señora Marcela requiere un préstamo para ampliara su comercio de fruta  lo que obtendrá mejores ingresos donde facilitara su nivel de vida de la clienta
texts.en:
Marcelina lives in the province of Carrasco. She is single and does not have any children. She lives with her aunt and uncle. This borrower is from the José María Linares province in the department of Potosí, one of the poor areas of Bolivia.

Like the majority of people, she came from her community of Carpa Huata looking for better opportunities. In her community, production went down due to climate changes, which are hard to control. Production was becoming more and more scarce, so she decided to migrate to her brother's land in the tropics.

She currently works there, selling pineapple, citrus fruits, yucca, and avocado. She has monthly income from this business, through which she sells fruit that she buys in the Santa Cruz market.

Marcela needs a loan to expand her fruit business, which will give her better earnings. This will improve this borrower's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to increase sales of citrus fruit, yucca, and avocado

loans.name: Sahodat

texts.ru:
Саходат трудолюбивая женщина 50 лет, мать четверых детей и бабушка пятнадцати внуков. Вот уже на протяжение 30 лет Саходат занимается животноводством. Её выдали замуж совсем молодой девушкой в 16 лет и с тех пор она всё трудится и трудится. У Саходат уже четверо взрослых детей: три дочери и один сын, который живет вместе с ней. Её муж работает таксистом, возит товары и людей из города в город. Несмотря на свой возраст Саходат всё так же ощущает себя молодой и здоровой, но иногда её мучают боли в спине из-за долгой работы на поле.
У неё большое стадо:4 коровы и 5 баранов. Также она на своем участке выращивает овощи и фрукты и ее невестка относит все на рынок и продает.
Сейчас Саходат хочет немного достроить пастбище для скота,чтобы во время холода они не заболели и закупить для них корм. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Саходат надеется на помощь и благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Sahodat is a hardworking woman, 50 years old, a mother of four and grandmother of fifteen grandchildren. Over the last 30 years, Sahodat has been involved in animal husbandry. She was married as a young girl of 16, and since then she's been working and working. Sahodat has four adult children: three daughters and one son, who live with her. Her husband works as a taxi driver. He carries goods and people from town to town. Despite her age, Sahodat feels young and healthy, but sometimes she suffers from back pain due to long work in the field.

She has a large herd of 4 cows and 5 rams. She also grows vegetables and fruit, and her sister takes everything to the market to sell.

Sahodat wants to build a little shelter for her livestock so that they do not get sick in the cold weather and also buy food for them. So she turned to the MDO Arvand for financial support. Sahodat hopesfor your help and thanks for your support.

loans.use: to improve her livestock's living condition and to buy them food.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Living with her parents in Beirut, Hanaa is a 25-year-old woman who has owned a beauty salon since 2013. While her mother does not work, her father is a foreman in a construction company.

Since her divorce, Hanaa has been doing the best she can to become independent in her new life. Her priority is to improve her living conditions to be able to support her parents financially.
Hanaa first started working from her house or visiting her clients in their own houses upon request. However, she decided to open her beauty salon two years ago in order to be able to provide her clients with improved services.

Today, Hanaa is asking for a loan of 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs to loan to buy a new tattoo machine and beauty products. Thus, she will be able to serve more customers and provide them with a better quality of service, which will increase her income and help her reach her personal and financial goals.

loans.use: to buy new beauty products.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 19-year-old, young businesswoman living in Muzarabani, Zimbabwe. She runs a grocery shop where she sells food items such as cornmeal, cooking oil, and beans.

Lilian inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur. Apart from the shop that she has, she has also ventured into a project rearing poultry that she intends to expand using the loan that she is requesting from Kiva. This expansion will also help her realize more income and even create employment for her community.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks to rear and sell.

loans.name: Los Vencedores Group

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer de 40 años de edad, soltera, tienen 2 hijos de 12 y 13 aaños, y su negocio es la venta de cotillón y refrigerio. 
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en el 1er anillo, área caracterizada por encontrarse en el centro de la ciudad, muy comercial.
Nelly es morena de cabello negro largo y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (sentada a la izquierda viste polera celeste). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Debido a la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos formó una banca de personas con negocio como; venta de comida, venta de zapatos, taller eléctrico, venta de medicina natural, venta de ropa de segunda mano, tienda de barrio y café internet, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de cotillón como; piñatas, globos, muñecos, platos y vasos de cartón y otros, “vendo algunos artículos que traen del extranjero y otros que yo misma elaboro…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con fiestas y cumpleaños constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de material de trabajo como, cartón, cartulina, cintas, papeles, pegamentos, etc. Su sueño es tener un puesto propio de venta, ella desea realizar la compra de material para la fabricación de artículos de cotillón. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Nelly solicita un préstamo para la compra de material para la fabricación de artículos de cotillón.
texts.en:
Nelly is a 40-year-old woman, single with 2 children who are 12 and 13 years old. Her business is selling party supplies and snacks.

She is proactive, a good mother and a very responsible person. Her business is located in the first circle (1er anillo), an area notable for being located in the center of the city, and very commercial.

Nelly is dark and not very tall, with long black hair. Her native language is guaraní and she speaks Spanish (seated on the left with a sky blue T-shirt). She shares her life with her children, who are in school. They live in a rented room made of bricks and cement, that has all the basic services.

Based on the need to earn a better income, she formed a loan group with other people who run businesses: food stall, shoe salesman, electric appliance workshop, natural medicine sales, second-hand clothing sales, a corner shop and an Internet cafe, in order to request a loan and improve their businesses.

Her business sells party supplies such as; piñatas, balloons, dolls, paper plates and goblets, among others, “I sell some things that are brought from other countries, and others that I make myself..." she says. The advantage of her business is that there are constantly birthday parties; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy supplies such as cardboard, construction paper, tape, paper, glue, etc.

Her dream is to have her own selling stall. She wants to buy supplies to make party favors. This is the first loan cycle with our institution, in the 2 years she has been running this business.

For these reasons Nelly is requesting a loan to buy raw materials she will use to make party supplies and favors.

loans.use: to buy raw materials she will use to make party supplies and favors.

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.ru:
Мукаддам жительница  кишлака Мучун, ей 32 лет. Она  замужем и имеет четырех детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Мукаддам выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Мукаддам никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Мукаддам вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Мукаддам выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Мукаддам получает хороший доход. Муж Мукаддам также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Мукаддам с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Мукаддам заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Mukaddam lives in the village of Muchun. She is 32 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives in a small rural village. Since childhood, she dreamed of becoming a teacher, but because of financial difficulties, she could not get a higher education. Immediately after graduating from high school Mukaddam was married. And so she became a housewife. But even while staying at home, Mukaddam never sits idle. She and her husband are trying to do everything possible to support their children with everything they need.
,
In order to have a steady income to feed the family, Mukaddam and her ​​husband started their own business. They work in animal husbandry. Mukaddam raises livestock and then sells the meat and milk. Mukaddam makes a good income from this. Mukaddam's husband also works in a local workshop and his work brings additional income to the family. Their joint income is enough to live, and they have enough funds to cover all their needs. Currently, Mukaddam and her husband want to buy a few head of cattle for fattening. So, she turned to Arvand and wants to take a loan to buy cattle. Mukaddam thanks you and Arvand in advance for your support, which0 will improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Rasuljon

texts.ru:
Расулчон  молодой парень 22 лет. Он живет вместе с родителями. Он еще не женат. У Расулчона средне техническое образование. Расулчон занимается ремонтом автомашин. Она мастер своего дела.  Он очень  хороший , добрый  и к своей  семье  любящий парень.  Он очень стремительный и трудолюбивый. 
Расулчон хочет установить пластиковые окна и двери для дома. Так как с наступлением зимы наступают холода. Но у него не хватает собственных средств. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Она  заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Rasuljon is a young guy, 22 years old. He lives with his parents. He has not married. Rasuljon has a secondary technical education. Rasuljon repairs cars. He is a master of his craft. He is a very good, kind and loving man to his family. He is very quick and hardworking.

Rasuljon wants to install new windows and doors for his home. Winter is coming, and with it, the cold. But he does not have the money. He therefore appealed to Arvand for a loan. He thanks you and Arvand in advance for your support and trust.

loans.use: to install plastic doors and windows.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell for her business. Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Remedios requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Remedios would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son de la ciudad de Lambaré, ellas se unieron para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio del trabajo unido y sacrificado. 
La Sra. Maria es una de las que integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras y a través de su esfuerzo está ayudando a su familia, dándoles todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder capacitarse y mejorar su pequeño emprendimiento.
La Sra. Maria solicita de este crédito para la compra de más verduras y frutas, para la venta que realiza todos los días en forma dependiente saliendo por las calles y ofreciendo casa por casa, de ese modo aumentar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: This group is in the elimination of poverty program. They are from the city of Lambaré and got together to be able to help their loved ones through joint work and sacrifice. Maria is one of the members of this group; she makes a living by selling fruits and vegetables, and she is helping her family through her efforts, giving them everything they need to a dignified life without hardships. She is making her best effort to get trained and to improve her small business. Maria is asking for this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell; she does so every day in itinerant fashion, going out into the streets and selling door to door. In this way she will increase her sales and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Vivian works hard to support her family.

Vivian has a buy-and-sell accessories business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more accessories to sell at her business.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more accessories to sell

loans.name: Cherry Joy

texts.en:
Cherry Joy is 28 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cherry Joy raises livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan from NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cherry Joy has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 50 years old, He is married with four children, and he did not complete his education. He was working in public service with a low income, and a few years ago his son has seriously ill, which led him to pay large treatment costs. That is when Mohammad started his business, which is a grocery located on a busy street, to help him increase his income and be able to provide good treatment for his son.

The requested loan is to purchase new products and tools to increase the quality of his work and to expand his shop to attract more customers. Mohammad dreams that his children grow up with a good education and that they obtain good jobs so that they become good and have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase new products and tools to increase his income.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a married woman with eleven children. She is 57 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Luz is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a massage therapy business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase needed materials like massage oil, lotion, etc.

Luz has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase needed materials like massage oil, lotion, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Villarosa

texts.en:
Villarosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Villarosa requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like a fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for seven years now.

Villarosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like a fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El Sr. Cesar se dedica a la reparación y fabricación de ventanas, puertas, entre otros de vidrio, se dedica a este ramo hace más de 20 años, pero de manera particular y manifiesta que gracias a su esfuerzo pudo independizarse hace más de 3 años, el mismo tiene su negocio en su propio domicilio.
César está casado con la Sra. Mirian, y ambos se ayudan para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder refaccionar su casa, el cual es su taller en el cual el trabaja y se esfuerza.
texts.en:
Cesar works in the repair and construction of windows, doors, the glass type amongst others, and has worked in this field for more than 20 years. He states that thanks to his efforts he was able to strike out on his own as a private contractor over 3 years ago and operates his business out of his own home. 

Cesar is married to Mirian and they help each other to be able to grow and improve their own standard of living and that of their loved ones. He's requesting this loan to be able to repair his house, which is his workshop where he works and strives.

loans.use: To repair his house.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 56-year-old married woman with three children. Her youngest is 18 and still attending school. Together with her family, she lives in Talibon, Bohol.

Celsa raises hogs to support her family. She also tills the land and grows rice. She has been engaged in farming for more than 20 years now.

Celsa requested a loan to buy pig feed, and farm supplies like fertilizers and rice seedlings. These could improve the yield of her farm and boost her hog raising business. Thus, she could handle her finances and start to expand her existing livelihood.

Celsa hopes that she could continue supporting her child's education by handling both sources of her income successfully.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, and farm supplies like fertilizers and rice seedlings

loans.name: Abd Alkareem

texts.en:
Abd Alkareem is married and has two children. After he retired from the army he decided to open his own business, which is a grocery. He started a small project to sell food supplies and general products. In order to improve his income, Abd Alkareem wanted to expand it and add more sections in his market.

He did not want to stop, and at this point he wants to develop and expand his shop. He asked for a loan to expand his shop and buy new products and to do good promotion to attract more customers. Perhaps this will help him to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: to expand his shop and buy new products and to do good promotion to attract more customers.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
La señora Felicidad vive y trabaja en Colomi, de estado civil casada, tiene 6 hijos dependientes de ella, de los cuales 3 estudian en el nivel primario. Se dedica a la actividad de agricultura conjuntamente con la familia, produciendo papa como el principal producto agrícola de mayor demanda en el mercado y en el lugar. Para esta actividad a veces contrata personal eventual para la siembra, labores culturales y época de cosecha. Los ingresos económicos obtiene a través de la producción y venta de papa, que es también parte del sustento para su alimentación (auto consumo). La señora Felicidad requiere el préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) 2 camiones y semilla de papa (10 cargas). 
Por último, la señora Felicidad se siente satisfecha al tener la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo que se adecúa a sus necesidades; porque con la compra de insumos agrícolas, mejorará e incrementará la producción de papa y tendrá mayores ventas que mejorará su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Felicidad (Happiness) lives and works in Colomi, she is married and has 6 dependent children, of which the 3 youngest study in primary school.

Her job is farming, along with her family. They raise potatoes, which are the most in-demand agricultural product in the market and where they live. For this work, they sometimes contract laborers, who may eventually help with planting, working the crops, or at harvest time. Their income comes from producing and selling potatoes, which are also part of the family's diet (auto-consumption).

Felicidad needs this loan to buy two truckloads of organic fertilizer (hen droppings) and 10 charges of potato seeds.

In closing, Felicidad is very satisfied at the opportunity to access a loan that fulfills her needs; because by purchasing farm supplies they can improve and increase potato production, sell more, and thus improve the quality of their life.
