loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer (hen droppings) and potato seeds to improve and increase potato production, and have a better quality of life.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is 41 years old and lives in Wihdat. She is a mother of six children, which means that she has a big family.

Rima's is a story bearing the meanings of hope and optimism; she is suffering the difficulties of life to be a good example for her children. Rima said, "I had a large free time, and I felt that I want to develop myself and to provide something for my family. I want to be [a] productive woman.”

After she felt that her children were getting bigger and their needs had increased she came up with the idea for the project: She started buying ready-made clothes and goods, and then her husband distributed them in the shops downtown.

Rima said, “The support that [was] provided by my husband gave me a strong motivation to [move] forward, and I began to feel the importance of women's role in society and that women have an important and complementary role in building a cultured, educated and able-to-take-responsibility society."

Rima began her business, and now she is thinking to develop it and expand it to increase her income, which will help her to provide the best for her children.

She applies for a loan to help her buy more kinds of products and clothes to sell and to do good promotion for her business; perhaps that will help her to increase her income and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of products and clothes to sell and to do good promotion for her business.

loans.name: María Ana De Jesús

texts.es:
María, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y sus hijos estudian.

María, se dedica a la crianza gallinas y también cerdos, esto lo realiza desde hace más de ocho años, su familia fue quien le enseñó dicha actividad, pero aparte de eso también se dedica a la crianza y cuidado de ganado.

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla, abono y pesticidas para obtener una cosecha de mayor calidad, ya que quiere tener mejores ingresos para mantener a su familia.

Su principal sueño, es que sus hijos continúen estudiando, para que se superen; también quiere tener un negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Maria has a third grade education, is married and has four children. Her husband works in farming and their children go to school.

Maria works raising chickens and also pigs, something that she has done for over eight years. She learned this activity from her family, but in addition she also works raising and caring for cattle.

She'll use this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, manure, and pesticides to obtain a higher quality harvest, since she wants to have higher income to support her family.

Her big dream is for her children to continue attending school so that they can better themselves; she also wants to have a well-established business.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, manure, and pesticides.

loans.name: Fatena

texts.en:
Fatena is a woman who is an example of the ambitious and patient. She is a single mother of four children and lives with her children in a poor area.

After her husband left her with no income with her children, Fatena felt that her children needed her more than any time ever, so she decided to overcome the obstacles and try her best to do anything to provide a living for them.

She started to sew traditional clothes, but she needs to increase her income to a provide good life and perfect education to her children, and to cover the household expenses. Therefore, she applied for a loan to buy yarns and fabrics to help her increase her products and increase her profits.

She hopes to expand her work and to have an independent shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy yarns and fabrics to help her increase her products and increase her profits.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 52-year-old, married woman and the mother of four children.

Wafaa and her husband want to ensure a comfortable life and the best education for their children, but day by day, the standards of living are getting increased; therefore, Wafaa decided to start her own small business.

She opened a small grocery beside her house. Her market is working well, but her children are becoming bigger and their needs are getting greater, so she thought about expanding her market.

Wafaa is doing her best to ensure the best life for her children; she does not want see them need anything. She asked for a loan to help her buy more products and more vegetables and to expand her market to increase her work and increase her income. She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more products and more vegetables and to expand her market to increase her work.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a woman with great ideas and a creative mind, and she is a very ambitious woman.

Mona has a willpower that led her to be a productive woman in her community. She is always looking for activities that can improve the family income.

She bought a sewing machine and trained on it until she became a professional. She started to make clothes and some products and sold them; that helped her to cover some of the household expenses.

She is 52 years old and lives with her big family that consists of her husband and her seven children, which mean that she has a big family.

Mona is requesting financial help to buy more fabrics and yarns to invest in setting up her business and attracting clients, and in this way creating a positive impact on her earnings.

Her dream is to have a big tailor business that provides a good income and creates jobs for the women who need jobs to help their families.

loans.use: to buy more threads and fabric.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Mère de quatre enfants, Akoua est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè. Agée de 46 ans, Akoua est une revendeuse des fournitures de mercerie. Akoua s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des séries de fournitures de mercerie en vue de gagner plus de recettes et pouvoir faire face aux charges de la famille et préparer la scolarité de ses enfants pour la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Akoua is forty-six years old, married and mother to four children. They live in Agoè and Akoua sells haberdashery items.

She buys new supplies twice a month from the market and will use her loan to order sets of items. She hopes to increase her earnings, be able to provide for the expenses of her family and prepare for the new school year ahead.

loans.use: to buy 2 sets of haberdashery items.

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la carpintería, sus hijos viven con ellos y ellos estudian.

Norma, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace cinco años, el negocio lo emprendió junto con su esposo, pero también tienen un negocio de venta de ropa y esto también les genera ingresos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su tienda, para que genere más ingresos y así poder mantenerlo día a día.

Sus sueños son, tener un lugar bien establecido para su negocio y tener una casa más grande, para poder vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is 44 years old, has a fifth grade education, is married and her husband works as a carpenter. Their children live with them and go to school.

Norma has had a small store for five years. She started this business together with her husband, but they also have a clothing business and this also generates income for them.

She needs the loan to purchase more merchandise to stock their store, so that it can generate more income and so that she can keep it going day after day.

Her dreams are to have a well-established site for her business and have a bigger house, so that she and her family can live better.

loans.use: To buy more more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Romero Pampa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROMERO PAMPA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gema es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de batidos, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de zapatos, venta de ropa, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gema es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una promoción de la institución, en su comunidad. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su esposo hace ocho años, y también cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la socialización y las reuniones de pago que realiza su Asociación Comunal en la institución.
texts.en:
The community association "Romero Pampa" will begin its first season with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional center, and consists of nine members. It's led by a board of directors in which Gema is the president. The businesses operated by the community organization are varied and include; selling smoothies, a neighborhood store, selling food, selling shoes, selling clothes, and selling blankets.

The loan they'll obtain will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, Gema being one of them, and she says that she joined Pro Mujer through one of the institution's promotional invitations in her community. Currently she has a blanket selling business, she states that she started this business with her husband's help eight years ago and she also says that she learned this business from her parents.

The loan that she'll receive is to increase her working capital (the purchase of wholesale blankets) which she'll acquire from vendors in the city of El Alto and subsequently sell at her shop. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially since she's married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the socializing and the payment meetings that her community association organizes at the institution.

loans.use: To purchase blankets wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Eleanor

texts.en:
“I want to help others. I dream of giving employment to my friends, neighbors, and relatives.”

This is Maria Eleanor’s aspiration. She’s not only concerned about herself, but wishes to succeed together with others. She operates a graphic printing shop located in Buhangin, Davao City. Her husband, Rico, is her business partner and they pay three employees to help them. They usually print tarpaulins, posters and flyers.

The Philippine National Election is set for May, 2016. Aspiring presidential, senatorial, congressional, and local candidates are already introducing themselves as early as now. Although the campaign period hasn’t started yet, they indirectly promote themselves by displaying tarpaulins with various greetings like “Happy Fiesta”, “Advance Merry Christmas” and all sorts. Indeed, Maria Eleanor’s business would be in demand in the next couple of months.

Maria Eleanor would like to buy another printer for tarpaulin with the aid of a 35,000 PHP loan. This additional printer will help increase production and subsequently boost the income for her family and employees.

Maria Eleanor desires to be a blessing to others through her business. She prays for good health, and dreams to acquire a house and lot for her family in the near future. She is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy another tarpaulin printer.

loans.name: Bleoume

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Bleoume  est une femme âgée de 43 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Bleoume est une marchande  de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et le revend dans un hangar à son domicile. Bleoume  demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari à promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en:
Bleoume is forty-three years old, married and mother to two children. They live in Adidogomé and Bleoume sells general food products.

She buys new supplies three times a month and sells them from a stall at her home. Bleoume has requested this loan to order sacks of rice and drums of oil to increase her stock levels. She hopes to maximise her profits and help her husband provide for the education of their children and the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of rice and 3 drums of oil.

loans.name: Shafeeqa

texts.en:
Sahfeeqa is an amazing single mother who lives in Wehdat. She has three children, and she is working hard to ensure a good life for them without them needing anything.

Shafeeqa's husband died many years ago; because of that, she decided to open her own business to provide a living for her children.

Shafeeqa is a very ambitious woman. She wanted to be a productive woman, so she started her business in 2008, and she took a loan to help her buy what she needs to become able to start her work in her beauty salon.

Shafeeqa wants to expand her shop and buy what she needs to raise her profits; she applied for a loan to help her buy a new air conditioner, hair dryer and new tools.

She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a new air conditioner, hair dryer and new tools.

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Bashar is 38 years old, single with no kids, and lives in Beit Omaren in Nablus city. Bashar has a small stockade in front of his house. His main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc. Bashar needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits his ability to expand his project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Bashar hopes to expand his project by increasing the number of livestock.

Bashar thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy ewes and sheep.

loans.name: Kossiwavi

texts.fr: Kossiwavi est femme âgée de 33 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Kossiwavi est une marchande de poissons frit qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et dans les quartiers les plus proches. Kossiwavi désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de cartons de poissons en vue de tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
Kossiwavi is thirty-three years old, married and mother to one child. They live in Adidogomé and Kossiwavi sells fried fish.

She buys her supplies twice a month from the market and sells the fish from the front of her home and in the nearest surrounding neighbourhoods. Kossiwavi has requested this loan to buy more boxes of fish, increase her profits and contribute more to the expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy 6 boxes of fish.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 64 years old and has five children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Rufina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rufina has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rufina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila is 57 years old and married with two children. Fedila works very hard to provide for them.

Fedila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Fedila has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, milk, cereals, coffee, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc.

Fedila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jennifer works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a married woman with three children, and she lives in Jarash. She is an amazing and hardworking woman. She wants to help her husband with the household expenses and the tuition fees for her children.

Fatima is really an example of a woman who has willpower. She started her own business and opened a small mini market for general products.

Fatima wants to expand her work and to increase her income to live comfortably with her family. Therefore, she requested a loan to buy more products to sell to increase her profits and be able to help her husband more and more.

loans.use: to buy new products to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Maria Rosibel

texts.es:
María, de 27 años de edad, es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, no pudo obtener un título universitario, solo pudo estudiar hasta tercer grado, actualmente vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas, las cuales están en la escuela y su esposo motoristas del transporte público.

María, coloco una pequeña tienda donde vende verduras y otros productos desde hace 5 años.

María, necesita el préstamo para fortalecer más su tienda y surtirla un poco más, porque se acercan las fiestas patronales y la demanda se incrementa más.

Ella sueña con tener un negocio más fuerte y darle a su familia todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
María is 27 years old, she is an entrepreneurial and hardworking person. She could not get a university degree because she was only able to study through the third grade. Today, María lives with her husband and their two children, who are both in school. Her husband is a public transit driver. 
María has a small store where she sells vegetables and other products. She has had this store for 5 years. 
She needs the loan to improve her business and to add more items, because the annual festivities to celebrate the town's patron saint are coming up and demand increases during this time. María dreams of having a stronger business and of giving her family everything they need.

loans.use: to improve and stock her store.

loans.name: Esmer

texts.en:
Esmer engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish to the locals in the community. She is 33 years old and a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 10 and the youngest is 3.
Aside from fishing, she also engages in seaweed farming. She has been growing seaweed for almost 10 years now.

Esmer decided to take a loan to buy fishing nets and seaweed seedlings. These resources are vital in improving her livelihood. It enhances her catch and improves the production of seaweed as well.

Esmer is determined that she will do her best in expanding both her sources of income to support the welfare of her children, especially by sending them to get college educations for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 53 years old and married.

Vivian is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Vivian has been farming rice for 16 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Vivian would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jonalee

texts.en:
Jonalee works hard to support her family. Jonalee is married and has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines.

Jonalee requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. She has been in this business for eight years now.

Jonalee would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her manicurist business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. Marivic is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marivic would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, 31, is married and has one child who is in school. For the past ten years she has sold fish to make a living in the Philippines.

Cecilia has applied for a 13,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall. She is saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Gliceria has been raising hogs for more than 20 years now. She is a 58-year-old married woman with seven grown children.

She hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. In addition to hog raising, she also toils the land and grows rice.

She needs additional capital to improve her livelihood. She has requested a loan to buy pig feed and farm supplies like fertilizers. These would enable Gilceria to raise quality hogs and improve the yield of her farm. Thus, she would be able to generate higher income and settle her obligations.

She dreams of having better living conditions by managing both her sources of income properly.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and farm supplies like fertilizers

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like bread, biscuits, candies, powdered soap, coffee, sugar, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, soft drinks and seasonings.

She is a 44-year-old married woman with no dependents. She has been running a sari-sari(variety store) for four years now. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to purchase groceries, soft drinks and liquor. These supplies will fill the content of her store. It will attract more buyers to come. Thus, she will be able to roll out her capital and balance her finances.

Mary Ann is hoping that she will be successful in handling her business to have a sustainable living in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, soft drinks and liquor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 59 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard \working entrepreneur.

Editha has a general store business in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, beer, sanitary pads, toothpaste, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Editha has been in this business for eight years. Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, beer, sanitary pads, toothpaste, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Richita

texts.en:
Ma. Richita is 44 years old and has three children. Ma. Richita is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Ma. Richita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ma. Richita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Richita has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Ma. Richita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jeanalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jeanalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Jeanalyn is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs for her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jeanalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, salt, noodles, etc. for her food production business.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, salt, and noodles for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rosana has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosana has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Teofila requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Teofila has been in this business for 40 years now.

Teofila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is married to a fisherman. They are blessed with three children. Her oldest child is 18 and the youngest is 11. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods including noodles, edible oil, sugar, seasonings, toothpaste, eggs, gasoline and soft drinks.

For almost six years now, Mercedita has been engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store for her livelihood.

She has requested a loan to buy supplies like soft drinks, gasoline and batteries (used for fishing). These are essential tools for augmenting her sources of income. She could display a variety of items and also improve her husband's catch. Thus, she could now start to expand and afford to buy nutritious meals for her growing children.

She hopes that both of these livelihoods will help alleviate their status of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies like soft drinks, gasoline and batteries (used for fishing).

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling purchase order cards in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell for her business selling purchase order cards.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from buying and selling ready to wear and raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is 50 years old and married with five children. With three children still in school, Restituta works very hard to provide for them.

Restituta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, candies, toothpaste, etc., to sell.

Restituta has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, candies, toothpaste, etc.

In the future, Restituta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, candies, toothpaste, etc,. to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlinda is 58 years old and has two children who are in school.

Erlinda has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

Erlinda has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Antonia works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruit. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her coconut farming business.

Antonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 52 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 63 years old and married with six children.

Juanita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase piglets, feed, vitamins and vaccines for her business.

Juanita has been in pig fattening for nine years now and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Juanita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, vitamins and vaccines for her business.

loans.name: Florance

texts.fr: Florance est une veuve femme âgée de 50 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Avec deux enfants à charge, Florance est une marchande de friperies qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Florance demande ce crédit pour commander des habits de friperies. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Florance pourra bien prendre soin de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Florance is a 50-year-old widow living in Adidogomé with two children under her care. She is a merchant of used clothes and resupplies twice a month at the market.

Florance is requesting this loan to order used clothes. With the resulting profit margins she will be able to take good care of her children.

loans.use: buy 200 units of used clothes

loans.name: Graciela Octavia

texts.es:
Graciela es una mujer de 48 años de edad, divorciada, tiene una hija de 28 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es independiente, constante y muy dedicada. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘buenos aires’ área caracterizada por el comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas. 
Graciela es morena de baja estura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su hija que trabaja y es independiente, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida como hamburguesas y salchipapas (salchichas y papas fritas), “me dedico a este negocio desde 20 años y hace 10 años que tengo mi opuesto de venta propio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que queda a media cuadra de su casa, la desventaja es que se queda a vender hasta altas horas de la noche. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea realizar la refacción de su kiosco ya que por el tiempo y las lluvias este se encuentra corroído y desgastado. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Graciela solicita un préstamo para pagar la refacción de su kiosco y continuar con su negocio de comida rápida.
texts.en:
Graciela is a 48 year old woman. She is divorced and has a 28 year old daughter. Her business is selling fast food. She is independent, tenacious and very dedicated. Her business is located in the "Buenos Aires" area, characterized for its business and manufacturing everywhere.

Graciela is dark skinned, has a short stature and robust physique. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her daughter who is independent and works. They live in their own home built of bricks and cement, and it has all of the basic services.

Her business is selling fast food like hamburgers and "salchipapas (hot dogs and french fries)".
"I have worked in this business for 20 years, and I have had my own stand for 10 years," she comments. The advantage of her business is that it is only a half of a block from her house. The disadvantage is that she stays at the stall until very late hours of the night.

Her dream is to open a restaurant. She wants to pay for renovation on her stall since, because of the temperature and the rain, it is corroded and worn. This is the 1st loan she has asked for through the institution in the 20 years that she has been doing this work. For those reasons, Graciela is asking for a loan to pay for renovation on her refreshments stand and continue with her fast food business.

loans.use: to pay for renovation on her stall and continue with her fast food business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maria successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is 27 years old and has two children. Arlen is married and both of her children are in school.

Arlen is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Arlen requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Arlen has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Arlen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Sonia requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Sonia has been in this business for seven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Sonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 56 years old and married, and she works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Dolores has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Dolores aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Viviane

texts.fr: Viviane est âgée de 48 ans et est une veuve femme. Viviane vit avec ses deux enfants et à Adidogomé où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Viviane s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et désire commander des bols de maïs afin de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et bien réorganiser son activité.
texts.en:
Viviane is a 48-year-old widow who lives with her two children in Adidogomé. She prepares maize-based porridge for her customers who are satisfied with her activity.

Viviane stocks up once a month at the market. She wants to order bowls of maize so she can generate good profit margins, and thereafter promote her children's education and fully reorganize her business activity.

loans.use: buy 25 bowls of maize

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 49-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jane has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.en:
Inocenta is 62 years old and married with three children.

Inocenta is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Inocenta requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Inocenta has been in pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Inocenta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hairdressing supplies, such as: dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and others.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Florencia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jose Tulio

texts.es:
Tulio, de 45 años de edad, es un agricultor, debido a la falta de recursos económicos no pudo asistir a la escuela, pero aprendió a leer y a escribir por iniciativa propia en clases nocturnas, después de salir de trabajar; actualmente está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar, tienen 2 hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad.

Tulio, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar granos básicos, los primeros cultivos que sembró los perdió por motivos de falta de agua; Tulio, también necesita el préstamo para comprar una refrigeradora y vender productos lácteos en su casa, esta idea fue de su esposa. 

Su principal sueño es tener una buena parcela para sembrar maíz y recuperar lo perdido en la primera cosecha y con las ganancias que obtenga de la cosecha poder comprar una ternera.
texts.en:
Tulio is 45 years old. He is a farmer. Due to the lack of economic funds, he could not go to school, but he learned to read and write on his own accord in night classes after work. He is married and his wife does housework. They have 2 children who are 4 and 10 years old.

Tulio needs the loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides to plant basic grains. The first crops that he planted were lost from lack of water. Tulio also needs the loan to buy a refrigerator and sell dairy products in his house. This was his wife's idea.

His main dream is to have a good plot to plant corn and recuperate what he lost in the first harvest. With the earnings he wants to be able to buy a calf.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Fati est une femme mariée habitant à Adidogomé. Ayant trois enfants à charge, Fati est une revendeuse des serviettes de friperies qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier. Fati désire ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de serviettes en vue d’avoir des gains et contribuer aux charges de la famille en aidant son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
33-year-old Fati is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with three children to care for.
She is a retailer of second-hand towels who resupplies four times a month at the market and resells them going from neighborhood to neighborhood.

Fati is requesting this loan to order dozens of towels so she can generate profits and contribute towards family expenses by helping her husband pay their children's school fees next September.

loans.use: buy four dozen towels.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a banana vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell for her banana vending business.

Sherly has been in this business for 20 years. Sherly earns more income from pig fattening.

Sherly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Horonata

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Honorata works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Honorata is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Honorata has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, and flour for her food production business.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Hello world - meet Dorcas!

She is a smallholder farmer based in Kangutu village, which is in the Central region of Kenya. This 30-year-old farmer started in 2012 with a dairy cow and poultry for milk and eggs. Today, she has also ventured into crop farming, both for sale and for consumption. She sells her produce at Nkubu, which is one of the fastest growing towns in Africa.

Dorcas is seeking a loan to increase her banana farming. Growing bananas does not require much effort, but to achieve high yields requires skills, dedication, and proper planting methods. Dorcas, who has three children, feels she is cut out for it. Firstly she has adequate space, as she has a half-acre farm she owns for this project. She also has 2 employees who are farmers, and they will come in handy to get the banana farm off the ground.

Returns from this investment will enable Dorcas to pay for food, which is her highest monthly expense when she is not servicing a loan.

Dorcas managed to attain a secondary education herself. With your investment, she will make enough income to educate her children and even further her own education, if the stars align.

loans.use: to increase her banana farming

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 39-year-old smallholder farmer who is hungry for success, a person who decided to become an farmer because she wants to change her reality. She aspires to be recognized as a great farmer. She farms a small plot of land in Siongiroi in the Rift valley region of Kenya.

For the past five years, she has been involved in mixed farming; her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, and tomatoes and she also keeps dairy cows. Gladys has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Gladys mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Gladys is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge, hence she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if they are to fetch a high price and through this loan, Gladys is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Gladys feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts.

Support an entrepreneur whose dream is to give an excellent quality of life to her family. This support will not only benefit Gladys, but will also help create full time employment for someone because she intends to employ someone to help with the farm work and ride the motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport her produce to the market.

loans.name: Estrellas Del Gran Poder Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DEL GRAN PODER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Natalia  es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de dulces, venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de refrescos y gelatina, venta de celulares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Natalia es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, quien le ayuda es  su hermano, da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio aprendiendo de su hermana. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la foto aparece también la Sub Gerente del Centro Collpani que es la señora que viste con un chaleco color de rojo.
texts.en:
The "Estrellas del Gran Poder (Stars of Great Power)" loan group will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is composed of 8 members and is led by a board where Natalia is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association have are varied, and between them there is: selling clothing, selling sweets, selling blankets, selling food, selling soft drinks and gelatin, and selling cell phones.

The loan will benefit the small micro businesses where Natalia is a member. She points out that she joined Pro Mujer because a friend who is a customer of the institution invited her. Now she has a business selling clothing. Her brother helps her. It should be known that she started this business learning from her sister.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase earnings, by buying clothing at wholesale pricing which she will get from the venders in the city of El Alto. Afterwards, she will sell it in the fairs in El Alto.

This form of work allows her to get resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has one child. When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the health area that the institution offers.

The Assistant Manager of the Centro Collpani is also in the photo. She is dressed with a red vest.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Antonietta is 44 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Antonietta has a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines. Antonietta requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Antonietta has been in this business for four years. In the future, Antonietta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to set up a store and buy products such as rice, beans, bread and coffee.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 35 years old and married. Fely works very hard to provide for them.

Fely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like snack foods, shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Fely has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, etc.

In the future, Fely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like snack foods, shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 45 ans, Afi habite à Adidogomé et est mère de quatre enfants. Afi se bat énormément dans son commerce de petits poissons fumés pour subvenir  à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Afi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des paniers de petits poissons fumés en vue d’avoir un stock important et gagner plus de bénéfices afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Married and living in Adidogomé, 45-year-old Afi is the mother of four children. She struggles enormously in her small smoked fish trade business to meet her own needs and those of her children.

Afi is requesting this loan to order baskets of small smoked fish so she can have a large stock supply and generate more profits, to support her children's school education and their development.

loans.use: buy five baskets of small smoked fish

loans.name: Mama  Fidèle

texts.fr: Fidèle est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans résidante à Adidogomé. Mère d’un enfant, Fidèle est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires qu’elle revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Fidèle s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des  sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Fidèle compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider Sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
Fidèle is a 30-year-old married woman living in Adidogomé. Mother of one child, she is a retailer of food products she sells by going around the surrounding neighborhoods.

Fidèle resupplies her goods twice a month at the market and is requesting this loan to order bags of rice and cans of culinary oil.

With the resulting profit margins, Fidèle hopes to improve her sales and help her family with its development and education.

loans.use: buy two bags of rice and three cans of culinary oil

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec quatre enfants à charge. Abla est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Abla sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin réaliser des bénéfices et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Abla is a married woman living in Adidogomé with four children. She is a retailer of charcoal who resupplies six times a month at the market and resells in front of her home.

Abla is requesting this loan to finance the order of bags of charcoal, so she can generate profits and support her husband with family expenses, and ensure a good education for their children.

loans.use: buy four bags of charcoal

loans.name: Massa

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Massa est une femme âgée de 37 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Massa est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture domicile. Massa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des des paniers de légumes et de tomates fraîches en vue de stocker une plus grande quantité de marchandises et  maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en:
Married with four children, Massa is a 37-year-old woman living in Adidogomé. She is a retailer of general food products who resupplies twice monthly at the market and resells from her home-based display.

Massa is requesting this loan to order baskets of vegetables and fresh tomatoes, so she can stock a larger quantity of merchandise and maximize profits, to help her husband with the children's education and daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy four baskets of vegetables and seven baskets of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Lovely Group

texts.en:
Lovely Group was started in the year 2015 at Baramunda, Bhubaneswar, of Khurda district, Odisha, India. These are six active, self-dependent women, with an objective of developing their obtainable businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of this group have their own profession and business.

Diptimayee is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and the group members’ employment improvement. She is sitting in the group with a raised hand beside her tailoring machine in the photo. She is about 23 years old and living with her husband; she has no children.

She has been engaged in the tailoring business in her own home in Baramunda for four years. Her husband is also helping her to support the business. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of 6,000 INR. Her opinion is that, from this small income, it is very difficult to maintain her family in an urban area like Bhubaneswar. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So, she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

Diptimayee planned to purchase a tailoring machine and cloth. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the rebuilding of another shop, and to provide better education to her children. The other five members of the group are also smart at their professions and also are actively engaged with different professions like a saree business, a snacks business, and a tailoring business in the same society with this loan. They hope to make their livelihoods better.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and cloth.

loans.name: Iti

texts.en:
Iti is a 39-year-old enterprising lady from Kandi under Murshidabad district in West Bengal. Her husband works as a priest on a daily earning basis. His income is inconsistent and low. Iti also supports her family financially by doing a small job. She has one daughter who is married now.

Now Iti wants to start her own dairy business to provide extra income for running her family smoothly. She wants to sell milk in her neighborhood. There is a huge requirement for cow milk in her area; this is why she has chosen this business. For additional income, she wants to sells milk products and cattle by-products like cow dung to her customers.

To fulfill these plans, she needs to buy a dairy cow for her business. But money is the main problem.

Thus, she is asking for a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner. She feels that this will add some extra profit to her present income and as well as satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a new dairy business.

loans.name: Sadhana

texts.en:
Sadhana, a 48-year-old woman, stays in a small village in Kandi, West Bengal. She is blessed with three children (two sons and a daughter). One of her son is working and the other one is a student for a B.A. (Bachelor of Arts). Her daughter is married. Sadhana is also involved with a small income generating work and her husband is engaged in farming.

As the family income is hardly sufficient to run the family, Sadhana decided to start her dairy business. Being a hardworking woman, she wants to devote her full time to her small milk selling business for additional income. Because of growing expenses, it has become necessary for her to increase her income. So she wants to purchase a dairy cow to start her milk selling business, but due to lack of capital Sadhana seeks a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.

She is very hopeful that this loan will support her to earn extra income and help her to strengthen her family economy. With the increased profit she wants to purchase more farmland. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for starting her milk selling business.

loans.name: Ambreen

texts.en: Ambreen is a responsible housewife, and mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall, her husband sells different types of eatable items e.g samosas, pakoras, chicken roll, Kabab paratha and etc.Ambreen's husband needs to purchase different types of eatables and other items for his business purposee, so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.Therefore Ambreen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's food stall business.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali lives with her family of three members in a small village in Khagbari. She is 42 years old and a housewife. She is blessed with two sons (one is in school while the other is in college).

She and her husband jointly run a small grocery shop from their house and sell the villagers’ daily necessities. This is the only source of income for the family but the income is insufficient to bear their sons’ educational expenses after covering their basic needs.

Anjali’s 20-year-old son, Bikram, is a second-year bachelor in science student in Mathabhanga College. Bikram is well aware that education is the only sure way to improve one’s quality of life, because he has always had a goal of becoming a good teacher. Now he has reached the threshold of completing his graduation and wants to pass with good results in his final exams. He needs the help of private tutors to score good marks, but his parents are unable to afford his educational expenses.

So Anjali is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to pay for her son's college fees, private tutors’ fees, and also to purchase other necessary study materials. She hopes in the long run her son will establish himself as a competent teacher.

Anjali and her son Bikram (standing side by side in the photo)are very much thankful to their generous lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her son's graduation level education.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a 44-year-old lady who lives in Falakata of West Bengal. She is a mother of two daughters and a son. All of her children are studying in different grades in the local village school. Gita and her husband both are illiterate and can sign their names only. But they are willing to provide their children a good education so that their children lead a good life.

Gita’s husband is a rickshaw puller by profession. His earnings are not enough to cover the educational expenses of their children after meeting the household costs for their family.

Gita’s daughter, 18-year-old Pinki, is now studying in grade 9 at Falakata Subhash Girls’ High School. She is a good and hardworking student. She aims to become a nurse in future. Now she needs the help of private tuition to score good marks in her examinations; otherwise she could not proceed further.

Gita learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan for her daughter’s uninterrupted education. With the loan amount, she will pay the private tuition fees and school fees and will buy school uniforms, books and other educational articles for her daughter, Pinki.

Gita and her daughter Pinki (as in the photo) are very much grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan. They give hearty thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: to bear the costs of her daughter’s uninterrupted education.

loans.name: Sefali

texts.en:
Sefali is 26 year old and a mother of two school-going children (a son and a daughter). (Sefali does not know her exact age , so the age mentioned is according to her voter id card). She lives in Falakata with her family. Her first priority in life is to provide good education to her children. Her son reads in grade 9 and her daughter is studying in grade 6. Sefali is a housewife and her husband is engaged in a vegetable business.

Sefali’s son, Dinabandhu, is a student of grade 9. He is 15 years old and reads in Falakata High School. He is an average student, but tries his level best to give his best in examinations.

Sefali is facing difficulty to cover her children's educational expenses. Dinabandhu is sincere about his studies and school curriculum, and if he is provided with proper guidance, he can perform well in his examination. Sefali is unable to take care of all the things he needs to continue his studies.

Thus, as a responsible mother, Sefali applied for an educational loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy education materials and engage a private tutor for her son, Dinabandhu.

Sefali hopes this educational support will give a boost in her son’s education. Sefali and Dinabandhu (as in the picture) are now very happy after getting the loan and thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to bear the educational expenses of her son.

loans.name: Magnificas De Pro Mujer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAGNIFICAS DE PRO MUJER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de zapatos, servicio de transporte. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amalia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por una promoción de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana  hace tres años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, papa y fideo por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto esta compra le ayudará a  comercializar los platos de comida que la señora elabora para posteriormente comercializarlo en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Magnificas de Pro Mujer" communal bank is starting its first loan cycle at Pro Mujer's Alto Lima office. The bank has eight members and is managed by a board of directors that has Amalia as its secretary. The members have different businesses, including those selling meals, blankets, clothes, and shoes, and one offering transport services.

This loan will benefit small-time entrepreneurs in Amalia's group. Amalia herself says that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer and is doing so following a promotion by a representative of the organisation. Amalia currently has a business selling meals. She says that she learned how to do this work from her sister three years ago.

This loan will be used to increase working capital by buying rice, potatoes and pasta in bulk from sellers in the city of El Alto. This purchase will help Amalia to sell meals that she prepares. This work allows Amalia to earn an income to support her family financially. Amalia has a partner and two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Amalia says that she likes the health education offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes and pasta in bulk.

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CRECER” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Daniela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de faldas de cholita, venta de arroz, venta de zapatos, venta de carne, venta de pollo, venta de frutas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Daniela es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió al trabajar como vendedora en una tienda y con los pocos ahorros que tenía decidió emprender este negocio hace un año atrás

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de zapatos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Crecer" communal bank is starting its fifth loan cycle at Pro Mujer's Collpani office. The bank has eight members and is managed by a board of directors that has Daniela as its president. The members have different businesses, including those selling clothes, traditional skirts, rice, meat, chicken, fruits and shoes.

This loan will benefit small-time entrepreneurs in Daniela's group. Daniela herself says that she joined Pro Mujer following an invitation from a friend, also a member of the organisation. Daniela currently has a business selling shoes. She says that she learned this trade working as a saleswoman in a shop. With the few savings she gathered, Daniela decided to start her own business one year ago.

This loan will be used to increase working capital by buying shoes in bulk from sellers in the city of La Paz to sell at her business. This work allows Daniela to earn an income to support her family financially. Daniela has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Daniela says that she likes the training and health education offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona, de 48 años de edad, es muy responsable, debido a la falta de recursos económicos no pudo asistir a una escuela, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a trabajar la agricultura, tiene 5 hijos pero todos tienen sus propios hogares. 

Petrona, desde pequeña se dedicó a elaborar petates y a lavar ropa ajena, de esa manera ha logrado cubrir las necesidades de su familia. 

Petrona, necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de petates y comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar mano de obra para sembrar granos básicos.

Su principal sueño es vender más petates y obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Petrona is 48 years old and very responsible. Owing to a lack of money, she could not go to school as a child. Petrona has a partner, a farmer; the couple has five children but all now have their own homes.

Since a young age, Petrona has made a living producing grass mats and washing clothes. This has allowed her to cover family necessities.

Petrona needs this loan in order to buy basic materials for producing mats and farming supplies, and to pay labourers to sow basic grains.

Petrona's big dream is to sell more grass mats and to have a better harvest.

loans.use: to buy basic materials for producing mats and farming supplies, and to pay labourers to sow basic grains.

loans.name: Hamidah

texts.en: Hamidah is married with three children and all attending school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for some years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She works seven days a week.  She would like to get more capital so as to increase her stock so as to attract more customers. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married mother of five children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling fresh fish and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy fresh fish. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and perishability of fish and ever increasing tax. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Shamila

texts.en: Shamila is married with four children and all go to school.  She takes care of additional family members. She operates a grocery shop at the market and has been in this business for many years.  She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy sugar,boxes of soap,rice,cooking oil,beans and flour. She works six days a week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She would like to buy a fridge to start selling cold drinks. She resides in a rented house and family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, boxes of soap, rice, cooking oil, beans and flour.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 46 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and seven children, some of them are still attending school. Her husband is the main income source and as per her she is a housewife taking care of her house and family. Today, she is in need for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children study fees. In the future, she is planning to take more loan to ensure a great educational path for them to be able to work at a proper company to gain good experience in the field.

loans.use: to pay her children study fees.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is 30 yrs old, single and he runs a business of buying and selling livestock.  He has  been in this business for four years.  His monthly income is ksh 15,000.  He is taking a loan from Visionfund of ksh30,000 to buy cows for sale. He anticipates the profit will repay the loan.  It is his first loan and he dreams in the future to expand his business and get married and have children

loans.use: to  buy cows.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: Alpha  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rika Village. Alpha  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Alpha  suffered from poor yields that crippled hisability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Alpha  has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 120 bags of maize this year, Alpha  can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Hawah

texts.en:
Hawah is a divorced mother of ten children. She also takes care of additional family members . She makes crafts of baskets, mats and has been for several years from home. she has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy materials for making crafts. She works seven days a week .

Her major business challenges include seasonality of materials for making crafts. She is aspiring of buying land to start farming . She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent,food, and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy materials for making crafts.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is a single mother of three children and two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members . She operates a food stall at the market on retail basis and has been for 20 years she has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy fresh beans, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, mangoes. She generates additional from selling used clothes. She works seven days a week .

Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to build rental houses. She resides in the family and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy fresh beans, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, mangoes .

loans.name: Sanyu

texts.en: Sanyu is a single mother of one child. She also takes care of additional family members . She has a beauty salon and has been for 4 years. she has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy weaves, braids, relaxers, shampoo . She generates additional income from selling used clothes. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She would like to buy another dryer and a fridge so as to start selling cold drinks. She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids, relaxers, shampoo.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married with two children and all go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. She operates a boutique at the market on retail basis and has been in this business for seven years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include the seasonality of clothes. She has applied for a loan of from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She aspires to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Hazati

texts.en:
Hazati is widowed with three children and two go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She moves door to door selling used clothes and sells on retail basis six days a week.

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of owning a permanent business premise and also to buy plot of land. She resides in a rented house and family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian is a single mother of three children and two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members . She is a poultry farmer.
