She has been for 6 years . she has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy poultry feeds,vaccines and pay for transporting. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works from home seven days a week and sells of retail basis only. Her major business challenges include poultry diseases which affect quality of chicken. She would like to build more rooms to expand poultry farming. She resides in the family and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees, and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds, vaccines and pay for transporting.

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and three go to school. She sales charcoal at the market. She has been in this business for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She gets additional income from rental houses.

Her major challenge include high transportation costs. Her dream is to build more rental houses. She resides in her own house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children who all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for the last five years. she works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy pineapples, watermelon, oranges, tomatoes,mangoes, and green bananas. She major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, watermelon, oranges, tomatoes,mangoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a single mother of four children and two go to school. She also takes care of additional family members . She operates a food stall at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for for 2 years. she has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy cassava,tomatoes,onions,carrots, and sweet potatoes.  She works seven days a week and sells of retail basis only. Her major business challenges include perishability of food and seasonality. She is aspiring of getting more capital to buy more stock for her stall. She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy cassava, tomatoes, onions, carrots and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a single mother of five children. None of them go to school. She sales charcoal on a retail basis, and has been in this business for 11 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shilling from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She works from home seven days a week. She generates additional income from rental houses. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to buy land for farming.  She resides in the family house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying utility bills, and food .

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with seven children and four of whom go to school. She has additional family members. She sales used clothes and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She moves door to door selling clothes six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

She is aspiring of owning a permanent business premise and also to buy plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent,food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is widowed with seven children and four of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells used clothes and has been in this business for 3 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She moves door to door selling used clothes and sells on retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

She is aspiring of owning a permanent business premise and also to buy plot of land . She resides in a rented house and family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is married and has four children and three go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on retail basis and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, Irish potatoes, beef,peas, and fresh beans. She works seven days a week and sells on retail basis only.

Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She would like to buy more serving utensils. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, Irish potatoes, beef, peas for her restaurant

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en: Faridah is widowed with seven children and four of whom go to school.  She takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used shoes and has been in this business for many years.  She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes.  She moves door to door selling used shoes and sells on retail basis six days a week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality of used shoes.  She is aspiring of  buying a plot of land . She resides in a rented house and family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used shoes.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a single mother of three children and all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members . She sales charcoal from home and has been for 3 years she has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from poultry farming. She works from home seven days a week and sells of retail basis only.

Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of owing a delivery van to ease transportation. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Easter is married with one child. She takes care of additional family members.She operates a bar in a shop that she rents.  She has been in this business for six years on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy crates of beer, spirits, boxes of mineral water, and soda.
Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to buy a plot of land and build residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, beer and bottles of spirits.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 19 year old single woman from Lebanon living with her mother who represents the main income source in the family, and she works very hardly to always being able to fulfill the family needs and to live in a good lifestyle.

In order to pay her university fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. she said that her target is to achieve a higher position and being able to support her mother financially

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is married with three children and two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members . She operates a kiosk and has been for 4 years she has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy packets of sweets, biscuits, sugar, cooking oil, toilet paper. She works seven days a week and sells of retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of owing a delivery van to easy transportation. She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees,food, and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy packets of sweets, biscuts, sugar, cooking oil, toilet paper.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en: Safiya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gidan Village. Safiya joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of her family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, she  no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed her family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Safiya will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Safiya has set high goals of harvesting 19 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Safiya has made it her ultimate goal to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente, de 32 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, es albañil, trabaja a 5 kilómetros de su casa y en su tiempo libre se dedica al trabajo de campo, ya que este fue fomentado a traves de sus padres desde que era un niño y es así como él ayudaba a sus padres en las tareas agrícolas; actualmente está acompañado y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales solo tres viven en la casa con él y los demás ya tienen sus propias familias. 
 
Vicente, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y otros productos agroquímicos que se necesitan para dicha labor y para pagar mano de obra para sembrar.

Vicente, sueña con que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Vicente is 32 years old. He is a very hard-working person. He is a builder and works 5 kilometers from his house. In his free time he works in the fields, as this was encouraged by his parents from when he was a child. This was how he used to help his parents with the agricultural tasks.

He is now married and has 5 children. Three of them live in the house with him and the others have their own families.

Vicente needs the loan to buy fertilizers and other agrochemical products that he needs for the job, and to pay labor for planting. Vicente dreams of his children studying and being professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other agrochemical products that he needs for the job, and to pay labor for planting.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rika Village. Grace  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children.  In the past, Grace  suffered from poor yields that crippled herability to pay for her children's school fees. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Grace  has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 100 bags of maize this year, Grace  can now ensure that her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields.

loans.name: Mallku Irpiri Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MALLKU IRPIRI” iniciará el décimo octavo  ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de revistas de manualidades, venta de comida, venta de carne de res, venta de medias, venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de pasteles, venta de ropa, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rina es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de revistas de manualidades; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió  por iniciativa propia hace cuarenta y tres años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de revistas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Bolivia Perú para posteriormente comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la foto no aparece la señora Veneranda porque, después del desembolso, se fue a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The "Mallku Irpiri" loan group will begin its 18th cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal of Santiago II. It is composed of ten members and is directed by a board where Rina is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association have are varied, and between them there is: selling craft magazines, selling food, selling beef, and selling blankets.

The loan that they are asking for will benefit the small micro businesses where Rina is a member. She points out that she joined Pro Mujer from a friend's invitation who is a customer of the institution.

Currently, she has a business selling craft magazines. She learned this business on her own initiative 43 years ago. The loan she will take out is to increase earnings by buying magazines at wholesale price. She will get them from the wholesale vendors on the Bolivia-Peru border and later sell them in her stall.

This way of working allows her to get resources to support her family economically, since she is married with four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health area and the trainings that are offered.

Veneranda is not in the photo because, after the disbursement, she went to her stall.

loans.use: to buy magazines at wholesale price.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec un enfant à charge. Agée de 41 ans, Akossiwa est une revendeuse des spaghettis qui s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des cartons de spaghettis, Akossiwa demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat en vue des gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir faire face à ses besoins quotidiens et celui de toute la famille en particulier.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with one child under her care. 41-year-old Akossiwa earns a living through selling spaghetti, which she purchases six times per month from market then resells on the street in the local area. In order to purchase cartons of spaghetti, Akossiwa is requesting this loan so she can make her purchase. By doing this, she will be able to earn a profit, thereby meeting her daily needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase eight packs of spaghetti

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de cinq enfants, Kossiwa est une femme âgée de 65 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Kossiwa est une marchande de produits d’alimentations générales qui achète ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile dans sa propre boutique. Kossiwa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz et des spaghettis afin d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit en vue d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en: Kossiwa is a 65-year-old widowed mother to five children who lives in Adidiogomé. She earns a living through selling general foodstuffs which she purchases three times per month from market then sells out of her own home through her store. Kossiwa is requesting this loan to purchase bags of rice and spaghetti so she can have a large stock at her disposal and thereby maximise her profits. By doing this, she will be able to assist her children with their educations and see to their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of rice and six packs of spaghetti

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans, Ami est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé. Avec un enfant à charge, Ami est une femme dynamique qui se bat pour l’épanouissement de son enfant en préparant de la bouillie accompagné des beignets et vend aussi des fruits. Ami sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs, des sacs de farine de blé et des paniers d’oranges. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Ami répondra favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider son enfant dans son éducation.
texts.en:
29-year-old Ami is a married woman with one child living under her care who lives in Adidiogomé. She is a dynamic woman who fights for her child to have the best start in life by cooking and selling porridge, along with fritters and also fruit.

Ami is requesting this loan so she can purchase bowls of maize, bags of wheat flour and baskets of oranges. With the resulting profits, Ami will be able to meet her customers' needs and will have considerable financial autonomy. She will then be able to help pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase 120 bowls of maize, six bags of wheat flour and four baskets of oranges

loans.name: Maria Doris

texts.es:
María, de 45 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, no pudo asistir a la escuela únicamente aprendió a leer y escribir por esfuerzo propio.

María, aprendió a hacer pan y tamales artesanalmente en su casa, ella hace estos productos desde hace 5 años, en esta labor se involucra su hija en sus días libres.

María, necesita el préstamo para la construcción de otro horno para la elaboración de pan, porque tiene mucha demanda.

Su mayor sueño es poder construir su horno y cubrir la demanda y administrar sus ganancias para invertirlo en la misma labor productiva; pero además sueña con hacer una panadería.
texts.en:
María, 45 years old, takes care of the household tasks. She couldn't go to school and only learned to read and write by her own efforts.

María learned to make bread and tamales traditionally in her house. She has made these products for 5 years, her daughter is involved in this work on her days off.

María needs the loan to build another oven to make bread because she has a lot of demand.

Her greatest dream is to be able to build her oven and meet the demand and manage her earnings to invest it in the same productive work, but in addition she dreams of having a bakery.

loans.use: to build another oven to make bread.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married and has seven children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for five years. She works from home and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis seven days a week. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler.

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 están en la escuela y él otro no asiste porque está pequeño aún.

María, es una persona  muy  trabajadora y se dedica a la elaboración de petates desde hace más de 20 años, esta labor es la que le permite generar ingresos para el sustento familiar; ella elabora este tipo de productos artesanales desde que vivía  con su padre, ahora sus hijos se involucran y le facilitan el trabajo a ella. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima (tule) para la elaboración de petates, actualmente se quedaron sin materia prima para elaborarlos y esta es la única fuente de ingresos económicos que tiene como familia.

Uno de sus mayores sueños es poder ver a sus hijos como profesionales y brindarles mejores condiciones para vivir.
texts.en:
María, 37 years old, is a single mother and has 4 children, of whom 3 are in school and the other doesn't go because he is still little.

María is a very hard-working person and has worked making sleeping mats for over 20 years. This work allows her to generate income to support her family. She has made this type of traditional product since she lived with her father. Now, her children are involved and help her with the work.

María needs the loan to purchase raw material (tule reeds) to make sleeping mats. At the moment she is without raw materials to make them and this is the only source of income that they have as a family.

One of her greatest dreams is to be able to see her children as professionals and offer them better life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials (tule reeds) to make sleeping mats.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a single mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She is aspiring is to educate her children to university level. She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

She has a business of selling used shoes and has been doing this for two years. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She generates additional income from rental rooms.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used shoes.

loans.name: Melvin Roney

texts.es: Melvin, tiene 40 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Barbara. El anteriormente se dedicaba a laborar para una empresa privada como guardia de seguridad. Hace un año aproximadamente decidió colocar su propio negocio con la venta de mercadería  y cosméticos. Realizando este trabajo de manera ambulante como también en su casa. Los productos que ofrece son: camisetas, cremas, shorts, blusas, calcetas y cosméticos. Melvin ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 11,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de producto como camisetas, pantalones, blusas, short,  calcetas, desodorantes, lociones y otros cosméticos para surtir su negocio y mejorar las ventas. Su meta es sacar adelante a su familia, darles una buena educación y mejorar el negocio ya establecido.
texts.en: Melvin, 40 years old, is married, has two children, and lives in the municipality of Quimistán, Santa Barbara. Previously, he worked in a private business as a security guard. Approximately a year ago, he decided to establish his own business selling merchandise and cosmetics, doing this work as a street vendor and also in his house. The products that he sells are: shirts, creams, shorts, blouses, socks, and cosmetics. Melvin has decided to ask for a loan of 11,000 lempiras to invest it in the purchase of products such as shirts, pants, blouses, shorts, socks, deodorants, lotions, and other cosmetics to stock his business and improve his sales. His goal is to get his family ahead, give them a good education and improve his established business.

loans.use: to purchase products such as shirts, pants, blouses, shorts, socks, deodorants, lotions, and other cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works seven days a week. She is aspiring to see her business expand.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Elizabeth De Santiago Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ELIZABETH DE SANTIAGO II” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rebeca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, tienda de barrio, salón de belleza, pastelería, venta de zapatos, venta de cotillones (artículos para fiestas de cumpleaños).  

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rebeca es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pasteles y jugos de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó hace ocho años y lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, la señora cuenta que al principio fue un reto pero ahora ya se encuentra con un negocio ya consolidado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de un nuevo horno, que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar la producción en la elaboración de pasteles ´para posteriormente comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la foto no aparecen la señora Judith ya que, después del desembolso, tuvo que irse a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The Elizabeth de Santiago II loan group will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is made up of nine members and is led by officers of whom Rebeca is the president. The businesses that the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are: food sales, grocery sales, a neighborhood store, a beauty salon, a pastry shop, shoe sales, and party favor sales (items for birthday parties).

The loan that they will be getting will benefit the micro-business owners of whom Rebeca is one. She says that three years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling pastries and fruit juices. She says that she established this business eight years ago and she learned it through her own initiative She says that at first it was a challenge but that now she has a strong business.

The loan that she now will take out will be to purchase a new oven, which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto. This purchase will help her to improve her production in making pastries to later sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is in a common-law marriage and has two children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training and the health center that the institution offers.

Judith isn't in the photo since, after the payment, she had to go to her sales stall.

loans.use: to purchase an oven.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen is married and has three children who all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for five years. She sells her clothes by moving door to door. She works six days a week. She is aspiring to get business premises.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is single and has two children who both go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for five years. She sells African attire so as to acquire additional income. She moves door to door selling used clothes and sells on retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality of used clothes. She is aspiring to own a permanent business premise.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is married and has four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

She operates a food stall and has been in this business for six years. She works seven days a week. Her major challenges include transportation costs from villages to the market.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes, cabbages, onions, mangoes and cassava.

She is aspiring to build a residential house.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbages, onions, mangoes and cassava.

loans.name: Maria Marcos

texts.es:
María, de 57 años de edad, está soltera, tiene 4 hijos, con ella vive una nuera, solo su hijo más pequeño estudia, del cual los gastos del estudio dependen de los ingresos de ella.

María, es una persona  muy  trabajadora y se dedica  a la elaboración de petates, este trabajo ha sido fomentado por sus padres como una cultura, ya que junto a esta actividad también crían cerdos, los cuales los alimenta para venderlos, en esa actividad se involucran todos los miembros que viven dentro de su casa. 

María, necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de petates y para comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para sembrar granos básicos.

Ella sueña con tener una plantación de tule (la materia prima para elaborar petates) y mantener una excelente producción, para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old. She is single and has 4 children. One of her daughters-in-law lives with her and only one of her smaller children is still in school. His school expenses depend on María's income. María is a very hard-working person and she works making mats. This job has been encouraged by her parents as a culture, because along with this job they also raise pigs. They feed them and then sell them. There are a lot of members who live in her house that are involved in this work.

María needs the loan money to buy raw material to make mats, and to buy fertilizers and pay labor for planting basic grains. She dreams of having a tule (the raw material for making mats) plantation and to maintain an excellent production to get a better income.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make mats, and to buy fertilizers and pay labor for planting basic grains.

loans.name: Petenera

texts.en:
Petenera is a single mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and utility bills.

She sells fruits and vegetables and has been doing this for two years. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works seven days a week and sells of retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to grow fruits so as to expand her income.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy mangoes, oranges, pineapples, tomatoes, eggplants and onions.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, oranges, pineapples, tomatoes, eggplants and onions.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a single mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and utility bills.

She operates a restaurant on a retail basis and has been doing this for five years. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy beans, green bananas, cassava, flour and ground nuts.

She is aspiring to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy beans, green bananas, cassava, flour and ground nuts.

loans.name: Sumayiya

texts.en:
Sumayiya is a single mother of four children and all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in her own house with no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

She operates a retail shop selling mattresses. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more mattresses. She is aspiring of getting more capital from MCDT SACCO so as to stock mattresses.

loans.use: to buy mattresses.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is a single mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

She sells used shoes at the market on a retail basis and has been doing this for 10 years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality of used shoes. She is aspiring to expand her business to serve as many customers as possible.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Uganda. She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school.

Eva operates a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 18 years. She works 7 days a week. She sells her products in a shop on a retail basis.

She has requested a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, beans, flour and boxes of soap.

Major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level.

She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, beans and flour.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, both of whom go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (her sisters). She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

She sells second-hand clothes door-to-door on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes.

Her major business challenge is the seasonality of clothes. Her goal and aspiration is to start importing second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children; three are attending school. She has no additional family members.

She has operated a retail shop in a rented premise for the last 10 years, working seven days a week.

She has applied for a loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy rice, flour, sugar, soap, cartons of salt, beans and crates of soda.

Her main challenges include seasonality and transportation.

Her future goal is to buy a bigger fridge to serve her customers better.

She lives in rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, soap, cartons of salt, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her four sons are students. Her husband has been running his own business selling garments for 15 years; her husband is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Her husband needs to purchase different types garments and accessories for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase this merchandise.

Therefore Samina is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing this merchandise for his business.

Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn a maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's garment business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 40-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three sons and one daughter. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 17 years. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothing in bulk for the purpose of reselling, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Naseem is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With this loan, she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.
 
Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en: Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda, is married with six children, and all her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a retail shop. She has been in this business for the last 22 years and works seven days a week. She gets additional income from poultry farming. She has requested a loan of 1,600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of sugar, rice, cooking oil, beans, peas, and flour. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses include school fees, utilities, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, rice, cooking oil, beans, peas, and flour.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 38 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Carmelita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like tempura, cooking oil, sugar, vinegar, etc. for her food vending business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 5 years. Carmelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like tempura, cooking oil, sugar, vinegar, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita, 45, is a married woman with six children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mercidita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Mercidita has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Mercidita would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 33 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling meat.

Nena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. 

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 55 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Felicitas has a food vending business in the Philippines. Felicitas requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, etc. for her food production business.

Felicitas has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Felicitas would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a responsible mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing vehicle mechanic services for 14 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to buy tools, machinery and other items for business purposes. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise. Therefore Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Razia's husband can purchase the items easily and provide better services to customers to earn a profitable income. Razia  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Razia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vehicle mechanic business.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is 42 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is a responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly and because of this, her husband is unable to generate any income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible however, due to the lack of money; her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. 

Hameeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Hameeda is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his rickshaw

loans.name: Zohran

texts.en:
Zohran is a responsible mother of 4 children.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing mechanic services for 22 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to purchase tools, machinery and other items for business purposes. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to buy these items. 

Zohran has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Zohran's husband can purchase these items easily.  He will be able to provide better mechanic facilities to the customer and earn a profitable income. Zohran also plans to make savings with the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future. Zohran is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vehicle mechanic business

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira, de 71 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, que ha sacado a sus hijos adelante a pesar de ser viuda, porque su esposo falleció hace 10 años; ella estudio hasta tercer grado y actualmente vive con un nieto, su esposa y un bisnieto.

Edelmira, vende ropa y artículos plásticos como platos, vasos y tasas, de los cuales la mayoría de la venta la realiza casa por casa, en los cantones más cercanos, tiene más de 20 años de tener el negocio y ya tiene muchos clientes.  
  
El préstamo que está solicitando será invertido para comprar más mercadería para el negocio (ropa), porque tuvo problemas de salud y gasto parte de las ganancias en medicinas.

Edelmira, sueña con seguir trabajando de la misma manera.
texts.en:
Edelmira is a 71-year-old hardworking woman who has provided for her children despite being a widow after her husband passed away 10 years ago. She studied up to the third grade and currently lives her grandson, his wife, and their son.

Edelmira, sells clothes and plastic goos like plates, cups, and bowls. She sells most of these items door-to-door in the nearest districts. She has run this business for 20 years and has many clients.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise for her (clothing) business because she had health problems and used part of her earnings on medicine.

Edelmira dreams of continuing to work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her (clothing) business.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, una zona alejada de la capital del país, ellas son mujeres muy luchadoras y sacrificadas.
La Sra. Gladys es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos,  vende calzados, prendas, artículos de bazar y otros, y de esa manera se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Gladys a través de su sacrificio está ayudando a las personas que ella quiere y por quienes lucha.
Pide este préstamo para comprar calzados y prendas variadas, y también venta de artículos de bazar, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus esfuerzos como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida y mejorar su pequeño emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group San Miguel is in its first cycle of the committee of women program. It is in the city of Curuguaty, a remote area of the capital of the country. They are very fighting and sacrificing women.

Ms. Gladys is one of the members who makes a living in the peddling of all types of products. She sells footwear, clothing, bazaar items and others. In this way she makes a living in a dignified and honest way. Through her sacrifice she is helping people that she wants to and for those who struggle.

She is requesting this loan to buy shoes and various clothing, and also sell bazaar items. In this way she is able to continue with her efforts as she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to be someone in life and improve her small enterprise.

loans.use: to buy shoes, various clothing and bazaar items.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Niño Jesus está integrado por 15 integrantes, están en su 2do. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lilian quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos y calzados varios, comenta que por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder sacar adelante a sus seres queridos, ella es una persona muy sacrificada que pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar zapatos y calzados varios, de manera a poder seguir luchando y creciendo para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The Nino Jesus (Baby Jesus) group is comprised of 15 members who are in the second cycle of their Women's Committee program in which everyone works together to get ahead. They are working on a campaign to end poverty in which each one puts forth her best effort to improve her living conditions.

One of the members is Mrs. Liliana, who makes her living selling shoes and a variety of other footwear. She says that through her work she has the means to take care of her loved ones. She is a person who is willing to make sacrifices and who makes every effort to grow and improve herself every day. She is requesting this loan to buy shoes and a variety of footwear so she can keep striving and growing in order to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and a variety of footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy natural remedies for sale.

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Narek is from Aghitu village where he lives with his parents and three brothers. His elder twin brothers are army officers. Narek, together with his little brother and father has been running a farm.
They keep a livestock of three cows, calves, pigs, piglets and some hens. On the family owned land, Narek and his family also cultivate wheat and potato,as well as grow walnut, apple and pear trees. Narek asks this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. Agricultural income is very important for the family's living, and Narek wants to sustain it.

As this is Narek's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

The loan will greatly assist Narek to continue his farming business. He hopes that Kiva lenders will give him an opportunity to gather more income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Santos Milagro

texts.es:
Santos, de 35 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a una escuela, pero aprendió a leer y a escribir por medio de educación a adultos, está acompañada y vive junto a su compañero de vida, quien trabaja en la frontera, una hija y su nieta.   

Santos, vende enchiladas, yuca frita y otros productos de comida típica, este negocio lo tiene desde hace más de 12 años, aprendió de pequeña a hacer los distintos productos típicos, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y en el negocio le ayuda su hija.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar yuca, harina, sal, repollo y otros ingredientes para los alimentos que vende, ella está solicitando el crédito porque se aproxima un torneo de futbol en su comunidad y carece de capital para la compra de la mercadería. 

Santos, desea seguir trabajando de la misma manera y que su negocio vaya mejorando día con día.
texts.en:
Santos is a 35-year-old hardworking woman. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school, but she learned how to read and write through adult education programs. She lives with her life partner, who works on the border, her daughter, and her granddaughter.

Santos sells enchiladas, fried yuca and other typical foods. She has had this business for more than 12 years. When she was a little girl, she learned how to make different typical foods. She runs the business out of her home and is assisted by her daughter.

The loan will be used to buy yuca, flour, salt, cabbage, and other ingredients for the food products she sells. She is requesting this loan because a soccer tournament is approaching in her community and she lacks the capital to buy merchandise.

Santos hopes to continue working as she has been so far and that her business improves every day.

loans.use: to buy yuca, flour, salt, cabbage, and other ingredients for the food products she sells.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras 2 está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas se encuentran dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde se destaca la Sra. Francisca quien solicita de este préstamo para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, panificados, verduras, y otros, para surtir su despensa, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
Cabe destacar que la Sra. Francisca es una mujer muy luchadora que pone todo de sí para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y evitar que sus seres queridos pasen por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
texts.en:
The group named Mujeres Luchadores 2 is in its seventh cycle of the committee of women program. They are in the elimination of poverty program where Francisca stands. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of drinks, food, bread, vegetables and others to fill her pantry. This will help her to refine her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

Notably, Ms. Francisca is a fighting woman who puts all of herself to be able to give her loved ones all that she was not able to have, and prevent her loved ones going through needs like those she went through.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food, bread, vegetables, and others.

loans.name: Taele

texts.en: Taele is a 46 year old mother with 7 children and she runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Taele requested for a loan to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2006.

loans.use: to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank,

loans.name: Tinoai

texts.en: Tinoai is 44 years old with 6 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. She hopes to expand her business, but in order to do this, Tinoai has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, banana tube, taro roots, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, chainsaw, and backpack sprayer to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, banana tube, taro roots, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, chainsaw, and backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es una persona muy trabajadora, que pese a la corta edad que tiene, esta esforzándose para poder tener una mejor condición de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en comprar sabanas e hilos para seguir con su trabajo.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar hilos, telas, gomas y otros, para poder seguir con su trabajo y luchando por poder crecer y mejorar en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Diana is a hardworking person who in spite of her young age keeps making an effort to improve hers and her family’s living conditions.

She comments that she used the previous loan to buy sheets and threads to continue with her work.

Now she is asking another loan to buy threads, fabrics, rubbers and other products to continue with her activities, and also to keep fighting to grow and improve in her undertaking.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabrics, rubber and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a single mother of three children and two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a beauty salon and has been for 2 years she has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers, and treatments. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works seven days a week and sells of retail basis only.

Her major business challenges include seasonality and power shortages . She would like to expand her salon and be able to provide bridal services. She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers and treatments.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Sra. Graciela es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está casada, tiene una despensa y carnicería bien equipada y con buena infraestructura, además con clientela formada, que con sacrificio ha logrado mejorar. La Sra. Graciela comenta que en sus comienzos solo vendía verduras y algunos productos para consumo familiar y luego con las ganancias iba creciendo y mejorando.
Su mayor deseo es ir ampliando su negocio y poder convertirse en un autoservice. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos variados para poder surtir su despensa, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Graciela is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She is married and has a well-equipped store and butcher's shop with good infrastructure and customers that, with sacrifice, she has managed to improve. Graciela says that when she started she sold only vegetables and some family consumable products and then her income began to grow and improve.

Her great dream is to expand her business and to be able to become self-service. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy varied products so she can stock her store and thus continue her sales like always.

loans.use: to buy various products to stock her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas es un grupo nuevo formado con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar su vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia quien tiene un Kiosko, donde vende insumos de primera necesidad como Azúcar, harina, sal, fideos, arroz y bebidas heladas, es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora que pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Sonia Solicita  este préstamo para la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo, bebidas gaseosas, con su esfuerzo de todos los días logrará mejorar la calidad de  vida de toda su familia. En la foto del grupo aparecen 17 mujeres ya que el grupo tiene 17 integrantes, pero solo 16 piden de este prestamo.
texts.en:
The group named Mujeres Unidas is a new group formed with the union of various neighbors from the city of Coronel Oviedo. They are putting their greatest efforts to be able to improve their lives and those of their loved ones.

One of the members is Ms. Sonia who has a kiosk where she sells basic necessities such as sugar, flour, salt, noodles, rice and frozen drinks. She is a sacrificing and fighting woman who puts her greatest effort to be able to give her loved ones all that she was not able to have. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to grow and succeed.

Ms. Sonia is requesting this loan to buy sugar, rice, noodles, and soft drinks. With her effort every day she is able to improve the quality of life for her family. In the group photo there are 17 women as the group has 17 members, but only 16 are requesting this loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, noodles, soft drinks and others.

loans.name: Nuriat

texts.en: Nuriat is a single mother of three children and two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members . She operates a food stall and has been for 8 years . she has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas,sweet potatoes, and cassava.  She works from home seven days a week and sells of retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She would like to buy a plot of land in future. She resides in the family and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas,sweet potatoes, and cassava

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 51 years old, married with three children.

Alejandra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Alejandra has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Alejandra aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru:
Гульнаре 50 лет, она замужем. У нее среднее образование, Гульнара очень доброжелательная, ответственная, целеустремленная женщина. На сегодняшний день она не работает, однако имеет большой опыт в ведении предпринимательской деятельности - более 10 лет Гульнара вместе с супругом у себя на родине вели столовую, были наработаны постоянные посетители, имели хорошую прибыль. Однако, во время событий 2011 года, Гульнаре и ее семье пришлось закрыть бизнес и переехать в город Бишкек. На родине остались родственники и собственный дом.
После перерыва Гульнара решила вновь заняться предпринимательством. Она узнала, что в Банке "Бай-Тушум" есть возможность получить льготный кредит на Стартовый бизнес. Гульнара прослушала курс по финансовой грамотности, произвела расчеты и оценку своего будущего бизнеса. Также Гульнара уже приобрела полки для магазина, она посмотрела объявления и узнала примерную стоимость контейнера, нашла место недалеко от дома, где и откроет магазин. Сделав расчеты, Гульнара пришла к выводу, что ей необходим кредит в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), на запрошенную сумму она приобретет контейнер. Гульнара давно мечтала открыть собственное дело, поэтому делала сбережения, на собственные накопленные средства купит холодильники, весы, продукты питания для реализации. 
На сегодняшний день совокупные семейные доходы Гульнары и ее семьи - около 8,600 сом (KGS), это пенсия супруга и заработная плата сына. К слову, сын Гульнары - большой молодец, он учится в университете, дополнительно работает в поликлинике, получая заработную плату в размере 5,000 сом (KGS). Помогает как может материально и по хозяйству, доходы небольшие, да и Гульнаре хочется быть независимой и наоборот самой помогать сыну. Поэтому Гульнара и решила начать свое дело. По ее прогнозам, среднемесячная чистая прибыль от торговли составит 9,600 сом (KGS), за вычетом расходов по кредиту, это хороший доход в дополнение к имеющимся.
Будущая прибыль от бизнеса и увеличение активов, позволят Гульнаре оплачивать обучение ее сына и накопить в будущем на покупку собственной квартиры в городе.
texts.en:
Gulnara is 50 and married. She has a high school education and is a very kindhearted, responsible and purposeful woman. She currently isn't working but has great experience in entrepreneurship, as she and her husband ran a cafeteria in their home region for more than 10 years, where they had regular clients and good income. However, during the events of 2011 she and her family had to close their business and move to the city of Bishkek, leaving behind their relatives and their home.

After a break, Gulnara has decided to start another business. She found out that good loans for start-up businesses are available through Bai Tushum Bank. She has taken a course in financial literacy, done the math and valued her future business. She has also already acquired shelves for her shop, looked through ads and researched the standard prices for containers, and found a place not far from her home where she could open a shop. Having done the calculations, Gulnara figured out that she needs a loan of 150,000 KGS, which will allow her to purchase a container. She has long dreamed of opening her own business and therefore has saved some money and will use these savings to purchase refrigerators, scales and food products for sale.

Gulnara and her family's current combined income is about 8,600 KGS, made up of her husband's pension and her son's salary - her son, by the way, is quite the achiever and not only studies at the university, but also works part-time in a clinic and earns a salary of about 5,000 KGS.He helps where he can both financially and around the house but it's not a lot of money and Gulnara wants to be independent and turn things around so she can help her son. Therefore she has decided to start her own business. She predicts that her average monthly profit from the shop will be 9,600 KGS after deducting loan payments, which is a good income when added to what they already have. Future business revenue and increase in assets will allow Gulnara to pay for her son's education and in the future to purchase an apartment in the city.

loans.use: to start her own grocery business by purchasing a container to open a shop

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family. Beatriz is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Beatriz requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, four, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

Beatriz has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Beatriz would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, four, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Carmelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Carmelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a selling ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods.  Carmelyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  purchase additional stocks of ready to wear to sell for her selling ready to wear business.

Carmelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia, is a 48 years old married woman from Tbilisi district. She has an unemployed daughter and husband, who works as a baker, so makes a small income. Maia is a sales lady at the local store and generates 350 GEL per month. However the family lives in poverty and require a more stable income to cover all daily costs. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.

So she decided to start her own business with the loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. With the loan of 2200 USD, she will purchase all the equipment and tools and open a traditional Georgian bakery. Her husband has great experience of this kind of work and will make his work more productive and Maia will get the stable source of family-income.

The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need. Maia and her family members will be very grateful for the financial support for developing their own business.

loans.use: to improve her family's living condition and open a bakery.

loans.name: Toipua

texts.en: Toipua is a 44-year-old woman with 6 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbage, cucumber, and eggplant in her village to earn a living. Toipua has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, and eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, and hand gloves, to help her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage,cucumber, and eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en: Ioana is a 34-year-old mother with 3 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. Ioana has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, and container, to assist her in running the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, and containers.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José primeramente trabajó como peón en una estancia y su esposa como cocinera, después que crecieron sus hijos se vio la necesidad de venir hacia la ciudad para que puedan estudiar, así fue que montaron una ferretería en la zona es uno de los pioneros en el rubro.-
 Él se dedica a la venta de ladrillos, arena gorda, y posee una ferretería, hoy en día cuenta con clientela formada por su buena atención y productos de buena calidad que ofrece.-
 El crédito que solicito fue para la compra de materiales para ferretería para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
José first worked as a farmhand on a small farm and his wife was the cook. Later, as his children were growing up, he saw the need to come to the city so they could go to school so he started a hardware store in the area. He is one of the pioneers in the role.

He is dedicated to selling bricks, coarse sand and he has a hardware store. Today he has customers earned from his good attention and the good quality products he offers.

The loan that he has requested was to buy materials for the store that he can later sell.

loans.use: to buy materials for his hardware store.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, all attending school. She has no additional family members. She sales chips, chapatti and fried cassava at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT - SACCO to buy cooking oil, a tray of eggs, chicken, beef, cabbages, potatoes.

Her major challenges include high taxes that are charged by the revenue authority. Her major expenses includes rent and feeding the family. She would like to buy a plot of land to start farming. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, a tray of eggs, chicken, beef, cabbages, potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, bread and other items.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with five children and four of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for many years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She gets additional income from farming. She moves door to door selling used clothes and sells on retail basis six days a week.

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of owning a permanent residential house. She resides in a rented house and family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina is single with five children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a stall of charcoal at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation. She would like to build rental houses in future She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees,utility bills, and rent.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is 52 years old with 3 children who are all grown up.

Minerva's store has been a big help in supporting their daily needs, since her husband's salary working as a driver is not enough to support their needs. Minerva has been operating her store since her children were little. Through the store Minerva has been able to support her children's education. Now that her children are grown up and have their own families, Minerva is still operating her store to help provide on her own. She does not want to depend on her children for her needs.

Minerva has been a SEED partner for 2 years and has seen improvement in her business. Her store, which had been just in front of her house, has been relocated in the market where she can get more customers and increase her income. She has more stocks in her store as her customers are starting to buy in bulk.

She wanted to add spices like garlic, onions and pepper in her dry goods items since these were in demand in the market. She can sell it by retail or wholesale which can increase her income.

Minerva is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy 3 sacks of onions, 2 sacks of garlic, 2 sacks of dried beans and pepper to sell in her store.

Minerva is hopeful that with the loan she can increase her income and help support their daily life since the store now is their only source of income. She wants to save enough to provide for their old age and health and for unplanned events.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of onions, 2 sacks of garlic, 2 sacks of dried beans and pepper to sell in her store.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and two children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a salon business from the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for nine years on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling soft drinks.

She has requested for a loan from MCDT- SACCO of 1,100,000 Uganda shillings to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers, rollers, and shampoo. Her major challenge is power shortages. Her goal and aspiration is to buy better chairs and fridge for her salon. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers, rollers, and shampoo.

loans.name: Jessica Judith

texts.es:
Jessica, de 25 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos niños, su esposo falleció hace 6 años, actualmente vive con los abuelos de los niños. 

Jessica, posee una tienda desde hace 3 años, decidió emprender este negocio por motivación de su abuela, quien le dijo que pusiera una tienda y que ella le ayudaría mientras se acostumbraba al negocio, de esta manera ya tiene su propia tienda y es con la cual genera el sustento diario para sus hijos. 

Jessica, necesita el crédito para comprar más mercadería para el negocio y colocar una venta de hamburguesas y hot-dog, porque su casa está cerca de un estadio de futbol y pronto comenzara la temporada del futbol salvadoreño. 

Jessica, sueña con ver crecer a sus hijos y que se conviertan en profesionales.
texts.en:
Jessica is 25 years old, a single mother of two. Her husband passed away 6 years ago. Currently she lives with the children's grandparents.

Jessica has had a store for 3 years. She decided to start this business thanks to her grandmother's support. Her grandmother told her to set-up a store and that she would help Jessica while she got used to the business. This way, Jessica now has her own store, which provides for her children's daily livelihood.

Jessica needs this loan to buy more merchandise for her business and to install a hamburger and hotdog counter because her house is close to a soccer stadium and the Salvadorian soccer season will start soon.

Jessica dreams of seeing her children grow up and become professionals.

loans.use: buy more merchandise for business and install a hamburger and hotdog stand.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El tiene 50 años de edad es casado, trabaja como obrero en una constructora. Se encuentra preocupado por su esposa debido a que le encontraron un pequeño tumor en su ojo izquierdo que esta creciendo, necesitan extirparlo y la cirugía es muy costosa. El gana el salario mínimo por lo cual le es imposible tratar a su esposa.
texts.en: He is 50 years old and married.  He works as a construction worker.  He is worried about his wife because they found a small tumor, which is growing, in her left eye.  They need to remove it, and the surgery is very expensive.  He makes a minimum salary, which makes it impossible to treat his wife.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Bharati

texts.en:
Bharati is a 39-year-old housewife. She is from a small village of Khagrabari. Her husband, Sunil, is a blacksmith who earns a very small income. Bharati also tries to add some money to the family funds by running a small, home-based business. They are blessed with one son.

Their son, Shibsankar, is 19 years old and pursuing his B.A. (Bachelor of Arts) education in Sanskrit from B.T. Evening College. He is now in his first year.

His parents have done their best for him to complete his schooling and give him the opportunity to enter a good college. He is average in studies, but hopes to go for higher studies. If he gets private tuition, then he could do much better in his coming examinations.

Bharati is very eager to give her son all kinds of support, but is unable to do so because of their inadequate income, so she is requesting an education loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy education supplies and pay tuition fees, college fees, etc., for her son’s continuous education.

Bharati and her son, Shibsankar (in the photo), are very happy and thankful to BJS and Kiva for this educational loan.

loans.use: to purchase educational materials and pay educational fees for her son.

loans.name: Kulchum

texts.en:
Kulchum is a 28-year-old lady who lives at a small village in Falakata of West Bengal. She is a mother of two children (a daughter and a son). Both of her children are studying in different grades in a local village school. Kulchum had attended school till grade 5 and could not proceed further due to her family’s poor financial conditions. She is willing to provide her children a good education so that they can lead a better life in the future.
