Kulchum’s husband is engaged with a shuttering business, and his earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational expenses of their children after meeting the household costs for their family.

Kulchum’s daughter, 10-year-old Nargish, is now studying in grade 5 in Falakata Subhash Girls’ High School and is very much serious about her studies. She wants to continue her studies further with good marks, so she needs the help of private tuition to score better in all her examinations; otherwise, she could not proceed further.

Kulchum learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan for her daughter’s uninterrupted education. With the loan amount she will pay the school fees, private tuition fees and buy necessary educational articles for her daughter, Nargish.

Kulchum and her daughter, Nargish, are very much grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan. They give hearty thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: to pay the schooling fees and buy necessary articles for her daughter’s educational purposes.

loans.name: Elsira

texts.es:
La Sra. Elsira es de la ciudad de Lambaré, es propietaria de un negocio familiar, un Taller de Confecciones, está ubicado en su casa, cuenta con infraestructura y maquinas adecuadas para poder seguir con su trabajo.
Es una señora. Muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Tiene casa propia y su hijos ya son todos profesionales que con mucho sacrifico pudo sacarlos adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos gomas, botones y otros para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ms. Elsira is in the city of Lambaré, and is owner of her own family business, a clothing shop. It is located in her home, and features infrastructure and adequate machines to be able to continue with her work.

She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman. She has her own home and her children are already professional who with much sacrifice were able to succeed.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fabric, rubber thread, buttons and others to be able to continue with her work as she has done.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, rubber thread, buttons and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Rovinsa

texts.en:
Rovinsa is married with four children, and all four go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes.

She generates additional income from selling onions and green banana fingers. She works seven days a week.

Rovinsa aspires to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business.

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Kaarendy Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Kaarendy Poty ” está en su  ciclo 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lorena, quien es vendedora de ropas variadas, es una mujer muy trabajadora que está esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Poco a poco y con la lucha que viene haciendo,  y sumada a las capacitaciones que esta recibiendo mejora poco a poco su negocio.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas de todo tipo, como ser: remeras, camisas, pantalones, blusas, polleras y otros, y de esa forma tener los medios para poder continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group named "Kaarendy Poty" is in its ninth cycle of the women's committee program where they are in a poverty elimination program fighting and working hard to be able to grow and improve their living conditions and that of their families.

One of the members is Lorena who is a vendor of various clothing. She is a very hard working woman who is working to improve her living conditions and that of her loved ones. Gradually and with hard work, and coupled with the training that she is receiving, she is improving her business gradually.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy clothes of all kinds such as shirts, pants, blouses, skirts and other items and thus have the means to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes of all kinds such as shirts, pants, blouses, skirts and other items.

loans.name: Chaitali

texts.en:
Chaitali is a young woman of 28 years from Kandi. She is married and a mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). She wants to educate her children properly. Two of her children are studying in different grades, and her younger daughter is a toddler now. Her husband works in a brick kiln and is hardly able to earn sufficient money to meet all the family's expenses.

The economic conditions of her family required Chaitali to do something for the sake of her family, and she wants to start her own milk supply business. Chaitali wants to purchase a dairy cow. She will supply milk from door to door to her neighbors. She will also sell cow dung, which is a good farm manure and fuel for cooking.

In order to start her business, she needs to purchase one cow. But the biggest challenge she faces is limited funds.

Chaitali is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. It will produce enough milk to enable her to supply more and satisfy her customers. With this business, she will be able to earn more, so she has decided to take a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. The loan will greatly help her to organize her business in more useful ways.

Chaitali wants to help her husband economically and try to contribute in an effective way to educate her children properly.

She gives her heartfelt thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow for starting a new business of supplying  milk.

loans.name: Jhuma

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Jhuma is the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She lives in a small village of Khagrabari. In spite of having an education up to grade 8, she is highly interested to provide her children a good education. Both of her children are regular good students of grade 11 and grade 7.

Jhuma is a housewife, and her husband has a small hardware business. Her son, Chirag, is a student of grade 11 in Maharaja Nripendra Narayan High School. At 15 years old, Chirag is a very meritorious boy and sincere about his studies and the school curriculum. His father is the only earner of the family, so his parents are facing difficulties in paying his educational expenses. Jhuma has been unable to take care of the educational equipment that Chirag needs for grade 11 to continue his studies.

Thus, Jhuma applied for an educational loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for buying educational materials and paying the educational fees of her son, Chirag. This loan amount will resolve her anxiety. Jhuma hopes this educational support will give a boost to her son’s education.

Jhuma and Chirag (as seen in the picture) are now very thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to afford the cost of educational equipment for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoos, rinses, and others.

loans.name: Las Guapas De Minga Group

texts.es:
El grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son 15 mujeres que se unieron para poder sobresalir y crecer en lo que cada una viene haciendo y luchando por mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nadia, entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la Venta de Ropas usadas, a parte de las capacitaciones correspondientes y de los seguimientos también sigue esforzándose por poder crecer y mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas usadas para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
This group is part of the program dedicated to eradicating poverty. It is comprised of 15 women, who united to succeed and grow in their respective fields of work and to help in their struggle to improve their families' quality of life.

One of the members is Ms. Nadia. Part of her work is the sale of used clothing. In addition to the constant learning and monitoring process, she also continues to work hard in order to grow and improve her business.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy used clothes to sell. This way, she will be able to continue with her sales as she has done so far. She is grateful for the opportunity to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “San Antonio” está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde se destaca una de las integrantes quien es la Sra. Daniela, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa está luchando por salir adelante.
Daniela se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas y por medio de su humilde trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su lucha diaria.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas frescas y de estación para poder continuar con sus ventas, y de esa manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar su pequeño emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group 'San Antonio' takes part in the poverty eradication programme.
Daniela, one of the members, spares no effort and works hard every day to be a successful woman entrepreneur and improve her lot in life.
She sells fresh fruit and this humble business gives her the means to help her loved ones thanks to her daily hard work.
She asks for the loan to buy fresh fruit to sell in order to keep her business going.
She is grateful for the opportunity to improve her small business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is an ambitious, patient and powerful guy. He could not complete his education because of the financial situation of his family.

Tareq is 24 years old and lives in Irbid with his family. His family is facing a financial problem. That’s why he decided to help and opened his own business, which is a grocery. He started his business with a low quantity because of the lack of money. Now he wants to expand his business and buy more poultry, and he wants to put in an air-conditioner. Therefore he applied for a loan to buy what he needs to develop his business and increase his income and be able to help his family more and more.

Tareq hopes to save money to complete his education.

loans.use: to buy more poultry and put in an air-conditioner at his grocery.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis está estudiando para ser enfermero, desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar con su madre, ya que nunca tuvo una figura paterna. Luis es una persona muy luchadora que pone todo de sí para poder seguir con sus estudios.
Luis pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de universidad. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis is studying to become a nurse. Since he was young, he has had to work with his mother, since he never had a father figure in his life. Luis is a very determined person, who puts in all of his efforts to continue with his studies.
Luis is asking for this loan in order to pay for university fees. He is grateful for the opportunity he has received to become someone in life.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en:
Hieng, 44, lives in the community of Kampong Thom province, Cambodia. She has two children.

To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice. She sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 12.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming.

To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from KIVA now to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds and insecticides.

She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is 43-year-old mother with four children. She runs a convenience store in her village to earn a living.

Mele is requested a loan to help her pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee.

She is an SME client and has an excellent repayment record. She hopes to keep her daughter in university until her graduation; her daughter is studying business management and hopes to become a professor in the near future.

Mele became a member of SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee.

loans.name: Iemaima

texts.en:
Iemaima is a 52-year-old mother with four children; she runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living.

Iemaima requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, hand gloves and a backpack sprayer to help her run the business.

She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, hand gloves and a backpack sprayer,.

loans.name: Sreim

texts.en:
SREIM, 43, comes from Kampong Thom province. He is a father of five children.

To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, growing rice for sale and earns, on average, an income of USD 7.00 a day. So far, he has been in this career for around 20 years.

To ensure the harvesting acceleration, he would like to have some people to assist him in the harvesting process, yet he doesn’t have sufficient money to do so.

Therefore, he would like to apply for a KIVA loan to pay for hiring laborers.

He would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for hiring laborers

loans.name: Maliasusana

texts.en:
Maliasusana is a 38-year-old mother with five children.

Maliasusana runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living.

Maliasusana requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and hand gloves to help her run the business.

Maliasusana will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and hand gloves.

loans.name: Tolopo

texts.en:
Tolopo is a 20-year-old mother with one child. She runs a business selling tuna sandwiches and toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Tolopo requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned tuna, plastic bags, containers and butter to assist with the business.

She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned tuna, plastic bags, containers and butter.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Mirta vive en la ciudad de Encarnación, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas en su salud, es por ello que pone su mayor esfuerzo.
Mirta se inspira en poder ayudar a las demás personas y también en poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder  pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Mirta lives in the state of Encarnación. She is studying nursing. She wants to help others with their health. That's why she puts forth her best effort. Mirta is inspired by the ability to help others and to improve her own quality of life.

She seeks this loan to be able to pay the fees associated with her degree, so that she can continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Iuogafa

texts.en:
Iuogafa is a 37-year-old mother with six children; she runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living.

Lina has requested a loan to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a box of canned fish, a box of vegetable oil and a box of milk to assist her run the business.

She has been doing this for more than two years. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a box of canned fish, a box of vegetable oil and a box of milk.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other member of her family. She has been selling raw food and vegetables in the market at retail for the last 15 years, working seven days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy cabbages, oranges, pineapples, onions, cabbages and boxes of tomatoes.

Her challenges include transportation and perishability of fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to buy land and start farming. She rents a house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, oranges, pineapples, onions, cabbages.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children. She operates a fruit and vegetable stall at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last four years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy pineapples, watermelon, mangoes, oranges, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and carrots. Her major business challenges include perishability of fruits and seasonality. Her goal is to start farming. She lives in rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and rent.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, watermelon, mangoes, oranges, tomatoes.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children. She operates a food stall at the market selling fruits and vegetables on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last four years and she works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy watermelon,mangoes, oranges, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and carrots. Her major business challenges include perishability of fruits and seasonality.

Her goal is to expand her capital base so as to serve more customers. She lives in rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, mangoes, oranges, tomatoes, onions,.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is married with seven children and four of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for many years.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She moves door to door selling used clothes and sells on retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of building permanent premises. She resides in her own house and family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy  a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Nhóm 08, Thôn 1, Quảng Lộc Group

texts.en: Xinh is 42 years old and married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Xinh lives in Quang Xuong District, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. Her family is a low-income household in the village. The main hardship that Xinh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. In 2014, Xinh joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Xinh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. With her business profit, Xinh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Taiu

texts.en: Taiu is a 34-year-old mother with four children. She operates a small business selling pancakes, buns, and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. Taiu requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, a bottle of vegetable oil, and plastic bags for her. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Julia está estudiando la carrera de derecho, hoy está estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo para poder cubrir sus gastos de estudios.
Ella está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida, y luchar para poder mejorar sus ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le será muy útil para poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juliana is studying law. She currently studies and works at the same time, to pay the costs of her studies. She is putting forth her best effort in order to be someone in life, and to be able to work hard in order to increase her income.

She seeks this loan to be able to pay her university fees, which will be very helpful in allowing her to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mère de quatre enfants, Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 49 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Afi est une restauratrice de gâteaux qui s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois au marché. Afi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de farine de blé, des bidons d’huile, du sucre et du charbon de bois. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Afii va pouvoir étendre son activité et promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: The mother of four children, Afi is a 49-year old married woman who lives in Adidogomé. Afi makes cakes and obtains the necessary ingredients twice per month at the market. She is requesting this loan so that she can order bags of wheat flour, jugs of oil, sugar and charcoals. With the resulting profit margin, Afi will be able to extend her activity and promote her children's education.

loans.use: to buy four bags of wheat flour, two jugs of oil, one bag of sugar and one bag of charcoals.

loans.name: Hoan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoan, born in 1960, is a Thai-ethnic woman, currently living with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her monthly civil servant salary, so it is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. Her daughter is studying at a university, so Hoan wants to borrow a loan to pay for her daughter’s education fees and invest more in her daughter's studies.

She hopes the loan amount will help her daughter have better conditions for studying and get a good job after her graduation from the university.

Hoan will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s education fees

loans.name: Toan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Toan, 25 years old, is a Thai-ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her lovely daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family's occupation is mainly based on cultivation and breeding. They have about 1.5 hectare of land for cultivating sugar cane and corn, so the income after harvesting sugar cane and corn is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family.

However, her daughter is going to start the first year at kindergarten but Mrs. Toan does not have enough money to pay education fee and buy learning tools for her daughter.

Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will find an extra job to work to earn money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time, and is hoping that the loan amount will help her daughter have better conditions for learning.

loans.use: to pay the education fee and buy learning tools for her daughter

loans.name: Thieu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thieu, 30 years old, is a Thai-ethnic woman. Her family has three members, including her husband and her son. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from the civil servant salary of the married couple, so it is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She is studying at the university for a nursing major, but the saved amount is not enough for her to pay for education fees of the coming term. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She really hopes that the loan amount will help her have good conditions for studying, and when she has graduated, she would have a good stable income and have money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay education fees.

loans.name: Bakur

texts.en:
Bakur is a farmer and lives with his wife and 17-years-old daughter. Bakur's wife helps him a lot with agribusiness and they work hard to run the farm successfully. Their farm includes 30 hens and a big fruit orchard, with peach, cherry, walnut, apple and pear trees growing there.

Bakur asks this loan to purchase car to use it in agricultural works: specifically to transport the harvest to market.

Bakur has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, he wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, he was able to stable his monthly income.

Bakur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. Let's help this hard-working family to prove that everybody can overcome life’s difficulties through hard and devoted work.

loans.use: to pay for a car to use for transporting his fruit to market

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, es una mujer que esta poniendo todo de si para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida, comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
Ella pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is studying business administration. She is a woman who is giving her all to be able to grow and be someone in life. She says that she used her previous loan to pay fees associated with her degree, in order to continue with her studies.

She seeks this new loan to be able to pay fees associated with her degree, in order to continue with her studies, striving to improve the conditions of her life.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Sinuu

texts.en:
Sinuu is a Samoan citizen; she is a 56-year-old mother with nine children.

A loan amount of $12,000 WST will help Sinuu to buy a freezer, registration licenses for alcohol, a cooler, to pay for restocking, etc.

Sinuu hopes to gain more profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, registration licenses for alcohol, a cooler, to pay for restocking, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está estudiando la carrera de Ingenieria Electromecanica, actualmente es empleado de una empresa, y de esa manera busca los medios para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Su principal objetivo es terminar su carrera para poder ejercer, tener mayor ingreso económico y ayudarle a su mamá.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Francisco is from the city of Encarnación. He is studying electromechanical engineering. He is currently employed by a business, through which he seeks the means to be able to improve his quality of life.

His principal objective is to finish his degree so that he can work, increase his income, and help his mother. He seeks this loan so that he can pay his university fees, in order to be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 21 years old and supports one member of his family. He runs a business of buying and selling livestock for the last five years. Right now his monthly income is ksh 20,000.

He is borrowing a loan from visionfund ksh 30,000 to buy cows for sale. He will use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and meet family needs. This is his first loan from visionfund. His hopes and dreams for future is to continue with livestock, marry and have children.

loans.use: to buy cows  for  sale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
It’s hard to imagine raising raise eight children. It’s quite challenging to provide for their everyday food, given their usual needs such as clothes and shoes, and pay for their educational expenses. But Alicia, 52, is trying her best with the help of her carpenter husband, Romeo, and with the aid of her vegetable vending and hog-raising business. They also own a piece of land where they plant and harvest some crops. This is a good source of alternative income. As of now, two of her children are already working and six are still studying. She doesn’t consider her big family as a burden; instead she sees them as companions in her life journey.

When Typhoon Haiyan devastated the Philippines, especially the Visayas region, in November 2013, Alicia’s vegetable vending business suffered a lot due to damaged farmlands, trees and crops. With the help of her family, they were able to “build back better” her enterprise. Now she’s aiming to add more vegetable produce and buy fertilizer for their farm. She also plans to buy additional piglets to raise.

A loan worth PhP 30,000 would be very helpful to procure all these. Additional income and savings from this loan will contribute a lot towards their dream of completing their children’s education and enjoying a little comfort in life someday.

Alicia meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, fertilizer and piglets for her businesses.

loans.name: Samba Sadio Wolof Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée en 2009.Les membres habitent dans le même village et ont une bonne entente et une solidarité dans le groupe.leurs principales activités est le commerce et l’élevage.

Mame Diarra l'emprunteur en vedette est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est marié et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 garçons.

Elle s'active dans le petit commerce de tissu.Elle s’approvisionne dans les villes les proches pour revendre dans son village et les villages environnants.
Avec le crédit,elle va acheter 2 pièces de tissus Khartoum et wax.
 
Avec les bénéfices,elle va renforcer son épargne,assurer les fournitures de ses enfants.Elle participe à la prise en charge de la nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in 2009. The members live in the same village and get along well, there is solidarity within the group. Their main activities are trade and animal rearing.
Mame Diarra, the featured borrower, is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of six children including three boys. She works in the petty trade of cloth. She gets her supplies in the nearest towns to resell in her village and surrounding villages. With the loan, she will buy two pieces of Khartoum and wax cloth. With the earnings, she will build her savings, and buy supplies for her children. She contributes to the purchase of the family's food.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en: Chea’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Soeu province in Cambodia. Chea makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel, his wife and grandmother live in Gugarq village. Emanuel runs their family farm. The farm consists of only calves, cows and one pig, but Emanuel works hard to sustain the farm and gather income for family's living.
Emanuel applied for this loan to enlarge the farm with two oxen and purchase forage for feeding the livestock in the winter.

As this is Emanuel's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The loan will greatly assist Emanuel to continue his farming business.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and forage for feeding the livestock in the winter

loans.name: Soklim's Group

texts.en: Members of Soklim’s Group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. Soklim makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and teacher to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel for boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sambou's Group

texts.en:
Sambou’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia.

Sambou makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and tailor to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Sarin’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sarin makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and tailor to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is a repeat client to the institution. He is married with 5 children, with 4 attending school. He operates a retail shop at Omurutwe trading centre in Bugangari Sub County, which he has been doing as his business for over 15 years.

Cleophas was constrained with limited capital and he decided to join Ugafode to access financial assistance. He has been taking a loan to boost his business, so he applied for a loan of 3000,000 million to expand to add new stock in his business i.e. salt, clothes, rice, beer to meet the available market in the area.

Cleophas thanks Ugafode for financial assistance which has enabled him to sustain his business and be able to meet all his family financial obligations.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to boost his retail trade business.

loans.name: Mousumi

texts.en:
Mousumi hails from the village of Nabagram under Kandi in Murshidabad district of West Bengal.

She is a 32-year-old married homemaker as well as a lovely mother of one six-year-old daughter. In order to provide more financial sustenance, she gives private lessons to the children of her village. Her husband is running his medicine shop in the village successfully. He is supported in his endeavor by his wife Mousumi.

Now they want to make the business bigger to become more sustainable. This aspiration is only blocked because of lack of financial options and the need of a loan.

So, Mousumi is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) so that she can invest the amount to buy new medicine stock for her husband's shop.

Mousumi is very happy and wants to convey her thanks to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of medicines for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia estudia para poder ser una buena contadora, y por medio de sus estudios poder crecer no solo como persona y como profesional.
Ella es de la ciudad de Pilar, y comenta que está poniendo todo su sacrificio para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Claudia is studying to become a good accountant, and through her studies to be able to grow not only as a person, but as a professional. She is from the city of Pilar, and says that she is giving her all to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her loved ones.

She seeks this loan to be able to pay the fees associated with her degree, in order to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando continua con sus estudios de contabilidad, es una persona muy sacrificada que viene esforzándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder continuar con sus estudios.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder pagar de vuelta las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Orlando continues with his study of accounting. He is a very self-sacrificing person who strives to be able to improve his living conditions and those of his loved ones.

He says he used his previous loan to be able to pay the fees associated with his degree, in order to continue his studies. Today he seeks a new loan to again be able to pay the fees associated with his degree, in order to continue to study as he has been.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Chan Thy

texts.en:
Chan Thy, who is 26, comes from Kampong Thom Province. He is a father of one little child.

To make a living, Chan Thy manages and operates a farming business, growing rice to sell, and he earns, on average, $10.00 USD a day. So far, he has been in this career for five years.

To ensure harvest acceleration, Chan Thy would like to have some people assist him in the harvesting process, yet he doesn’t have sufficient money to do so. Therefore, he would like to apply a Kiva loan to pay for hiring labourers.

Chan Thy would like to thank all lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for hiring labourers.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Membre depuis 2002,  cette brave femme a une expérience avéré dans le programme des Bancs Villageois. Son activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Coumba est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle est vendeuse de tissus.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des tissus d’un montant de 250000 francs CFA et payer des frais de transport et de voyage de 65000 francs CFA. Elle revend sa marchandise au détails dans le quartier.

 Les bénéfices lui serviront  de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
A member since 2002, this courageous woman has proven experience in the "banc villageois" loan program. Her main activity is small retail commerce.

Mrs. Coumba is married with eight children, and sells fabrics.

She intends to use this loan to buy fabrics 250,000 CFA francs' worth of fabrics, plus transportation and travel costs amounting to 65,000 CFA francs. She retails her merchandise in the neighborhood.

She will use the profits to provide for her children and help her husband in managing daily expenditures.

loans.use: buy 250,000 francs' worth of fabrics plus 25,000 francs for transportation, to be sold retail in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Nesa

texts.en: Luzarina is 55 years old from Bien Unido. She is married and her husband is a fisherman.  Luzarina sell his catch and also that of other fishermen. She also makes and sells dried fish and seashells. She is asking a loan to invest more on this business. She will buy more fish and seashells to dry and sell. Her profit will be used to buy healthy diet for herself and her husband, reinvestment on the same business and savings.

loans.use: to buy more fish and seashells to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a food stall selling potatoes, green bananas at the market . She has been in business for the last three years, working seven days a week.

She has requested for a loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy a bag of potatoes and bunches of green bananas . Her challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her dream is to start farming. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy a bag of potatoes and bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been raising broiler chicks and chicken for a while now. This is a thriving business since it only require 45 days and she can sell the chicken to her customers.

She is asking a loan to buy feed and chicks to expand her business. This way, she can buy new chicks on time the moment she has already sold her chicken.

Her income will allow her to buy healthy meals for her family, save for the future and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy feed and chicks

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
She is Mary Jean, aged 44, from Tigbauan, Iloilo. She is married to Jvy, a factory worker, with whom she has one child who is studying in college. They have no luxuries in life but they are happy and content as long as they are healthy and love prevails among them.

As her husband's salary is barely enough to support their child’s education, Mary Jean runs a small store to help her husband make a living. Her stall is located along the street to entice more buyers and passersby. She sells mainly snack items and beverages. She has been in this business for 12 years already and has established a good name in her community.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is seeking a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to pay for biscuits, bread, candies, coffee, soft drinks and instant noodles. These items are commonly in demand in her stall. She trusts your good heart to support her in her livelihood.

In a year or two, their child will be graduating from college and they will be relieved of huge expenses. By then, they would feel that their sacrifices would pay off, because they believe that education is a great equalizer among the rich and the poor.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for biscuits, bread, candies, coffee, soft drinks and instant noodles.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cherry works hard to support her family.

She has a farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Cherry is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming rice business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel works hard to support her family. Raquel is a widow and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetable, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Raquel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia.

Phal makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, four of whom are in school, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a corn and rice mill business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Myrna is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice and corn mill business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una joven soltera, trabaja como asistente en una empresa de telefonía. Hace tiempo comenzó a sentir dolor en la espalda baja y fue diagnosticada con una hernia de disco, con el tiempo ha venido sufriendo de fuertes dolores de espalda por lo que sufre de debilidad en ambas piernas. Su vida cotidiana se ha visto afectada ya que tuvo que ser incapacitada. Le urge ser intervenida para evitar secuelas en el movimiento de las extremidades inferiores. Desgraciadamente su salario no le alcanza para la intervención ya que ella es el único sustento de sus padres.
texts.en:
This is a single young woman who works as an assistant at a telephone company. Awhile back, she began feeling pain in her lower back and was diagnosed with a herniated disc. Over time she has suffered from severe back pain and weakness in both legs. Her daily life has been affected and she has been left disabled.

It is urgent for her to have surgery in order to prevent damage that could affect the movement in her lower limbs. Unfortunately, her salary is not enough to cover the treatment and she is the only one supporting her parents.

loans.use: to receive treatment for a herniated disc.

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hong, born in 1972, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. Her family has four members, including her husband, her son, her daughter and her. They are living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and to save a small amount. She wants to repair her house but the saved amount is not enough to buy materials for repairing the house. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family to repair the house and make it more spacious.

loans.use: to buy materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Nhoi's Group

texts.en:
Nhoi is a Thai woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family lives mainly based on the income from cultivation and breeding. Her family has more than 7,000 square meters of cultivated land for coffee. The income after each harvest is just enough to cover their living expenses and to save a small amount. Her eldest daughter is going to complete junior high school in the coming year and her son is in kindergarten. She wants to take out a loan to buy learning tools for her children.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan on time and she hopes that the loan will help her children have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy learning tools for her children

loans.name: Minh's Group

texts.en:
Minh, born in 1981, is an ethnic Kinh man. His family consists of three members, including his wife, his daughter and himself. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

His family’s main income is from his wife’s civil servant salary and raising chickens and pigs. The income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and to save a small amount. He wants to repair his house but the saved amount is not enough to buy materials. Therefore, he wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

He will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and he hopes that the loan will help his family have a spacious house with good living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Halimah

texts.en:
Halimah is married with three children and two go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market on retail basis and has been in this business for 10 years.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, tomatoes, onions, cabbages. She works seven days a week. She is aspiring to build a residential house. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, tomatoes, onions and cabbages.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is married with 4 children, 2 of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members as well. She is a poultry farmer, and she has been in this business for 11 years.

She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of chicken feed, chicks, and vaccines. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works from home 7 days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include poultry diseases.

She is aspiring to build more room for her poultry and also start growing maize. She resides in her family house and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utilities, and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of chicken feed, chicks, and vaccines.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna lives in Ormoc City, Leyte. She is 61 years old and married. She owns a Sari-sari store (general) business. She sells soft drinks, sachet items of coffee, face cream, milk powder, yeast, eggs, seasonings, toothpaste and fabric conditioner. She is asking for a loan to buy stock of soft drinks, milk in bigger boxes, coffee, shampoo, hair conditioner, eggs, noodles and canned food.

Lorna believes that she can attract more customers if her store is full. In the future, she plans to continue introducing more merchandise to her customers for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, milk in bigger boxes, coffee, shampoo, hair conditioner, eggs, noodles and canned food

loans.name: Massalou

texts.fr: Massalou est une veuve femme de 44 ans qui vit à Agoè. Mère de quatre enfants, Massalou est une revendeuse des céréales et des tubercules d’ignames. Massalou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour atteindre ses objectifs. Pour commander des sacs de maïs, des bassines de cossettes et des calebasses d’ignames, Massalou nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants en payant les frais scolaire dès la rentrée à venir.
texts.en:
Massalou is a widow of 44 who lives in Agoè. The mother of four children, Massalou resells cereals and yams. She stocks up twice a month at the market and resells her wares in front of her house so as to achieve her objectives.

Wishing to order some sacks of maize, basins of manioc chips, and gourdfuls of cocoyams, Massalou needs this loan to finance her restocking and make a good profit so as to cover the needs of her children and pay school fees for the coming school year.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of maize, nine basins of manioc chips and two gourdfuls of cocoyams.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 56 years old and married with four children, who are all grown-up.

Lucila’s husband is helping her operate their candle making business. Lucila knows how to make candles from her former job as a candle maker. Lucila started her business of candle making six years ago when her sari-sari store (grocery store) sales were low and sold the candles from her store to make ends meet.

Lucila's store is their only source of income. Her children cannot support them because their income is only enough to support their own families. Also Lucila does not want to depend on her children, so she is still working hard to provide for her own expenses.

The customers purchase her candles because of the affordable price. Lucila wants to produce a large quantity of candles because some of her customers are asking for boxes, but she lacks the capital to do so.

Lucila is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy five sacks of wax, paint, a mold and boxes to make candles to sell to her customers.

The loan will enable her to increase her income and support their everyday expenses.

Lucila hopes to continually manage her candle business and sari-sari store (grocery store) so that she can save enough to support their health and old age.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of wax, paint, a mold and boxes to make candles to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Thary's Group

texts.en:
Thary’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Thary makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a construction worker and tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. It will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Houn's Group

texts.en:
Houn’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Houn makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. It will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan continua con sus estudios en la carrera de derecho, es una persona que esta poniendo todo de si para poder ser un buen profesional, y de esa forma poder ser un buen profesional que ayude a las demás personas. Comenta que su anterior prestamo lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
Juan pide este préstamo nuevo para poder volver a pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Juan continues with his studies for a law career. He is a person who is giving his all in order to become a good professional, and in this manner, to be a good professional who helps other people. He comments that his previous loan was also used to make it possible to pay his university fees and, thus, to continue with his studies.

Juan is requesting this new loan to pay, once again, the fees required by the law school, enabling him to continue pursuing his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials and repair her house.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 51-year-old dressmaker from the City of Ormoc in Leyte. She has been making dresses for ten years. This is her way to supplement the income of her husband, who is a carpenter.

Through this business, she can help in raising their youngest child, who is 16 years old. Marivic is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine, buttons, zippers, needles, machine oil and fabrics. In the future, she hopes to see her child graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, buttons, zippers, needles, machine oil and fabrics.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin lives in Kampala. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also has additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last six years. She works six days a week.

She has requested a loan from MCDT - SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Savern's Group

texts.en:
Savern’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia.

Savern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and motor driver to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Алишер мужчина 34 лет, женат, отец троих детей. Он родился в сельской местности и с детства знает все тяготы жизни. Он окончил 9 классов школы и очень мечтал поступить в университет. Но так и не смог, так как не было средств. В 18 лет он женился и вот уже на протяжение 15 с лишним лет он занимается животноводством. Хотя Алишеру приходится тяжко, не жалуется ни на что, он живет размеренной жизнью, работает от заката до рассвета, воспитывает и кормит детей. Его родители живут с ним,так как он единственный сын в семье. Алишер хочет, чтобы его дети получили самое лучшее образование и смогли жить не зная забот.
У Алишера 5 коров и 4 баранов. Его жена каждое утро доит коров и относит молоко для продажи на рынок.
Сейчас Алишер хочет купить корм для коров. Также в этом году два его сына идут в школу и он хочет купить им канцелярские принадлежности и одежду. Но у него полной суммы, поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Он надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Alisher is a man of 34 years. He is married and the father of three children. He was born in a rural village and has known all life's hardships since his childhood. He finished 9th grade in school and dreamed of starting university, but he was not able to as he didn't have money. He got married at 18 and has worked with livestock breeding for 15 years already.

Even if tings are hard for Alisher he does not complain about anything. He lives a regular life. He works from dusk till dawn and raises and feeds his children. His parents live with them as he is the only son in the family. Alisher would like his children to get the best education and to live a worry-free life. 

Alisher has five cows and four rams. His wife milks the cows every morning and brings the milk to the market to sell. Currently Alisher would like to purchase livestock feed. This year two of his sons are in school and he would also like to purchase stationary and clothing for them. He does however not have enough money and therefore he turned to "MDO Arvand" for financial support. He hopes for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and to purchase stationary and clothing for his children who are in school

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell for her buy and sell dried coconut meat business.

Demetria has been in this business for 3 years. Demetria earns more income from farming coconut.

Demetria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elena is 60 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Elena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Elena has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia, who is 33 years old married woman, lives in Kutaisi city. She has husband and school-aged daughter and son. Natia works at the local kindergarten and gets a small monthly income, that is really hardly enough to meet even basic needs of her family.

Natia decided to be involved in a trading business and make her work more profitable. She sought for credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts was unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions.

The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1600 GEL purchasing a stock of clothing and start selling in her community. Natia will get the chance to earn income, make better living condition and provide a good education for her children.
Natia awaits Kiva lenders support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothing and start her trading business.

loans.name: Sophun's Group

texts.en:
Sophun’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sophun makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. It will also save time previously spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Layli

texts.en:
Layli is a 37-year-old rural woman from a small village in Khagrabari. She lives there with her husband and two children (one daughter and one son). Both the children are studying in different grades.

Layli's husband is a tailor by trade and his monthly income is hardly sufficient to cover the education costs of his children after managing the household needs. Both parents try their level best to make their children well-educated.

Layli's son Alfajuddin, a 17-year-old boy, studies at Sadar Govt. High School in grade 11. He is serious about his studies but shows average intelligence. He could have done better in his last board exam if he had got any private tutor's help. He has chosen Arts in his Higher Secondary level and his ambition is to be a responsible teacher in the future. Now he wants some good private tutor for proper grooming so that he can score better in his coming examinations.

His mother Layli decided to provide good tutors for her son but is unable to give him that assistance. That is why she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase Alfajuddin's educational equipment, pay his educational fees, and engage a private tutor for him. She hopes that this loan will provide good support to push her son’s education further and that he will be one step closer to his dream.

Layli and Alfajuddin (as in the picture) thank their generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase study materials and pay educational fees for her son’s grade 11.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, baked goods, and other products.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas y semilla de maíz para la nueva siembra, resto lo utilizará para adquirir más animales de corral  como gallinas indias, cerdos, entre otros, espera seguir mejorando su negocio para prosperar junto a su familia.
Agradece el apoyo que le brinda la institución con los créditos que necesita para conservar su actividad económica y cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en: Víctor is requesting a new loan to buy manure, insecticides, pesticides and corn seed for the new season. The rest of it he will use to buy small animals like free-range chickens and pigs amongst others. He hopes to continue to improve his business in order to prosper together with his family. He is grateful for the support that the institution provides with the loans which he needs to keep up his economic activity and fulfill his obligations.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides, pesticides and corn seed for the new crop, the rest will be used for buying more small animals.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, mantiene la continuidad de su taller de enderezado y pintura de vehículos con la ayuda del crédito anterior, comenta que sus ingresos han incrementado un poco y así fácilmente sale adelante con su familia.
Requiere de un nuevo para comprar lijas y pinturas, para realizar sus actividades y brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes, espera tener resultados positivos como anteriormente.
texts.en:
Miguel maintains his vehicle body and painting shop with the help of the previous loan. He remarks that his income has increased a little and thus he is easily getting ahead with his family.

He needs a loan again to buy sandpaper and paint to do his activities and offer a quality service to his customers. He hopes to have positive results as he did previously.

loans.use: to buy sandpaper and paint to do his activities and offer a quality service to his customers. He hopes to have positive results as he did previously.

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Divorcée et mère d’un enfant, Kafui est une femme âgée de 60 ans résidant à Agoè. Kafui est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Kafui sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de tomates, des macaronis et des bidons d’huile en vue de stocker une plus grande quantité de marchandises et  maximiser son profit afin d’aider son enfant dans son éducation scolaire et à son épanouissement ainsi qu’ aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en:
The divorced mother of one child, Kafui is a 60-year-old woman living in Agoè. She resells foodstuffs and restocks her inventory three times a month at the market, selling her goods just in front of her home.

Kafui is requesting this loan to order some cartons of tomatoes, pasta, and some jerrycans of oil, so as to stock a larger quantity of merchandise and maximize her profit. She hopes to help her child in his education and general well-being as well as covering the daily expenses of the household.

loans.use: to buy 10 cartons of tomatoes, one carton of pasta, and four jerrycans of oil.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is 40 years old and the mother of three children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan in Pakistan. She is a responsible and hardworking woman. Her youngest child is a student.

Naheed engages in a poultry farm to earn an income. She started her poultry farm 14 years ago, because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses. Her work is raising and selling poultry to suppliers.

She is currently requesting a loan which she will invest in buying chicks and chick feed, and in making some repairs to her enclosures.

Her goal is to continue working until she fulfills her dream to improve the condition of her house, since it was built many years ago, and its current state is not the best.

Naheed will be thankful to KIVA and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chick feed for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Khimsern's Group

texts.en:
Khimsern’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Khimsern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Corriente De Agua Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (Prisca,  María Sebastiana y Edelmira) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de productos básicos y nacatamales; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace 3 años para obtener préstamo en Pana Pana. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario corriente de agua, por la rapidez de movilización del vital líquido y ellas representan el trabajo femenino porque buscan como colocar su capital para obtener ganancias. 

Edelmira: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora de 30 años sonriente, casada, con 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Su esposo trabaja como vigilante. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, estableció una pequeña pulpería en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad de Bilwi. Está solicitando financiamiento para diversificar sus productos y vender nacatamales de viernes a domingo a precios accesibles. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three women (Prisca,  María Sebastiana and Edelmira), who are of the Miskita ethnicity of the city of Bilwi in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are entrepreneurial women who work every day with the goal to grow their small businesses of basic products and nacatamales (a dish of corn, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaves). They joined together as a solidarity group three years ago in order to receive loans through Pana Pana. They decided to name the solidarity group "Stream of Water", due to the swiftness of movement of this vital liquid. They represent female work because they are looking for ways to allocate their capital in order to receive profits.

Edelmira: She is a member of the solidarity group. She is a smiling woman of 30 years, married, with three teenage children who are studying in secondary school. Her husband works as a guard. With the goal of helping cover household expenses and the cost of education for her children, she set up a small grocery store in her section of the market in the city of Bilwi. She is requesting a loan to diversify her products and sell nacatamales from Fridays to Sundays at reasonable prices. She dreams of being a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to diversify her products and sell nacatamales (a dish of corn, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaves).

loans.name: Nhab's Group

texts.en:
Nhab’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Nhab makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and as a seller to support her family.

In the village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. It will also save time previously spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
57-year-old Clarita is a Sari-sari store owner from the community of Ormoc City in Leyte. She is married and she has operated her business for a few years now.

She has been selling basic items to the community, like canned food, noodles, detergent, bath soap, shampoo, seasonings and condiments. She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory so as to attract more customers.

She will use the loan to buy biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, vinegar, chips, shampoo and bath soap. Clarita is aware of how a store that looks full attracts more buyers than the stores that lack displays. She plans to expand her store and introduce more merchandise that she did not previously carry.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, vinegar, chips, shampoo and bath soap

loans.name: Jorge Franklin

texts.es:
Jorge, ha podido mantener el inventario de su tienda surtido con la ayuda de créditos, incluyo productos nuevos, tiene mejores ventas e ingresos que son de utilidad para apoyar a su familia.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para no descuidar el buen servicio que da a sus clientes, comprara granos básicos, bebidas, helados, condimentos, etc.,  para reactivar la tienda, también planea adquirir materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jorge has been able to maintain the inventory of his store, which includes new products, supplied with the help of the loans. He now has better sales and income which are used to support his family.

He is requesting a new loan to not neglect the good service he offers to his customers. He will buy basic grains, beverages, ice cream, condiments, etc. to reactivate his store. He also plans to acquire construction materials to improve his housing.

loans.use: buy basic grains, beverages, ice cream, condiments, etc. to reactivate the store and to acquire construction materials to improve his housing.

loans.name: Ana Vidal

texts.es:
Ana, con el financiamiento anterior pudo tener los materiales de costura necesarios para ir mejorando la calidad y producción de prendas de vestir, está satisfecha por confirmar que sus esfuerzos le permiten dar el sustento diario a su familia.
Opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar zippers, botones, aplicaciones, broches, hilos, telas, etc., necesita tener estos materiales para cumplir con los encargos que han hecho sus clientes, espera que su negocio siga creciendo y en el futuro tener un mejor equipo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ana with her previous loan was able to have the sewing materials needed to improve her quality and production of clothing. She is satisfied to confirm that her efforts allowed her to provide the daily sustenance for her family.

She is applying for a new loan to buy zippers, buttons, accessories, fasteners, thread, fabric, etc. as she needs these materials to fill orders from her customers. She hopes that her business continues to grow and in the future have better working equipment.

loans.use: to buy zippers, buttons, accessories, fasteners, thread, fabric, etc. as she needs these materials to fill orders from her customers.

loans.name: Eugenio De Jesus

texts.es:
Eugenio es soltero, vive con su hermano y sobrinos, su familia lo apoya en ocasiones, sus oficios son cultivar granos básicos, cuidar de su ganado y trabajar por jornadas con otros agricultores, así puede costear sus gastos, tiene 16 años de haber iniciado su propio negocio, sus padres le enseñaron trabajar para salir adelante, poco a poco ha ido aumentado el área de cultivo y las cabezas de ganado, no representa dificultades en sus actividades.
El crédito le servirá para comprar insumos agrícolas y preparar el terreno para continuar trabajando en la agricultura, además invertirá en alimento para ale ganado, fortalecer su negocio para ser responsable con sus obligaciones y cuidar mejor sus animales.
Sus sueños son construir su casa propia, mejorar la ganadería y apoyar a su familia a tener un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Eugenio is single. He lives with his brother and his nieces and nephews. His family supports him on occasion. His work is growing basic grains, caring for livestock and working as a laborer for other farmers. This is how he can cover expenses. He has had his own business 16 years. His parents taught him yo work to get ahead. Little by little he has increased his cropland and his heads of cattle. This has not been a difficulty for his activities.

The loan will be used to buy agricultural materials and to prepare the soil to continue working in agriculture. He will also invest in cattle feed to fortify his business to be responsible with his duties and to better care for his animals.

His dream is to build his own house, improve the cattle ranching, and helping his family to have a promising future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to prepare the soil and continue working in agriculture. He will also invest in cattle feed.

loans.name: Chreng's Group

texts.en:
Chreng makes a living as a rice farmer and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. She is part of a loan group whose members live in a rural village in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. In Chreng’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.
