Chreng is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families. They will also save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Nhim's Group

texts.en:
Nhim’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Nhim makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. It will also save time previously spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Roth's Group

texts.en:
Roth makes a living as a rice farmer and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. He is part of a loan group whose members live in a rural village in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. In Roth’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Roth is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family. Having a water filter at home will help each group member safeguard the health of their family. They will also save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, es estudiante de la carrera de Artes y su meta es la capacitación total de la carrera para la inserción en el campo laboral.
Es una persona muy sacrificada que se está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Emilio is from the city of Paraguarí and studying for a degree in Art. His goal is to receive the full training of his degree program so that he can join the workforce. He is a self-sacrificing individual who puts forth the greatest effort into improving his living conditions and those of his loved ones.

Emilio is requesting this loan so that he can pay his degree fees. This will allow him to continue his studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose , an entrepreneur from Ormoc City, Leyte, has owned a small grocery store for more than 15 years now. She is married with three dependents ages 12, 15 and 16.

Her business consists of selling food and personal products; for example, she sells rice, sugar, oil, coconut wine, soda, biscuits and candies. The business is the source of her daily income.

Rose needs to make further investments in her store; however, she lacks the funds to do so. Rose is requesting a loan to buy additional items and merchandise to sell, like rice, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks and more coconut wine.

With the loan, Rose will be able to augment her stock to attract more customers, thus giving her the chance of increasing her sales. She hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks and more coconut wine

loans.name: Bintou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc Villageois a été en 2002. Il est composé de femmes qui habitent la même localité et entretiennent des liens fort de solidarité. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Bintou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est la représentante du groupe. C'est une femme âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de d’encens.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter dans les produits pour la préparation de l’encens d’un montant de 50000f et du parfum d’un montant de 20000f pour le revendre en détails et renouveler son stock tous les mois.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’aider son mari dans les charges familiales et renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan group was created in 2002. It consists of women from the same locality who maintain strong ties of solidarity. Their main activity is small retail commerce.

Mrs. Bintou (seated at the far right raising her hand) is the group's representative. She is a 53-year-old married mother of two children. She is active in the commerce of incense.

She will use this new loan to buy 50,000 francs' worth of ingredients for the preparation of incense and 20,000 francs' worth of perfume for retail sales, and renew her stock supply once a month.

The profits will enable her to help her husband with family expenses and strengthen her business activity.

loans.use: buy 50,000 francs' worth of ingredients to prepare incense and 20,000 francs' worth of perfume

loans.name: Maria Brenda

texts.en:
Maria Brenda is 45 years old and is from Ormoc City, Leyte. For the past 20 years, she has operated a sari-sari (convenience) store in her community where she sells basic household commodities such as detergent, seasoning, toiletries, chips, canned goods, and soft drinks. In addition to this, Maria Brenda also helps run a transportation business that is a tricycle driven by her husband. 

Maria Brenda is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent, beer, and soft drinks. These items are in high demand and sell well on a daily basis. With her loan, Maria Brenda is confident that her sari-sari business will be more prosperous. She will use the profit from her loan for the school fees for her five children.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent, beer, and soft drinks

loans.name: Germita

texts.en: Germita is a 62-year-old woman from the community of Ormoc City, Leyte. She is engaged in selling bananas and biko (a rice cake made of sticky rice, coconut milk and brown sugar). Germita also sells banana cue (a deep-fried banana in caramelized sugar). She is asking for a loan to buy sticky rice, brown sugar, coconuts, bananas and cooking oil. Germina wants to expand her business so that she will not depend on her six grown children. In the future, she plans to reinvest and improve her business and snack menu.

loans.use: to buy sticky rice, brown sugar, coconuts, bananas and cooking oil

loans.name: Darwin Otoniel

texts.es:
Darwin necesita de un nuevo préstamo por los buenos resultados que estos le dan al invertirlos en su negocio, comprara aceite, frijoles, arroz, pan, boquitas, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad con los que mantendrá a sus clientes satisfechos.
El impacto que ha tenido al invertir el crédito anterior ha sido muy positivo, pues su negocio ofrece mayor cantidad de productos, le genera mejores ingresos y su estilo de vida es más confortable.
texts.en:
Darwin needs another loan because of the good results it gives him when invested in his business. He will buy oil, beans, rice, bread, snacks, detergents, and other necessities that will keep his customers satisfied.

The impact of the previous loan he invested has been really positive. His business offers a greater variety of products which generated more income, and his way of life is more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, rice, bread, snacks, detergents, and other necessities that will keep his customers satisfied.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 47 years old from the community of  Ormoc City in Leyte. For five years, she has been selling feed to the people in her community through her retail store. Most of her feed is for poultry. She is asking for a loan to buy more sacks feed to sell and also sacks of rice to add to her inventory. Ruth’s income will provide school fees for her 6-year-old daughter and a healthy diet for her family.
 
In the future, she hopes to expand her business to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feed and rice

loans.name: Bhabani

texts.en:
Bhabani is an entrepreneurial 47-year-old. She is married and her family consists of her husband and one son aged 28 years. Her only daughter got married. Bhabani lives with her son and husband in Kandi, Murshidabad district, West Bengal. Her son who studied up to M. A (Master of Arts) is engaged in a business of medicine with his father. Bhabani has not lagged behind. With a lot of work and effort she runs a multi-gym center which is doing well.

Bhabani was able to study up 8th grade but dropped out as her parents could not afford school fees. Ten years ago she decided to open a gym because she enjoys exercising and because there was no gym in her neighborhood with which she would compete. Every day she takes care of the clients who come to exercise. She offers her clients affordable prices, a balanced fitness program, and nutritional structure. This allows the members to gain strength, while offering a friendly, supportive environment. Bhabani thinks that her clients are an inspiration to her every day.

Now she is requesting an enterprise loan from Kiva's partner BJS to remodel her gym which needs some improvement. She will purchase some modern equipment that her customers demand. The loan amount will make improvements to her gym and increase her earnings which she wants to utilize for the betterment of her family.

Bhabani is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase some modern equipment that her customers demand for her Gym centre.

loans.name: Sreang's Group

texts.en:
Sreang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor support her family. She is part of a loan group whose members live in a rural village in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. In Sreang’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Sreang is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people safeguard the health of their families. They will also save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea makes a living as a rice farmer and also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. She is part of a loan group whose members live in a rural village in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. In Kunthea’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Kunthea is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people safeguard the health of their families. They will also save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Sochet's Group

texts.en: Sochet’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sochet makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these group members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Beberly

texts.en:
Beberly is 38 years old and married with five children, ages 5 to 18. While her husband works as a welder, she operates a sari-sari (variety) store to supplement their income. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like shampoo, detergent, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, matches, chips, biscuits, candies, condiments, canned food and seasonings. Beberly hopes that she can further expand and invest in her business so she can send her children to school.

She lives in Ormoc City with her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, detergent, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, matches, chips, biscuits, candies, condiments, canned food and seasonings

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena is a resident of Ormoc, Leyte. She is  27 years old with a  six-year-old daughter.  For the last four years, Lorena has been engaged in a sari-sari (convenience) store business to earn a living. She is asking a loan to buy stocks of goods to sell such as detergent, bath soap, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, rice, and soft drinks. Her income will be utilized for her family's daily consumption and payment of school fees.

loans.use: to buy detergent, bath soap, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy watermelons and refreshing beverages, as well as a new shelter to keep working.

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: Mère de quatre enfants, Adèle  est une femme mariée âgée de 49  ans résidant à Agoè. Adèle  prépare et vend de la boisson locale appelé « Tchoukoudou » faite à base du mil. Adèle s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de mil, Adèle  demande ce prêt  pour financer son achat ; ce qui lui permet d’augmenter sa quantité de marchandises, éviter les ruptures et de fidéliser ses clients et avoir plus de bénéfices pour participer aux charges de son foyer puis aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
The mother of four children, Adèle is a married woman aged 49, living in Agoè. She prepares and sells a local drink called Tchoukoudou, brewed with millet. Adèle stocks up twice a month at the market.

Wishing to order some sacks of millet, Adèle has requested this loan to finance her purchase which will allow her to increase the quantity she brews, avoid running out of brew, and retain her clients. She will make more profit to use to help cover the household expenses and help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of millet to brew millet beer to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some heads of cattle.

loans.name: Shohruh

texts.en: Shohruh is an attentive boy. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1997. He is single and lives with his parents. He graduated high school with excellence and is going to enter university. He wishes to get a higher education degree. He is interested in history and law. In order to enter university he needs to pay a tuition fee for his studies. He appealed to IMON and Kiva asking to get a loan to pay for his higher education costs. He awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education costs.

loans.name: Zula

texts.en:
Zula is married with seven children. Four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sales samosas and chapatti from home. She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include defaulters. She generates additional income from farming. She aspires to buy a plot of land.

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy baking flour, spices, and cooking oil. She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy baking flour, spices, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en: Kosal’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Kosal makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en: Justin is a single man. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells movies. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more movies. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more movies.

loans.name: Chameli

texts.en:
Chameli, 44 years old, is a hard-working lady from Kandi in Murshidabad district in West Bengal. She resides with her husband and two daughters. She has a secondary level education and she has a small job in a local school. Her elder daughter is attending school in grade 8, and the other one is a toddler.

Chameli's husband has been running a small grocery store selling daily need items like oil, soap, shampoo, biscuits, tea, sugar, etc. for the last five years. Right now her husband's business is not going well so he earns low income. With this income, they cannot keep up with their family expenses. Due to a lack of capital, her husband cannot purchase additional grocery items for his store to attract more customers. A loan will help him expand his business and enhance his earning capacity.

This is why Chameli is requesting a loan from BJS, Kiva's partner, with an aim to expanding the business. She wants to utilize the loan to purchase a stock of detergent powder, oil, soap, shampoo, biscuits, tea, sugar, etc. That will help the little shop expand its business.

Chameli believes her husband will earn more income from this investment which will help her to manage her family expenses smoothly. She hopes to expand the business and save enough to educate her daughters properly.

Chameli thanks her lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her husband's grocery store.

loans.name: Rosa Fany

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 36 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos de 17, 15 y 9 años vive en una casa arrendada puesto que no les alcanza para comprar una.

La ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en San Lorenzo a 30 minutos de la oficina de Guaranda, esta ventanilla se encuentra formada por 12 socios los que se dedican a agricultura especialmente el maiz.

Ella se dedica a sembrar papas, maiz ademas tiene un negocios de gallinas en las cuales las engorda y luego las vente peladas.

Con el apoyo del credito quiere mejorar su negocio para asi poder educar a los hijos. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Guaranda en un Local Comercial "Fertiza" El sueño es que tener sufuciente dinero para que los hijos estudien la universidad.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a conversar con los vecinos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old and has three children aged 17, 15 and 9 years old. She lives in a house that she leases as she can't afford to buy one.

The communal bank is located in San Lorenzo 30 minutes from the Guaranda office. It is made up of 12 members who work in agriculture, especially growing corn.

Rosa works growing potatoes and corn. She also has a chicken business where she fattens them and later sells them de-feathered.

With the help of the loan she wants to improve her business so she can provide education for her children. She will make the purchases in the city of Guaranda at the "Fertiza" premises. Her dream is to have enough money for her children to study at university.

In her free time she likes to go out and converse with the neighbors.

loans.use: to improve her farming and chicken raising business.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is 38 years old and hails from Falakata. She lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Her children are receiving education. Her husband is engaged in gardening work. The family income is too inadequate to cover her children's educational expenses.

Kiran’s daughter, 19-year-old Bishorika, reads at Raichenga Vidyaniketan (H.S). She is in grade 12 now and chose the Arts stream for her further education. She is going to take the Higher Secondary Board examination next year; that’s why she needs the help of good private tutoring. In the future her ambition is to pursue an M.A. (Master in Arts), thus she is trying to give her best in the coming Board examination. She needs some reference books to gain more knowledge for scoring well, but her parents are unable to fulfill her requirements with their limited earnings.

To overcome this, Kiran has taken out a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase all the necessary educational articles and pay all educational fees for her daughter’s further education, so that she can smoothly go ahead with her studies and reach her goal.

Kiran and Bishorika (in the picture) thank their lenders for the financial help.

loans.use: to cover all the education-related costs of her daughter.

loans.name: Mirium

texts.en: Mirium is a mother of four children who sells cassava flour and also deals in coffee buying and selling. These two sources of income help her meet her family needs. She is a very focused woman looking forward to transforming her businesses into a big coffee store that can supply the community throughout the year. However, being her family's sole provider, she is faced with a challenge of lack of capital income to run both her family and her businesses. Mirium requests a loan to buy more cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Wendinda Group

texts.fr:
SUZANNE, est une femme âgée de 46 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants.
Restauratrice depuis 05 ans. 

Le restaurant se situe dans la cour d’une gare de transport où il ya beaucoup d’affluent, elle dynamique propre et aimable tout cela fait marcher son activité. 

Elle veut le prêt pour acheter 20 caisses de boissons et de riz 5 sacs de 50 kg.
 
L’utilité du prêt de pouvoir renforcer son activité de restauration. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt plus de 6 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Suzanne is a 46-year-old married mother of four children. She has been running a restaurant for the past five years.

The restaurant is located in the courtyard of a transportation station where there are large crowds. She is dynamic, clean and friendly, all of which contributes to making her business prosper.

She wants the loan to buy 20 crates of drinks and five 50-kilo bags of rice.

The loan will serve to strengthen her restaurant business. She has already been granted more than six loans and and repaid them as scheduled.

loans.use: purchase drinks (20 cases) and five 50-kilo bags of rice for 1,075,000 CFA francs

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is a single mother of five children and three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members . She operates a food stall in her home area and has been for 5 years . She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, tomatoes, dried fish, onions. She works from home seven days a week and sells of retail basis only.

Her major business challenges include seasonality of food. She is aspiring to build a residential house. She resides with her family and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food, and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, tomatoes, dried fish, onions.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola is married with six children and attend school.  She also takes care of additional family members . She operates a food stall and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and cassava.  She works seven days a week.  She would like to buy a plot of land. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas and cassava

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn  is 41 years old from Bien Unido,  Bohol. She is married with five children ages 2-12. Her husband work as a Security Guard and Jocelyn is into operating a sari-sari store (general store) where she sell basic household needs like toiletries, seasoning and canned goods.  This business started eight years ago earning her PHP5000 per month. She is asking for a loan to buy items in bulk like detergent, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, chips, noodles, soft drinks, liquors and canned goods.  She hope that in the future, she will be able to make her store bigger so she can better provide for her family. Her priority at the moment is the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy detergent, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, chips, noodles, soft drinks, liquors and canned goods

loans.name: Kizito

texts.en: Kizito is a married man. He has two children. He operates a farm where he grows maize, beans, and other crops. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his family's living standards. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is 56 years old and married with six children.

Honorata is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Honorata requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Honorata has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Honorata would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Andrés David

texts.es: Andrés es un microempresario que se encuentra domiciliado en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla en compañía de su cónyuge y su hijo de apenas siete meses de nacido, éste emprendedor joven de 20 años es herrero por tradición; aprendió este arte gracias a su padre quien le permitió desde niño involucrarse en el proceso productivo de ornamentaciones en su taller.  Hoy en día cuenta con una amplia experiencia que le permite realizar productos de aspecto refinado que combinan su talento y originalidad.  Los servicios de diseño y elaboración de cerramientos en hierro para terrazas, ventanas, puertas, carpas entre otras estructuras, los propone a sus clientes a través de su propio catálogo que contiene fotografías de trabajos de su autoría y tan pronto como el cliente escoge la referencia, le genera la cotización según el diseño y espesor del hierro. El servicio es cancelado una vez recibido o conforme al contrato que haya realizado con el cliente y como su capital le es insuficiente para cumplir con la demanda actual, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar materia prima y elaborar estructuras para carpas. Con esta inversión podrá responder a un contrato de una empresa y estará más cerca de cumplir con su meta a futuro es mejorar su capital de trabajo, contar con la maquinaria y el equipo de trabajo necesario en su taller.
texts.en:
Andrés is a micro-entrepreneur who resides in a neighborhood in the south of Barranquilla with his partner and their son who was born just seven months ago. This youthful, 20-year-old entrepreneur is a blacksmith. He learned this trade from his father who allowed him to be involved in the process of making embellishments in his shop as a child.

Now he has ample experience so he can make products that are more refined, which combines his talent and originality. He presents his design & production of iron enclosures for terraces, windows, doors, awnings and other structures to his customers through his catalog, which contains pictures of his own work. As soon as the customer provides the referral, he gives them a quote according to the design and thickness of the iron. The service is complete once it is received or according to the contract that has been created with the customer.

Since he does not have enough money to fulfill the current demand, he is applying for his first loan with Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy raw materials and to make frames for awnings.

With this investment he will be able to respond to a contract with a company. He will also be closer to achieving his future goals, which is to increase the money he makes at work and to have the necessary machinery and work equipment in his shop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and to build frames for awnings.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana, se mantiene trabajando en su tienda para subsistir con sus seres queridos, nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar bebidas, frutas para preparar refrescos, golosinas, quesillo, repollo, tomate, etc., reactivara su tienda y emprenderá la venta de pupusas, otra parte del capital le servirá para pagar la reparación de una refrigeradora y la plancha para pupusas, tendrá en mejores condiciones su equipo de trabajo.
Los financiamientos son de gran apoyo para Diana, ya que de esta manera puede seguir progresando y cubriendo necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Diana supports herself by working in her store in order to provide sustenance for her loved ones. She is once again requesting a loan to buy drinks, fruit to make drinks, sweets, cheese, cabbage, tomatoes, etc. to give a boost to her store and start selling pupusas. The other part of the capital will be used to pay to repair a fridge and a griddle for make pupusas so that she has her working equipment in better condition.

The loans are a great help for Diana, as in this way she can continue to progress and cover the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, fruit to make drinks, sweets, cheese, cabbage, tomatoes, etc. to give a boost to her store and start selling pupusas.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. Margie is widowed and has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Margie requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods to sell, such as chairs and kitchenware. Margie has been in this business for three years now.

Margie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods to sell, such as chairs and kitchenware

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is a married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Meriam is 32 years old.

Meriam has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Meriam requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business, like cooking oil, flour, bananas, and sugar.

Meriam has been in this business for three years. In the future, Meriam would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business, such as cooking oil, flour, bananas, and sugar

loans.name: Savern's Group

texts.en: Savern’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Savern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA AMA DE CASA Y LABORA EN LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA PARA APOYAR EN EL SUSTENTO FAMILIAR. PRESENTA PROBLEMAS DENTALES Y DESCALSIFICACIÓN QUE LE PROVOCAN SEVEROS DOLORES, NECESITA VARIOS PROCEDIMIENTOS QUE DETENGAN EL PROBLEMA Y ASÍ  REAFIRMAR SU DENTADURA. SIN EMBARGO NO CUENTA CON LOS RECURSOS SUFICIENTES PARA ATENDERSE.
texts.en: This woman is a housewife who sells beauty products in order to support her family.  She has dental problems and suffers from decalcification that causes her severe pain.  She is in need of several procedures that will alleviate the problem and reinforce her teeth.  However, she does not have sufficient resources for addressing this issue.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru:
Элмира, 50 лет, замужем, она мама 3 детей, младшая дочь - студентка, ей 19 лет, старшие дети проживают отдельно. У Элмиры высшее образование и хороший опыт в ведении собственного бизнеса. Элмира самостоятельная, целеустремленная, добрая женщина, любит организованность и порядок в делах. У нее высшее образование. 
На протяжении 3 лет Элмира занимается предпринимательской деятельностью - предоставлением парикмахерских услуг (стрижка, покраска, женские прически) и маникюра. Начала Элмира с малого, сейчас бизнес развит, в найме 9 человек, но она сама продолжает стричь и делать прически, так как безумно любит свое дело. Помещение для салона арендованное, есть все необходимое собственное оборудование, салон работает с 9.00 утра и до 19.00 вечера. Ежемесячная чистая прибыль составляет порядка 21,000 сом (KGS). Элмира старается не останавливаться на достигнутом, она, давно планировала начать новый вид деятельности, а именно, предоставление услуг косметолога, визажиста и имиджмейкера. Элмира оценила конкурентную среду в новом виде бизнеса, провела предварительные расчеты и пришла к выводу, что услуги будут пользоваться большим спросом. Узнав о возможности получить льготный кредит "Стартовый бизнес" в Банке "Бай-Тушум", Элмира обратилась за суммой 150,000 сом (KGS), прослушала курс по финансовой грамотности. 
На полученные средства Элмира приобретет оборудование для нового вида бизнеса - специальное косметологическое оборудование: лампу, кварцевый стерилизатор; мойку, шкафы и прочую мебель. Прогнозная ежемесячная прибыль увеличится до 26,800 сом (KGS), за вычетом расходов по кредиту. Так же Элмира сможет обеспечить рабочими местами молодых специалистов. Она охватит новыми услугами как постоянных клиентов, так и привлечет новых.
Прежде всего, почему Элмира берется за любую возможность начать что-то новое, увеличить клиентскую базу и размер получаемой прибыли, это, чтобы иметь возможность улучшить благосостояние семьи, дать достойное образование своей дочери и накопить на воспитание внуков.
texts.en:
Elmira is 50 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her youngest daughter, a college student, is 19 years old, and the older children live on their own. Elmira has a college education and significant experience in running a business. She is an independent, determined, wonderful woman who maintains order and organization in her work. Elmira has been in the business world for three years, providing hairdressing (hair cuts, coloring, and women's styling) and manicures. She started with little but the business is growing. Nine people now work for her, although she still does haircuts and styling, because she absolutely loves her work. The salon's building is rented, has all the necessary equipment, and is open from 9am to 7 pm. Her monthly gross income is 21,000 som (KGS). 

Elmira tries to not stop with what she has already achieved. She has long planned take the business in a new direction, in particular to offer cosmetology services. Elmira has analyzed the competition in this type of business, done some preliminary calculations, and determined that there will be high demand for these services. After finding out about the availability of loans for new businesses at the Bai Tushum Bank, Elmira requested a 150,000 som (KGS) loan, and took a class on financial literacy. She will use the funds received to buy equipment for the new line of business. The specialty cosmetological equipment includes lamps, a quartz sterilizer, a wash basin, shelves, and other furniture. Her monthly income is expected to grow to up to 26,800 som (KGS), after deducting loan payments. Elmira will also be able to provide work for young cosmetologists. She will provide new services to her regular customers, as well as attracting new ones. 

Most importantly, and why Elmira takes every opportunity to begin something new to increase her clientele and income, is her ability to better her family's wellbeing, ensure her daughter is well educated, and save for her grandchildrens' upbringing.

loans.use: to start a new business in cosmetology by purchasing special сosmetology equipment and furniture.

loans.name: Hai's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hai, born in 1962, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman and joined the program of M7-MFI in April 2013. She currently lives with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family lives mainly by pig breeding; each year she can sell from two to three pig herds with the income at about VND 60 to 70 million. However, the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and to save a small amount.

She wants to raise sows but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy sows. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding with high productivity, and then she will get a considerable profit when selling her pig herds next year.

loans.use: to raise sows for her pig breeding business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a beauty salon in a shop that she rents and has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling charcoal.

She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair relaxers, treatments, shampoo, braids, weaves. Her major challenges include seasonality and power shortages. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the shop,food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers, treatments, shampoo, braids, weaves

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with two children and who attend school. She also takes care of additional family members . She is a poultry farmer, which she operates her business from home. She has been in this business for several years. She sells on a retail basis and works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 to buy poultry feeds and vaccines. Her major challenge is diseases that affect the quality of her products. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent. She would like to build more poultry houses in the future.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and vaccines.

loans.name: Nuulopa

texts.en: Nuulopa is a 45-year-old mother with nine children. She runs a  business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years to earn a living. Nuulopa requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and gloves.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Sau is 31 years old with six children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Sau requested a loan to buy a chainsaw, banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2014, and she will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw, banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Rose Maribel

texts.en:
Rose Maribel is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 24 years old, married with two young boys ages one and two.  She is engaged in cooking snacks to earn a living. She sell pancakes, mango fruit, steamed cassava cake and sweet potato. She is asking a loan of PHP4000 to buy cooking oil, flour, banana, milk, cassava and sweet potato.

She dreamed of giving her children a better chance in life through education. She hope to send them to school someday and live a prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, banana, milk, cassava and sweet potato

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie’s variety store is struggling as you can see in the picture. She has a lot of collectibles from her neighbors in Tigbauan, Iloilo. Many of her debtors pay after several weeks or months and she cannot force them because there are times when money is really difficult to earn.

It’s a good thing that she has an alternative source of income which is her farm being nurtured by her husband, Eduardo. They have five children, two of whom are already working. Their combined income somehow sustains their everyday needs and educational expenses of her three younger children. But she still aims to improve her variety store so it can earn enough to lighten their financial burden. A PhP 10,000 loan would be very helpful for her to buy additional grocery items, beverages and few sacks of rice to enhance her inventory. You can be the answer to her prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance.

Rosenie is an enthusiastic member of CCT where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items, beverages and few sacks of rice to enhance her inventory

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Internet cafés are beneficial to most Filipinos who cannot afford a monthly internet subscription. They can pay per hour or per minute of internet use and they can connect with their social network. Cherry, 35, knows this need. That’s why she decided to open an internet café called Piso Net beside her house in Buhangin, Davao City. Piso Net is a coin-operated internet PC with a typical rental fee of 1 PHP every four minutes. It is a budget-friendly internet café suitable for short-time internet users. She can help those students who need to research their school assignments, those families with members abroad who long to see each other through Skype, and also those bored individuals who want to play online games.

But no matter how in demand Cherry’s business is, she will experience loss if she does not give importance to its maintenance. As of now, she needs 29,000 PHP to pay for the checking, upgrading, and maintenance of her computers. She will also buy another computer unit to accommodate more customers. In due time, she hopes to open another branch of Piso Net to double her income.

She’s single but she’s a responsible sister who supports her sibling’s college expenses.

She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy another computer unit and to pay for the checking, upgrading, and maintenance of her computers.

loans.name: Ros's Group

texts.en: Ros’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Ros makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Zarina works hard to support her family.

She has a balut-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling peanuts. Zarina is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more balut to sell to her customers.

Zarina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more balut to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong, 36 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband, her son and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family’s main income is from cultivation, the income from harvesting rice and coffee after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family.

She wants to buy books and learning tools for her children but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have better condition for learning, and then they will have a brighter future. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy books and learning tools for her children.

loans.name: Lorn's Group

texts.en:
Lorn’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia.

Lorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lalmani

texts.en:
Lalmani is a 40 -year- old rural woman. She lives in a small village of Kandi. Lalmani has a big family comprised of her husband and four children (three daughters and a son). Two of her daughters are married and other two children are studying in different grades.

Lalmani’s husband is a driver by profession and she has engaged in a fish-vending business. She has been involved with this business for the past ten years. She buys fish from village fishermen and the wholesale market and sells them in the local market. Unfortunately their family’s income is not sufficient to maintain the family properly, so she needs to expend her business, but she lacks capital.

Thus she applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS. This will enable her to purchase more good quantity of fish to sell. She hopes to get more profit from the expansion of her business and save money for the future. Lalmani is grateful to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fish for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Mendria

texts.en:
Mendria lives in Bien Unido, Bohol with her family. She is 35 years old, married with two children, a daughter who is 12 and a son who is 8 years old. Mendria’s husband is a carpenter and a farmer. On the other hand, Mendria helps him by buying and selling of scrap materials like empty bottles, plastic containers and steel.

She also buy and sell empty coconut shells. Empty coconut shell is to be processed to become a charcoal or a container for Bohol home-made calamay (a famous Bohol delicacy that is made from ground sticky rice with coconut milk and brown sugar). Mendria is asking a loan to improve her three-year-old business and buy more empty coconut shells and bottles. Her income will be for the education of her two children and business expansion. In the future, she plans to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy  more empty coconut shells and bottles

loans.name: Le's Group

texts.en: Le’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Le makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William has finished paying his previous loan. He bought a dairy cow that improved milk production, thus resulting in more income. He was able to provide for his family's basic needs. He wishes to boost his business further by buying quality fodder for his cows. This will lead to an increase in milk production and thus more income. This will ensure that he continues providing for his family with ease.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow that will improve milk production.

loans.name: Tien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tien, 31 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She is currently living with her husband, her son and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her two children are both obedient and good at learning. Her eldest son is at grade 6th while the young daughter is at grade 4th.
Her family’s main occupation is farming so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family.

The new school year is coming and she wants to buy learning tools and pay fee of education for her children. However, she does not have enough money to do these requirements. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her two children have good condition for learning, and then they will have a brighter future. For herself, she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy learning tools and pay fee of education for her children.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Luzarina is 55 years old from Bien Unido. She is married and her husband is in to fishing. Luzarina sells his catch and that of other fishermen also. She also makes and sell dried fish and seashells.

She is asking a loan to invest more on this business. She will buy more fish and seashells to sell. Her profit will be used to buy healthy diet for herself and her husband, reinvestment on the same business and savings.

loans.use: to buy more fish and seashells to sell

loans.name: Martha Marisol

texts.es:
Martha de dedica al negocios propio, tiene 41 años de esdad es casada tiene cuatro hijos vive con la familia en una pequeña vivienda no muy comoda.

Tiene un pequeño restaurante de venta de comida rapida en las cuales vende salchipapas, hamburguezas colas y aguas, en negocio le deja ingresos significativos razon por la que desea ampliar el negocios y comprar pollo para vender.

El sueño de martha es tener un negocio con todas las comodidades necesarias para atender a los clientes, ya que a ella le gusta mucho conversar con los clientes de su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha works for herself, is 41 years old, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in a small house which is not very comfortable. She has a small restaurant which sells fast food such as salchipapas (French fries served with sliced hot dog), hamburgers, colas and fruit drinks.

She earns good income through the business, which is why she would like to increase her business and buy chicken to sell. Her dream is to have a business with all of the conveniences needed to take care of her customers as she enjoys chatting with her customers.

loans.use: to increase her business and purchase chicken to sell.

loans.name: Vivian Rocio

texts.es: Vivian de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 5 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, donde vende diferentes productos como: golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, sopas, etc. posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para surtir su tienda y así poder generar mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vivian is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her family. For five years she has a small store located in her home where she sells different products such as: sweets, sodas, basic grains, soups etc. She has a large clientele due to her good prices and her friendliness with her customers.

She is asking for another loan to purchase more products to better supply her store. She will then be able to generate more income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, sodas, basic grains, soups etc.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick used the previous loan to buy DSTV and stock beer, soda, and waragi to sell.

He is still in the same business of filming and running a video library in a busy trading center, found in Fort Portal, Uganda. His business is growing steadily because his clients deserve to enjoy their leisure by watching movies, football, and other forms of entertainment.

He is faced with a challenge of constant loading-shading, where power is on and off. Lack of power brings his business to a standstill on some days.

Patrick is looking forward to constructing a good house for his family.

Patrick needs a loan to subscribe to DSTV and buy a video camera.

loans.use: to subscribe to DSTV and buy a video camera.

loans.name: Ebah

texts.en:
Ebah, is 55 years old and widow. She lives with her children - one daughter and one son. Ebah is a housewife, however she also has a job. She makes a pouch bag from cement sacks and sell it to the market for 5 years and her children are employees. They pull together to increase their family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 5.000.000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a toilet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is still not enough to build a toilet and water sources by cash, but they are able to repay loans received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Sreb's Group

texts.en:
Sreb’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia.

Sreb makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor by selling groceries to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time they now spend collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 44 years old with three children ages 22, 18, and 17.

Emilia is operating her beauty salon business from her former job as beautician in a salon. Her salon is open from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. She also does home service to make additional income.

Her husband is a mechanic with a minimum salary that is barely enough to support their everyday needs, not to mention the education of their children, especially now that their children are in college and the tuition fees and other expenses are so high.

Emilia just recently went in crisis when her salon was robbed and the equipment inside was all taken, even the chairs and combs. Still Emilia did not lose hope and still opens up her salon and does services.

Emilia is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to buy equipment like dryers, hair curlers, hair irons, scissors, and hair products for her beauty salon to continuously provide service to her customers, especially on holidays.

Emilia is very hopeful that with the loan she will be able continuously operate her salon to generate an income and help support their basic needs and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy equipment like dryers, electric curlers, hair irons, scissors, and hair products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Irma Yaneth

texts.es:
Irma, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, estudio hasta noveno grado, no quiso continuar estudiando y decidió emprender su negocio propio de venta de antojitos (yuca frita, pastelitos de carne y enchiladas) por las tardes en las afueras de su casa, actualmente vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos los cuales están estudiando. 

Irma, tiene un negocio de venta de comida desde hace 2 años, desde pequeña le ha gustado trabajar para ganar su propio dinero, es negocio está a 1 kilómetro de distancia de su hogar y le está yendo bien, en el negocio le ayuda su mamá y sus hijos en la atención de los clientes.

El préstamo será invertido para remodelar el local donde atiende a sus clientes y para comprar mesas y sillas, porque en el lugar donde está tiene más visibilidad y está teniendo más.

Irma, sueña con seguir trabajando y que su negocio siga creciendo como la ha venido haciendo hasta el momento y que sus hijos logren superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Irma is 34 years old. She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who studied up to Grade 9. She couldn't continue to study and decided to open her own business selling snack food (fried yucca, meat pastries and enchiladas) in the evenings close to her house. She lives with her husband and three children who are studying.

Irma has had a business selling food for two years. Since she was young she has liked to earn her own money. Her business is one kilometer from her house. Things are going well. Her mother and children help her serving customers.

The loan will be invested to remodel the shop where she serves her clients and buy tables and chairs. She wants her shop to be more visible and stand out more.

Irma dreams of continuing her work and for her business to continue to grow as it has been doing up to now. She also wants her children to excel academically.

loans.use: to remodel the shop where she serves her clients and buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Samern's Group

texts.en: Samern’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Samern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es: Toribia de 66 de años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de gallina desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, pero también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: gallinas, maíz, verduras, consomés, tomates, hojas de huerta, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Toribia, 66, lives in her own home with her family. She has been making a living selling chicken tamales for several years. Her business is located in her home, but she also sells them on the street in different neighborhoods.

She is requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as chickens, corn, vegetables, broth, tomatoes, garden leaves, etc., so she can continue working and making good money.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as chickens, corn, vegetables, broth, tomatoes, garden leaves, etc.

loans.name: Juntas Y Unidas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina ella es soltera y tiene 51 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, la socia vende cemento, arena y clavos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, clavos y arena.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de materiales de construccion.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the community bank "Juntas Y Unidas" ("Together and United"). This bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province and department of Cusco. This partner is Mrs. Justina. She is single and 51 years old. She has 3 children. She works in her business selling construction materials. She sells cement, sand, and nails. Justina works from 8:00AM until 8:00PM. She already has several years in this business and has done very well. Justina's dream is to expand her business selling construction materials. Justina is asking for this loan to buy cement, nails, and sand. 
The group member who appears in the photo that is attached to the group photo took the photo after the meeting due to work reasons. 
The other partners are in the businesses of textile sales, clothing sales, construction materials sales and grocery store sales. Justina is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium and agrees to comply with the payment of her dues by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails, and sand

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married with two dependents who are two and nine years old.

Anabel helps her carpenter husband by being a P.O. (purchase order) guarantor. To be a guarantor, she has to pay a bond for a big amount of money to the store owner or malls so that people can have her P.O. cards, which they can use to buy groceries and other items from the malls. A certain amount will go back to her in form of a profit from the malls.

She is requesting a loan to invest in more P.O. cards and make her business more successful.

In the future, she would like to continue to expand her business for a better income.

loans.use: to invest in purchase order cards to sell.

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Madhabi is a rural woman. She is only 33 years old, married, and a mother of one daughter. She studied up to grade 4. Madhabi lives with her husband and daughter in their own house in a small village in Khagrabari. She is an optimistic woman who always works hard for the well-being of her daughter and tries to help her husband in his agricultural activities as it is the only source of income for her family.

Madhabi's husband is unable to afford the educational expenses of their daughter after covering the family needs because his income is not sufficient. But Madhabi always wants to give proper education to her daughter. Her daughter Moon Moon is now in grade 12 in Rajarhat Bidyabhaban High School. She is very serious about her study. If she could get private tuition, she could do much better.

So Madhabi seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to support her daughter's education, so that she does not face any hindrance in her education. She will purchase different educational equipment and pay all educational fees for her daughter with the loan.

Madhabi and her daughter Moon Moon (in the picture) are very thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to cover all of her daughter's education-related expenses.

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia is 71 years old and married with seven children. Roselia works very hard to provide for them.

Roselia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, noodles, home care products and other groceries.

Roselia has been in this business for 30 years. 

In the future, Roselia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, noodles, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 43-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children, both of whom are still studying.

Her husband is the main income provider; he owns a small mini-market in his town, and as for her, she doesn't work, she only cares for her home and family.

Currently, with the aim of paying her children's study fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l.

She is a permanent customer and she insists that she will always ask for Kiva’s support to ensure a good educational path for her children and this is their only goal.

loans.use: to pay her children's study fees.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business selling tea, which she has been doing for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

Lucy requested her fifth loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy mores stock of tea. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase mores stock of tea

loans.name: Herlin Marilin

texts.es:
Herlin, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, que día a día lucha para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante con sus estudios, ella es madre soltera, le ha sido difícil mantener a sus hijos, pero con esfuerzo lo está logrando.  

Herlin, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa desde hace más de 14 años, pero cuando no sale a vender ropa, ella hace tamales para ir a vender y no dejar de percibir ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia; la venta de ropa la hace casa por casa en las comunidades más cercanas.

Ella, está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería (ropa) porque su hija por las tardes le está ayudando con la venta y ahora que su hija le ayuda, las ventas van  mejorando considerablemente, porque juntas logran cubrir más territorio y están logrando atender a muchos más clientes. 

Herlin, sueña con que sus hijos logren culminar sus estudios con una carrera universitaria, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando; además desea que su negocio vaya creciendo más y pueda llegar a tener un puesto estable para no tener que andar casa por casa.
texts.en:
Herlin, 37 years old, is an enterprising and hard working woman who struggles everyday to help her children succeed with their studies. She is a single mother. It has been hard to take care of her children, but with effort she is doing it.

Herlin has had a business selling clothes for 14 years, and when she is not selling clothes she makes tamales to sell. She never stops earning to cover the needs of her family. She sells the clothing door to door in neighboring communities.

She is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise (clothing) because her daughter is helping her in the afternoons. Now sales are increasing considerably and they can cover more territory and reach more clients.

Herlin dreams that her children be able to finish their studies and a university education since she never had the opportunity to continue studying. She also hopes that her business continues to grow and that she can have a storefront and no longer sell door to door.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothing).

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is a 40-year-old married woman from Kandi. She is a homemaker and is blessed with three sons. They live in a small village in Kandi, in the Murshidabad district of West Bengal. Her sons are students of grade 9, 6, and 1, respectively.

Mamata's husband is a mason by profession. She is engaged in cultivation and has been working on her own land for many years. She mainly grows paddy along with other seasonal vegetables. Mamata has a great passion for this profession, as all day long, without regard for climate, she goes to look after her crops. She works tirelessly to provide financial sustenance to their family. She gained many good customers for her polite and simple behavior and for selling good quality crops at a cheaper rate. Like the other farmers, she also dreams of extending and improving her agribusiness.

That is why Mamata is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality paddy seeds, compost, and fertilizers which will allow her to produce vigorous good quality paddy rice so that she can give good security to her family with the help of the generated profit.

She is very thankful to her generous lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is a 26-year-old married woman from Kandi. She lives with her husband and two children (a son and a daughter) in the village of Nandi Baneswar. Monika cares for her livestock while her husband is a mason. Her son repairs cars and her daughter reads in grade 9.

With the growing cost of daily essential commodities, it is difficult for Monika to bear all the household expenses and give the family all the basic needs in terms of food or health. Moreover, bearing the education expenses of her daughter creates a burden on her. So Monika sells milk to the people of her locality to contribute to her family's income. She wants to sell cattle by-products like cow dung which is used as manure in the remote region for cultivation. There is also a huge demand for cow milk in her area. So, to avail the opportunity, she has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase another dairy cow and fodder for her business.

She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her because the family income will increase and it can ensure financial stability for her family to lead a decent life. She aspires to give a better education to her daughter with the profit generated from her business.

She conveys her thanks to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Shiuli

texts.en:
43-year-old Shiuli lives in a small village named Magurmari in Dhipguri. She is a mother of two daughters and one son. Her daughters are studying in different grades and her son works as a mason. Shiuli’s husband is a potato vendor whose income is marginal.

Shiuli’s daughter Sima is 16 years old and reads in grade 11 in Gossairhat Rajamohan High School. She has chosen the arts stream. She is serious about her studies and tries to score good marks in her examination. But Shiuli faces difficulties in bearing the educational expenses of her two daughters after meeting the household expenses, yet she is striving hard to provide uninterrupted education to her daughters. Now Sima needs some books and the guidance of good private tutors to score good marks in her upcoming exams.

Thus Shiuli is requesting an educational loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to bear the educational expenses for her daughter, Sima. She plans to pay all the educational fees of her daughter and buy study materials. This loan will help this bright young girl continue her education without any obstacles.

Shiuli and Sima (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's educational expenses.

loans.name: Reyna Mary

texts.es: La señora Reyna Mary nacio el 10 de junio de 1984 en la provincia Carrasco del departamento de Cochabamaba esta concubinado con el señor Jaime. desde muy joven se dedicaron a trabajar en diferentes actividades laborales, gracias a su esfuerzo llegaron a obtener un lote donde actualmente viven. la señora Reyna Mary es madre de familia de 1 niño con el señor Jaime, ella junto a su esposo se esfuerzan día a día en busca de mejores condiciones de vida para ellos y para su hijo,  emprendió diferentes actividades buscando obtener ingresos para la sostenibilidad de su familia. desde hace 10 años viene trabajando en la actividad de la agricultura  dedicándose a la producción de cítricos, negocio que le brinda ingresos económicos favorables para la sostenibilidad de su familia y de su actividad para mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar. la señora a adquirido habilidades en la actividad de la agricultura comercio de frutas y en vista a la rentabilidad del negocio decide ampliar su producción de cítricos para seguir mejorando su economía y tener una estabilidad económica para darles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos. Es por ello que la señora requiere un préstamos para incrementar su producción y mejorar su ventas.
texts.en: Reyna Mary was born on June 10, 1984 in Carrasco province, Cochabamba department. She is in a common-law marriage with Jaime. Since they was very young, they have worked in different jobs, thanks to their efforts, they managed to get a plot of land where they currently live. Reyna Mary is the mother of 1 child with Jaime. She, along with her husband, works day by day in search of better living conditions for themselves and their son. The undertook various businesses looking to get income to sustain the family. For the past 10 years she has been working in agriculture, focusing on growing citrus fruits, a business that offers her good income to sustain her family and, from her work, to improve the family living conditions.  She has gotten skills in the agricultural job of fruit sales and in light of the profitability of the business, she decided to expand her production of citrus fruits to continue improving her economic situation and have economic stability to give her children better living conditions. For this, she needs a loan to increase her production to improve sales.

loans.use: to buy supplies to expand her production and improve sales in this way she can get more income for the good of her family

loans.name: Loulou 1 Group

texts.en:
Naema is the featured borrower for Loulou 1 Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Naema is a 30-year-old married mother of two children. She started three years ago managing her husband's grocery shop to help him in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of products and items to satisfy her customers' special requests. Naema is the first lady on the right of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Sanaa is the lady standing in the middle, and Zahraa is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of products and items to satisfy her customers' special requests.

loans.name: Melvin Orlando

texts.es:
Melvin, de 23 años de edad, está acompañado, junto a su compañera de vida ha trabajado muy duro, tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, él cual es la luz de sus vidas.

Melvin se dedica al negocio de destazo de cerdos y la agricultura, con lo cual da sustento y seguridad alimentaria para su familia y su madre que con la cual vive actualmente y también apoya a Melvin en mucho de sus micro proyectos que le proveen mejorar la calidad de vida.

Melvin aprendió este negocio de su madre la cual hacía esto después de quedarse sola ya que su esposo emigró a los Estados Unidos, pero lo importante en este caso es como ellos han logrado salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, se ha hecho lo necesario para subsistir y conseguir cada día su alimentación, por ello Melvin se levanta temprano para realizar sus labores diarias tanto en la agricultura como en el destazo de cerdos.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar insumos agrícolas y continuar con su negocio de destazo de cerdos, de esta forma podrá seguir obteniendo los ingresos económicos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su familia.

Él espera continuar trabajando con la institución pues le gusta el apoyo que recibe para poder superarse.
texts.en:
Melvin, 23, has a life partner, and they have worked very hard.  They have a one year-old son who is the light of their lives.  Melvin works as a butcher.  He slaughters pigs and also farms. This is how he supports and feeds his family and his mother, who currently lives with them.  His mother supports Melvin in many of his small activities that provide the family with a better quality of life.

Melvin learned this occupation from his mother, who used to do this work after her husband left her and emigrated from El Salvador to the United States.  But what is most important in this case is that they have managed to get ahead with a lot of hard work and dedication.  They have done what needed to be done in order to survive and earn their daily bread.  To do this, Melvin gets up very early to carry out his daily work, both in agriculture and in slaughtering pigs.

Melvin will use this loan to buy agricultural supplies and to continue with his butchering business.  This way, he can obtain the income he needs to support his family.

Melvin hopes to continue working with the institution, as he likes the support he is getting that his helping him to improve his life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Santos Eduviges

texts.es:
Santos tiene 61 años de edad, quedó viuda ya que su esposo era cobrador de un autobús de la zona el cual se accidento y como consecuencia el falleció, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales dos ya formaron sus propias familias y los otros 4 dependen de ella.

Santos trabaja la tierra con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ya que  es su fuente de sustento, con la ayuda de su hijo menor ella trabaja en agricultura, también paga ayudantes para realizar todo el trabajo.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos como abonos, venenos, herbicidas, etc para la siembra de granos básicos y pagar mano de obra.

Santos necesita espera poder ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Santos is 61 years old and a widow. Her husband worked as a local bus conductor until he had an accident and died. She has six children, two of whom have their own families, and the remaining four are still dependent on her.
