Santos is a hardworking and dedicated farmer--the land is her source of income. With help from her younger son, she works the land and also pays other labourers to assist. She needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, insecticides, herbicides etc. for her basic grain crops, and also to pay workers.

She hopes that she will be able to help her children get ahead.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies such as manure, insecticides, herbicides etc. for her basic grain crops, and also to pay workers.

loans.name: Nelson Rubén

texts.es:
Rubén, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado, tiene dos hijos que estudian primer y segundo grado y su esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos. 

Rubén, tiene una relojería y venta de joyas, su esposa le ayuda en algunas ocasiones con el negocio, porque no le alcanza para pagarle alguien más, este oficio se lo enseño su papá cuando tenía 15 años de edad y desde entonces, se dedica a ese oficio y gracias a eso ha logrado salir adelante. 

Rubén, necesita el dinero para comprar herramientas para reparar relojes, él espera poco a poco ir mejorando su negocio.

Rubén, desea poder darle el estudio a sus hijos y también que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Rubén, age 35, studied through the ninth grade.  He is married and has two children, a first grader and a second grader.  His wife works taking care of their children.

Rubén has a watch and jewelry shop.  His wife helps him occasionally with the business because he can’t manage paying an additional person.  His dad taught him this line of work when he was fifteen years old, and ever since then he has done this job.  Thanks to it, he has managed to get ahead.

Rubén needs this money to buy tools for repairing watches.  He hopes to improve him business, bit by bit.

Rubén wants to be able to give his children an education.  He also wants his business to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy tools for repairing watches.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
19-year-old Saraswati is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from Kandi. She is married to Saubhagya and blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). They live in a small village of Kandi in Murshidabad district. Her children are below school going age.

Saraswati’s husband is a potter by profession whose income is hardly sufficient for the family. So to help her husband financially, Saraswati wants to rear a dairy cow for selling cow milk to her local area villagers. By running this business, she will able to earn for her family and save for a secure future. She wants to sell milk and cow dung also because there is a huge demand for these items. To achieve this, she needs capital to start her business. So Saraswati seeks to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a dairy cow.

With the income from her business, Saraswati will be able to support her husband financially to run the family smoothly and can provide a better life to her children. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of four children (three sons and one daughter). She is illiterate but can sign her name only. They live in their own small house at Kandi, a remote region in the district of Murshidabad.

Saraswati’s husband Sadhin is a farmer by profession. Her husband’s income is not sufficient for her family. As Saraswati strives hard to improve the living standard of her family, she runs her own grocery shop for financial sustenance.

She started this business eight years ago. One of her sons is helping her to run the shop. With great dedication and hard work, she has developed her business. But with the growing prices of household essential commodities, Saraswati needs to further develop her business.

So she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to buy grocery items like rice, pulses, salt, sugar, oil, biscuits, flour, etc., in bulk. With these she will be able to meet the demands of her customers as well as earn more to strengthen the family economy for a better future. So she is grateful to her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy necessary grocery items in bulk for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is 47 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband owns a vegetable business for many years. He purchases daily fresh and seasonal vegetables from the main market at wholesale and sells from his vegetable shop at retail. He earns a reasonable profit as he is an honest seller. He manages the household necessities from his earnings. He easily wins the trust of his clients. 

Nighat's husband wants to increase his vegetable stock on a daily basis. Nighat requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to purchase fresh vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Milan

texts.en:
Milan is a rural woman from Falakata. She is a 51-year-old married woman. Her three daughters are married and her only son is a student.

Milan's son Sanjit is 23 years old. He is pursuing a B.Ed. (Bachelor of Education) degree in Birpara College. He is a hard working student and wants to be a teacher in the future. But his marks are not good enough in earlier exams. So he needs proper guidance to excel him and prepare for competitive exams.

Milan's husband is associated with agribusiness. His income provides for the household expenses but cannot pay the whole education cost of their only son. Sometimes they cannot even provide necessary books for their son. Thus, providing him private coaching is too difficult for them to bear.

So to resolve these problems Milan has applied for an educational loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase her son's necessary text books, pay all educational fees, and enroll him in a private coaching class. Milan is hopeful that the loan will help her son to go one step closer to his goals.

Milan and Sanjit (as in the photo) express their gratitude towards their generous lenders.

loans.use: To cover the education costs of her son.

loans.name: Angela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Angela es una mujer muy esforzada, trabajadora y emprendedora, posee un negocio de venta de tortillas y productos lácteos. Es madre de dos hijos, uno de ellos ya ha crecido, el otro aún está a su cargo, siendo madre soltera ha hecho de sus hijos, dos grandes personas. Ella ya había tenido un préstamo con Kiva y MiCrédito con el cual logro crecer notablemente.
Ha vuelto recurrir a un préstamo, para poder abastecerse de lo que es su materia prima, y comprar leña, harina, queso, leche, crema, mantequilla, entre otros. Confían fielmente en MiCrédito y Kiva, además que tiene 20 años de ser comerciante. En un futuro pretende optar a un préstamo de vivienda, con el mejorara el techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Angela is a very strong, hard-working, and enterprising woman. She has a business of selling tortillas and dairy products. She is a mother of two children, one of which has now grown up. The other one is still under her custody. As a single mother, she has made her two children into two great people.

She has already had a loan with Kiva and MiCrédito, with which she achieved to notably grow her business. She has returned to request a loan in order to supply her prime ingredients and to buy firewood, flour, cheese, milk, cream, and butter, among others. She believes faithfully in MiCrédito y Kiva, and has 20 years of experience as a merchant.

In the future, she intends to opt for a housing loan to improve the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy firewood, flour, cheese, milk, cream, and butter, among others.

loans.name: Bharati

texts.en:
32-year-old Bharati lives in a small village of Falakata. She is a courageous mother of two sons. Her husband is engaged in carpentry work. He is the only bread winner of the family and his income is varying, depending on the availability of customer orders. Thus, affording the educational expenses of his sons after bearing the household costs is becoming gradually difficult for him.

Bharati's elder son Hiru, 18 years old, is a student of Bachelor of Arts (B.A) – First year in Ananda Chandra College. He has always been an average student. But with his hard work and dedication, he tries to excel himself confidently.

He would score good marks in the upcoming examination if he got the help of good tutors. As Bharati is unable to provide sufficient study materials and private tutors to her son, she seeks a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, which helps poor students to fulfill their dreams.

This loan will help to provide her son with good tutors and to purchase study materials, which will ensure that Hiru can achieve good marks in his examination.

Bharati and Hiru (in the photo) are obliged to their lenders.

loans.use: To afford the education related costs of her son.

loans.name: Sampa

texts.en:
42-year-old Sampa is a homemaker who hails from Falakata, Alipurduar district. A mother of one son. Sampa always strives hard so that her son receives proper education which she was deprived of in her childhood due to her family’s financial issues.

Now she is a homemaker while her husband is associated with agricultural works. The inconsistent earning from the agribusiness is spent for the household expenses, so they could not provide their son with adequate study materials and pay his educational fees on time.

Her son, 19-year-old Badsha, is studying for a B.Sc. (Bachelor of Science) degree at Siliguri College. He is a serious and studious boy. He has a long-cherished dream to be a teacher and wants to enroll in a B. Ed. (Bachelor of Education) course.

As his parents are unable to provide the college fees regularly which are creating a burden on them, Badsha thinks that his education will discontinue due to lack of money. In this situation Sampa has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase her son's study materials and books and to pay his college fees, examination fees etc. She will also enroll her son in some coaching center to improve him so that he will be one step ahead towards his aim.

Sampa and Badsha are very thankful to their generous lenders.

loans.use: to pay for the educational costs of her son's degree.

loans.name: Roxana Marili

texts.es:
Roxana de 26 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene dos hijos, trabaja en una tienda de productos básicos en el pueblo, es una persona muy responsable y con excelentes principios morales que la han llevado tener mucho éxito en sus trabajo, la joven creció solo con su madre, y realizó sus estudios hasta 9 grado.

Roxana  tiene una experiencia de 4 años en administrar la tienda, gracias a esta actividad la joven ha podido cumplir con todas las necesidades de su hogar y dar lo mejor a sus hijos para poder superarse.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, verduras, aceite, consomés, bebidas, golosinas, café, etc. Para surtir su negocio y cubrir la demanda de clientes.


Las metas que la joven tiene para un futuro son las de haber cancelado el crédito y adquirir otro financiamiento  para el mejoramiento de las instalaciones de su tienda y ampliar su casa ya que planea construir dos habitaciones.
texts.en:
Roxana is 26 years old, she has a partner and two children, and works in a shop which sells basic products in town. She is a very responsible person with excellent moral principles which have allowed her to have a lot of success in her work. She grew up with only her mother, and continued her studies until 9th grade.

Roxana has 4 years experience in managing the shop, thanks to which she has been able to fulfil all the needs of the house and give the best to her children in order to succeed.  

She needs this loan to buy basic products such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, soups, drinks, sweets, coffee etc. To stock her business and meet her clients demand. 

Her future goals include paying off the loan and gaining another source of finance to improve the facilities in her shop and to extend her house, she plans to build two bedrooms.

loans.use: to buy basic products such as rice, sugar, beans, vegetables, oil, soups, drinks, sweets, coffee etc. to stock her business

loans.name: Emilia

texts.fr: Emilia a 52 ans. Elle est commerçante de produits alimentaires.  Mariée, elle a un enfant. Elle s’investit entièrement dans son activité pour trouver de quoi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Avec les microcrédits, elle augmente ses stocks à chaque fois et apporte satisfaction à ses clients.
texts.en: Emilia, age 52, is a reseller of food products. She is married with one child. She is fully committed to her activity in order to help support her family. Through micro-financing, each credit  allows her to bolster her stock of merchandise and achieve customer satisfaction.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 34-year-old married father of one child and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, he left school at an early age and started working seventeen years ago in furniture making to cover his family's needs and expenses.

Ahmad is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business, and so today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy more planks to increase his production and provide his customers with better service.

Ahmad hopes to develop his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more planks to increase his production.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 33-year-old married mother with three children. She is a hairdresser and helps her husband to provide the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Fatima has professional skills and attended a beauty course in an institute.

Fatima is a sacrificing mother who is depriving herself for the sake of her children. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a bedroom for her house.
Fatima hopes to open her own shop in the future to increase her income and providw her family with descent living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a bedroom for her house

loans.name: Protus

texts.en:
Protus is a married man with 4 children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, salt, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items.

loans.name: Intissar

texts.en:
Intissar is a 48-year-old, Lebanese, married woman, living with her husband and five children, some of whom are still studying.

Her husband is the main income source in the family. He is a retired soldier in the Lebanese Army and works as a farmer while she is only focusing on her family.

Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay for her children’s educational fees. She states that, with her Kiva loan, she will be able to help her children to suitably pursue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Bwire

texts.en: Bwire is a married man with one child, and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a very hardworking man and raises goats and sheep to earn an income  in his rural area. He has been in business for ten years and he earns additional income selling bananas. He began the business in order to generate income and he has hopes of establishing another business. He is challenged by fluctuating prices and a lack of  pasture land for his goats. He will use the loan is to buy more goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre llego de virtudes le gusta mucho trabajar en el campo y estar con la familia, es casado tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 4 estan en la universidad y los 3 estan en el colegio.

manuel de dedica ala siembra de maiz y papas ademas a la crianza de animales como vacas, con dinero necesita comprar mas ganado para ampliar el negocios.

El sueña con tener un poquito de dinero para arreglar la vivienda y dar mas comodidad a la familia. En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar la banda ya que el toca algunos instrumentos y disfruta mucho enseñando a los demas.
texts.en:
Manuel is a man of virtue, he likes to work in the fields and to be with his family. He is married and has 7 children, 4 of whom are at university and 3 are at college. 
Manuel earns a living cultivating maize and potatoes, and also raising animals such as cows. With the money he needs to buy more cattle to expand his business.

His dream is to have some money to fix up his home and make it more comfortable for his family. In his free time he likes to play in a group as he plays several instruments and enjoys teaching others.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to grow his business

loans.name: Diocelin Yaneth

texts.es:
Diocelin, de 27años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, estudio hasta bachillerato, actualmente vive con su hijo y su esposo que es agente policial y su otra hija la cuida la abuela mientras ella trabaja.

Diocelin, actualmente trabaja como vendedora en un negocio de venta de repuestos para vehículo, tiene tres años laborando en ese negocio; pero ella además de ser empleada, también tiene su propio negocio, el cual acaba de iniciar y es venta de pupusas, en donde dedica su tiempo libre los fines de semana, para elaborar ese producto en su comunidad.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar carne, tomates, repollo, aceite, mesas y sillas para atender mejor a sus clientes, ella quiere invertir más en su negocio, porque la situación está difícil y en cualquier momento se puede quedar sin trabajo y si ella tiene su negocio bien establecido puede tener un respaldo para seguir generando ingresos.

Diocelin, sueña con ver crecer a su hija y si es posible hacer crecer la familia con dos niños más y todos logren tener un buen futuro.- Además, espera que todo lo que está planeando con su negocio, le salga bien y de esta manera contribuir a la ayuda familiar.
texts.en:
Diocelin is 27 years old and is an enterprising woman. She studied up to high school and now lives with her son and her husband who is a police officer. The other child (a daughter) is in the grandmother's care while Diocelin works.

Diocelin is currently a salesperson at a business that sells spare parts for vehicles. She has been working here for three years, but in addition to being an employee she also has her own business selling pupusas (thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, meat or beans) that she just started. She does it during her spare time on weekends when she makes the pupusas for her community.

She needs the loan to buy meat, tomatoes, oil, cabbage, tables and chairs to better serve her customers. She wants to invest more in her business because her situation is difficult and she could become unemployed at any time. If she has a well-established business, she will have a back-up way to generate income.

Diocelin dreams of watching her daughter grow up and if possible, for the family to grow by two more children. She wants them all to have a good future. Furthermore, she hopes that everything she is planning for her business goes well and that she can contribute to helping the family in this way.

loans.use: to buy meat, tomatoes, cabbage, oil, tables and chairs to better server her customers.

loans.name: Sandra Lisseth

texts.es:
Sandra, de 25 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, solo estudio hasta quinto grado, actualmente está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y todos se encuentran estudiando.  

Sandra, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, además le ayuda a su pareja en la siembra de granos básicos, ambos siembran 14,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra junto a sus padres cuando dejó de ir a la escuela, fue desde ahí que se dedicó a apoyar  a sus papás en las tareas del campo y del hogar; pero ella considera que todo eso le ha servido para ayudarle a su esposo para que juntos puedan salir adelante para llevar el sustento diario a sus hijos. 

Sandra, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo, porque necesitan comenzaron a sembrar, con esto podrán cuidar mejor sus cultivos y esperar una buena producción, para alimentar a su familia y poder vender una parte a su debido tiempo y obtener suficientes ingresos económicos. 

Sandra, sueña con brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos y que tengan las oportunidades que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Sandra is 25 years old and is the mother of three children. She only went to school until the fifth grade. She is currently in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture. All of her children are in school.

Sandra is a homemaker and also helps her partner with planting basic grains. They both plant a 14,000 square meter plot of land. She learned to work the land with her parents after she stopped going to school. It was at that time that she started helping her parents with farm work and housework. But she thinks that all of that served to help her help her husband so that together they can get ahead so that they can support their children.

Sandra is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for the crops because they need to start planting. With this they will be better able to care for their crops and obtain a good harvest to feed their family and be able to sell a portion in due time to earn enough income.

Sandra dreams of giving her children a good education and that they will have the opportunities that she did not have.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Delmy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Delmy, de 42 años de edad, está casada, estudio hasta noveno grado, su esposo es agricultor y solo tienen una hija. 

Delmy, su trabajo consiste en elaborar prendas femeninas y vender ropa usada, actualmente tiene dos meses de no trabajar, porque recientemente la operaron y como ya cumplió la dieta, desea trabajar pero necesita apoyo financiero, porque el dinero que tenía lo gasto en la operación, su esposo también le apoya después de realizar los trabajos en la agricultura.

El dinero que solicita es para comprar tela para la elaboración de cortinas, que le han encargado para una iglesia y comprar una carga de ropa usada, ella considera que la recuperación de ella, será mejor porque ya estará trabajando y eso le satisface.  

El sueño de Delmy, es que no le repita su enfermedad, para poder seguir trabajando y sacar adelante a su familia, porque su hija quiere ser maestra de matemáticas.
texts.en:
42-year old Delmy is married and has a grade 9 education. Her husband is a farmer, and they have just one daughter. Delmy earns her living making women's clothing and selling used clothing. However, she has not worked for two months due to recent surgery. As she has now completed treatment, she wishes to work but needs financial assistance. The money she had before was used to pay for her surgery. Her husband also helps her after he has finished his work in the fields.

The loan that Delmy is seeking will be used to buy fabric to make drapes, as requested by a church, and also a bundle of used clothing. She believes she will recuperate better as she will be working and feeling useful. Delmy's dream is not to get sick again, and to continue working and helping her family get ahead. Her daughter wishes to become a math teacher.

loans.use: buy fabric to make drapes

loans.name: Derng's Group

texts.en: Derng’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Derng works as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sobriyah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Sobriyah. Sobriyah is 50 years old and widowed. She lives with her daughter.

Sobriyah is a housewife; however, she also has a job, making pouch bags from cement sacks and selling them to the market, which she has been doing for 5 years. She works to increase her family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 5,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a water source at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation and water sources for her family, but her family income is still not enough to build the toilets and water sources with cash, although they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life, with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a water source at their home to improve their access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Basooka Kwavula Group

texts.en:
This group is located in a rural area and comprises six members. They are Stanley, Bob, Matia, Charles, James and Moses, who carry out different activities including farming, trading and transport.

Matia is a married man aged 39 with five children, of whom three are attending different schools in different areas. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man. He deals in farming and also trades in coffee as his side business.

He started his business in 1989 to improve his income and to get food for the family. He works six days a week and 10 hours per day. The challenge he faces is limited market. His future hope is to educate his children.

He acquired this loan to boost his agriculture business; he will buy farm inputs such as seeds and organic fertilizers. He also appreciates the services offered by UGAFODE Microfinance and the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Oanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh, born in 1989, is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been joining in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 2008. She is living with her husband, her son and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family lives mainly based on farming, so the income of each harvest after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. Her two children are still at school age, one is at grade 2 and one is at kindergarten, so the education fees cost her much. She wants to pay and invest more in their education but she does not have enough money to do it. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have better condition for learning, and then they will become the future of the nation.

loans.use: to pay and invest more in her children education.

loans.name: Hak's Group

texts.en:
Hak is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province and the mother of two dependent children. At the age of 60, she is still growing rice to earn the main income to support her family, and working as a paid worker as an additional source of her family’s income. She has been involved in these businesses for twenty years. Anyways, her crop could return her a very low income because of drought and threats from insects. She is able to earn about 12 USD per day.

Due to a lack of working capital, she is now leading a group to take this first Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer to boost her crop yields and increase her income to buy household supplies to use. She hopes this loan will help her to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to boost her crop yields and increase her income so that she can manage to buy more household supplies to use.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nansalmaa, 49 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling clothes to local people for 21 years. Her husband is electrician at the power plant.

Using her previous loan, she imported clothes from China at low prices. Now all of the stocked clothes are sold and she needs more clothes to run her business. So she is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy clothes from China. By doing so, she will supply the clothes to people during peak demand period.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies to make food.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo tiene 49 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, posee un taller de calzado, repara y elabora calzado  desde hace mas de 30 años, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de cuero, hilo, pega, tela, etc. para seguir con la elaboración ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y así tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has a shoe repair shop where he has been repairing and making shoes for more than 30 years. His shop is located in his home and he has a lot of customers because of the quality of his product. With the income from his sales he is able to cover his household expenses.

He is requesting a new loan to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric and other items to continue making shoes since it is his only source of work. This will allow him and his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric and other items.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a married man with 8 children who describes himself as determined. He operates a farm to grow maize and raise cows. He has been a farmer for 15 years. His business is located in a fertile area for agriculture and his primary customers are local people. He describes his biggest business challenge as changing weather conditions.

He will use 60,000 KES to buy fertilizer and seeds. He hopes that in the future, he will have a quality life. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en: Reynalda is 45 years old from Ormoc, Leyte. She has three dependents ages seven, nine and seventeen. Reynalda cook snacks which is called Banana chips or Banana crackers. This is made of banana fruit sliced thinly, deep fried with brown sugar. This is a favorite snack by many people and has a high demand at bus terminals. She is asking a loan to expand her business. She will use it to buy cooking oil, banana and sugar. Her profit will be utilized to buy healthy diet for her children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, banana and sugar

loans.name: Chany's Group

texts.en: Chany’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Chany makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is 49 years of age and lives with her one child in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her son is a motorcycle mechanic by profession; he repairs and troubleshoots the motorbikes. He has been doing this business for many years. He provides the services in his workshop near his hometown. Most of the people who have bikes like him to repair their bikes.

He has been running this business for many years and uses very expensive tools for repairing, which have gotten too depreciated. He wants to replace these tools with new ones but he does not have money to buy new tools.

Therefore, Irshad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy new repairing tools and some spare parts for repairing motorcycles.
 
Irshad says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new repairing tools and some spare parts for her son's motorbike workshop

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
Seng’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Seng makes a living growing rice, providing tailoring services, and working in construction to support her family.

Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ganga

texts.en:
Ganga is a 29-year-old humble and hardworking woman from Kandi. Her family comprises her husband and two sons, who are students of grades 4 and 2 respectively. She gives her first priority to provide a good education to her sons because she is illiterate and can sign her name only. Being a housewife, she takes care of her animal husbandry, and her husband is engaged with masonry work.

As the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds, and to provide financial sustenance for her family’s well-being, Ganga has decided to supply cow's milk to her neighbors and local villagers for additional income. She hopes this business will be lucrative and a strong financial support to the family because there is a huge demand for cow milk and cow dung in her local area.

So, she has decided to purchase a dairy cow and cow fodder for starting her milk-selling business. For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

This business will give a boost to her family's earnings to provide good education to her sons and to lead a decent life with her family. With the increased income, in the future she dreams to build a concrete house.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for starting her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 36-year-old married mother of two. Five years ago she started working in her grocery shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and sacrificing mother. She has a good reputation in her region.

Siham is trying desperately to develop her business; thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new business, as a second source of income, through buying a car and renting it out.

Siham hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to start a new business, as a second source of income, through buying a car and renting it out

loans.name: Tausoa

texts.en: Tausoa is a 41 year old mother with 4 children and she runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Tausoa requested for a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than 4 years. She became a member of SPBD in 2003, and she will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk,.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine and her son are in the agricultural business in the village of Nahapetavan, which is in the Shirak region. Karine's husband is a migrant worker who tries to financially support his family.
She raises livestock and grows crops. Karine has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to repay the loan. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments.

Karine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products.

Despite of financial difficulties Karine's first loan really helped her to overcome some difficulties with her farm and she bought feed for her animals. Karine's family is hardworking and they have never avoided the difficulties that are in the agricultural business. Karine expects good results from her cooperation with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for 12 piglets and food to feed the livestock.

loans.name: Zabezia

texts.en:
Zabezia is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be friendly. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. Her business goal is to have a milk plant within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve family living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer emprendedora le gusta mucho sacar adelante a su familia ella es medre soltera tiene 24 años de edad tiene dos hijos pequeños de 3 y 4 años.

se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, ademas a la cria de gallinas y cuyes, ella quiere incrementar el negocios comprando ganado a ver como le va puesto que es un negocios muy rentable y necesita el dinero para la educacion de los hijos.

El sueño de Maria es tener un negocios rentable para poder educar a los niños. en los tiempos libres le gusta pasear con los hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is an enterprising woman who likes to support her family. She is 24 years old and is a single mother of two children who are three and four years old. She works in agriculture growing corn and also raises chickens and guinea pigs.

She was to expand her business by buying cattle to see how it goes because it is a very profitable business and she needs money for her children's education. Maria's dream is to have a profitable business so that she can educate her children. In her free time she likes to walk with her children.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Rosa Aracely

texts.es:
Rosa, de 52 años de edad, por falta de recursos económicos, no tuvo acceso a la educación, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 29 años de edad, que ha terminado sus estudios en la Universidad y solo su hija depende de ella. 

Rosa, es ama de casa, pero también tiene 31 años dedicándose a la agricultura y a la venta de lácteos, tiene tres vacas lecheras que le proporcionan lo necesario, para vender leche y queso que ella misma elabora, trabaja 6 horas diarias y en el cuido de los animales también le colabora su hija. 

Rosa, el préstamo anterior compró una vaca, que mejoro el negocio de la venta de leche y queso, pero en está ocasión el préstamo sera destinado para comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla, abono y fertilizantes para obtener una mejor producción y con el residuo de la cosecha alimentar al ganado.

Rosa, sueña con tener un negocio de lácteos mucho más grande que el que tiene y ofrecer otro tipo de productos como quesillo y crema, también desea que su hija encuentre un trabajo, para la superación personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52 years old and due to a lack of economic resources did not have an education, she is a single mother and has a 29 year old daughter who has finished her university studies.

Rosa is a housewife, but she has also spent 31 years dedicated to agriculture and selling dairy produces. She has three milking cows which give her what she needs, to sell milk and cheese which she makes. She works 6 hours a day in which she cares for animals together with  her daughter.

Rosa bought a cow with the previous loan, which improved her business selling milk and cheese. But on this occasion the loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds and fertilizers to achieve a better harvest, and with the leftover harvest she will feed the cattle. 

Rose hopes to have a dairy business a lot bigger than she already has, and to offer other types of goods such as cream cheese tortillas and cream. She also hopes that her daughter will find work, to help her personal and family improvement.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers to achieve a better harvest

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sopheap makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ermelita

texts.en:
Ermelita is 57 years old with 2 children all grown up.

She operates her sewing business where she sew all the dress and sell them and take sewing services like dress repair in her shop. Ermelita has been in this business since her children are little and her business helps a lot in supporting their basic needs. 

Though her children are grown up, Ermelita still works in her dress shop to help provide for their needs.  Since their children cannot provide for them because of their low income is barely enough to support their own family. 

Ermelita has been SEED partner for almost 5 years and had seed Ermelita improvement in her business. From 1 sewing machine she now has 3 sewing machines in operating to make dress she also has 2 helpers with her whom are neighbors. She also add up a sari-sari store in front of her sewing business.

Ermelita is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 30, 000 to buy 100 yards of fabric, zipper, buttons and other materials needed to sew dresses and sell to her customers.

The loan will enable her to increase her income and gain regular customers as she continuously provides services to them.

Ermelita wanted to continuously manage her shop to help support their expenses and to save for their old age and unplanned events.

loans.use: to buy 100 yards of fabric, zipper, buttons and other materials needed to sew dresses and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is 44 years old with 2 children ages 20 and 16 years old.

Her husband is helping her operating her wholesale sari-sari store (grocery store).

Eda store started out to help her husband generate an income since her husband income as a driver before, is barely enough to sustain their needs. She started with PhP 500 from their savings and sell groceries in front of her house, since the location of her house is in front of the street, most of the time her groceries are sold out. Through time and good management Eda store is now earning a net of PhP 2,000-3,000 daily and her husband helps her now in delivering the items to customers.  The store has been a big help in supporting especially her children education.

Eda has been SEED partner for 5 years and had seen Eda business improvement. Her stocks double and as well as her customers and from retail she became a wholesaler and most of her customers are small sari-sari store in their community.

Eda shared her blessing by supporting her helper in her school expenses and work only 6 hours so she could do her school work. Eda wanted to expand and add more stocks to her store. She also wanted to add an electronic load and rice which is in demand in their community. 

Eda is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 70,000 to buy 5 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 5 boxes of canned goods, 10 cases of soft drinks and electronic load to sell to her store.

Eda is hopeful that with the loan capital she can increase her income more as she supply the demand of her customers and also the complete necessities in her store can attract more customers. 

Eda wanted to continuously manage her store to continuously provide for her family and help others through employment.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 5 boxes of canned goods, 10 cases of soft drinks and electronic load to sell to her store.

loans.name: Kimseng's Group

texts.en: Kimseng’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Kimseng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 48-year-old married father of two. He has been working in the transportation business since 2004. He works in transporting people from his village to nearby villages. He has a very good reputation in his domain and region.
His family's needs are increasing and his income doesn't cover those needs. Fouad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees.
He is working hard to provide them with the best education for a brighter future. He hopes that he can afford a truck which will improve his financial situation.

loans.use: To pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Qobiljon

texts.en: Qobiljon is a handsome guy who was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1992. He is single and lives with his parents. He graduated from  high school and passed the entrance examination to study at a commercial university. He is a full-time student studying language and literature. He needs to pay his tuition fee at time and requests a loan to pay university fees. In the future he wants to be a journalist.

loans.use: To pay university fees

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a farm where she keeps pigs. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more pigs. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable income. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a married man with 5 children. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a farm where he grows tomatoes,beans, maize. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in climate.

He will use the Kes 99,000 loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. His business goal is to have a large scale farm within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, milk, flour, soap and other items.

She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favourable place and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate capital.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more sugar, flour, soap and other items to sell in her shop. Her business goal is to have a big supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour, soap and other items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos and his family is involved in livestock breeding in Areni village of Vayots Dzor region.
Besides farming, Sos works at local company as a distributor, his father is a teacher at a local school.
The family works hard to sustain the farm and develop it. Sos asks this loan to purchase two cows and forage for feeding them.

As this is Sos's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

The loan will greatly assist Sos and his family to develop their farming business.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabel has been operating her own rental-housing business and, as an additional source of income, has had a sari-sari (variety) store business (as seen in the picture) for years now and she earns well from these.

She is from Pasay City, 43 years of age, and is married to Vitaliano. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. Annabel and her husband have to work hard, with the determination of having more income than they currently have, so they can provide their children with a better education.

To improve her profit and to pay for the maintenance of the boarding house, Annabel would like to ask for loan assistance. An amount of PHP 15,000 could help her in the renovation and beautification of their place, so that her regular boarders will choose to stay there for a longer period of time. She will also use a portion of the loan to add up to the capital needed for her canteen business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance, in advance.

In the future, Annabel hopes that they can attract more boarders. She also desires to start up other businesses, for their additional income.

Annabel meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation and beautification of her boarding house.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a hardworking married woman who owns a salt pan and does farming for extra income in Kasese-Uganda. With this she is able to meet her family needs, like educating her children. However , Teddy has bigger dreams like constructing a comfortable house for her family though the resources are not enough to satisfy her dreams. She is so passionate about her business continuity which will assist her in stabilizing her incomes.

She requests for a loan to buy construction materials, like, cement, sand and bricks for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, like, cement, sand and bricks for her house.

loans.name: Eridad

texts.en:
Eridad is 60 years old and married with six children. He deals in the salt business and also keeps cattle as a side income business. He is a very hard working man with a dream of expanding his businesses to new markets and also educating his children so they can have a minimum qualification.

However, he faces a challenge of limited capital plus seasonality changes that reduce the salt levels. Eridad is very determined to attain his dreams. He is requesting a loan to buy more salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy more salt for selling.

loans.name: Hern's Group

texts.en: Hern’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Hern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Somaya

texts.en:
Somaya is a 36-year-old married woman with 1 child who lives in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat.
Her husband earns a low income and Somaya intends to help her husband with household expenses by working in the photography. She started with a DJ and two cameras, and now has an event planning business.

She wants to expand her business to achieve a higher standard of living. She asked for a loan to buy cameras and devices to increase the quality of her work.

This loan will help Somaya to increase her income and improve the standard of living for her child.

loans.use: to buy cameras and devices to increase the quality of her work.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Amina lives in a small village of Dhupguri in West Bengal with her family. She is blessed with three sons. Her husband is a mason by profession; his income varies according to the availability of work. Two of her sons are studying, and one studied up to grade 9; now he is unemployed. Amina faces difficulties to bear the educational as well as household costs of her family. Amina tries her best to provide uninterrupted education to her two sons.

Her youngest son Rakib is studying in grade 8 in Gadong Huzuria Seniour Madrasah High School. He needs proper guidance and study materials to score good marks in this present academic year. But, Amina faces difficulties to bear all the educational expenses of her sons with the sole income of her husband. Amina thought she should help her son Rakib so that he can do better in his upcoming examination and pass out of grade 8 smoothly.

Hence, Amina is requesting a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to bear the educational expenses of her son. She plans use the loan money to pay school and private tuition fees and buy necessary study materials for her son Rakib. The loan will help the boy to continue his education without any difficulties.

Amina and Rakib (in the photo) are happy and grateful to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's educational expenses for grade 8.

loans.name: Menaka

texts.en:
Menaka is a 35-year-old hardworking woman from Kandi. Her family comprises her husband and three children (two sons and a daughter). All her children are students. Her husband is a mason, and she is engaged with a milk-selling business.

To provide a better living, Menaka has been engaged in cattle breeding and supplies milk to her neighbors to earn more for her family. Now this business is a strong financial support to the family. As the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds, she has to work hard so that she can be able to generate more income.

So, she has decided to purchase one more cow and expand her business. For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow and fodder in terms of getting more milk for sale. This will enable her to provide good education to her children and be able to expand her business with the increased profit.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Pov makes a living growing rice and providing tailor services to support her family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these group members to safeguard the health of their families,  save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Narit's Group

texts.en: Narit’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia.  Narit makes a living growing rice and providing tailor services to support her family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, flavored jellies, molds and other items.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en:
Amale is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. In 2010, she began a home-based business to produce homemade food. She works with excitement and enthusiasm as she likes this occupation. She is well known in her region by the delicious food that she prepares.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase ingredients and food provisions to increase her productivity and profits.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and food provisions

loans.name: Sareoun's Group

texts.en: Sareoun’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sareoun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor and seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Durga

texts.en:
Durga is a 26-year-old married woman. They live in Kandi. She is blessed with two daughters. Both of her daughters read in different grades in a local village school.

Durga herself is busy in housekeeping, while her husband runs a small masonry business. He makes foundations (centering) for houses in their rural area. Centering is a temporary structure upon which bamboo, rods, and planks are laid during construction. The profit that comes from this business is used to cover their family's expenses along with their children’s educational costs. This business is the only source of income for the family, and they want to make sure that the earnings from this should be sufficient to make ends meet. Thus, they want to grow this business.

Durga is a housewife who always supports her family and her husband. She has now decided to give financial support to her husband by taking the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) so that she can help her husband to buy more necessary resources and supplies like wood, wooden planks, bamboo, straw, ropes, and tools for making firm foundations for houses. She hopes to provide her children with the best education to establish them.

She is very much obliged to Kiva and BJS, as they came into her life as a light of success.

loans.use: to purchase necessary resources for her husband’s masonry work.

loans.name: Cheerful Grandmom - 50Tphúcnlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mận is 52 years old and she is married with 4 children. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Mận lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Mận faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase processed fish to resell.

In 2009, Mận joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Mận has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the 50TPhúcNLộc, which consists of 3 members. With her business profit, Mận hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: To purchase processed fish to resell

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: Mussarat is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for the last five years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Mussarat's husband needs to do maintenance on his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. It requires some maintenance charges to maintain his taxi. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance on his vehicle. Therefore Mussarat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance cost of her husband's taxi

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives in Kobuleti with her husband, brother and mother. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where they grow mandarin and nut trees. They work hard and sell the harvested products locally. Nana decided to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan. With the received credit Nana will purchase a stock of clothes and will resell them at a higher price. This will give her a chance to generate a stable and increased income. With the increased income she will provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothes.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is married with four children, three of whom attend school in Kasese, Uganda. Julius is a hard working man with different incomes, including a retail shop of general merchandise which he began with his little savings from his salary and a motorcycle transport business from which he gets supplementary income. Julius has an itching desire to build a permanent house for his family despite the hardships of high fuel prices plus constant mechanical breakdowns affecting his businesses. Julius is requesting a credit to buy cement, sand and bricks to build his dream home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks to build his dream home.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Rita is a resident of a small village in Kandi. Her family includes two sons, a daughter, and her husband. Rita's husband is engaged in a cycle repairing business. Rita runs a small-scale sewing work business.

She is well known in her locality for her quality work in stitching women’s clothing such as petticoats, frocks, blouses, etc. She sells her products to the wholesale dealers. She wishes to improve the productivity of her microenterprise by investing sewing implements and new materials, but her savings are too little to make a meaningful reinvestment in her business. At present, she sews with her too-old sewing machine, which sometimes does not work smoothly.

So, she is seeking a business loan of INR 14,000 from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a new sewing machine and other necessary resources. This will help her to produce more women's clothing to satisfy her customers demand as well as expand her micro-business to give her children a better future through a quality life.

Rita thanks BJS and Kiva for their kind support to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase one modern sewing machine to expand her small-scale sewing business.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en: Samia is a 42-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. Her husband represents the main income sources in the family in order to enhance their way of living. Today, she hopes to help her children with their education. For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the first installment of their study fees.  She will be more than happy to see them graduating and achieving their master's degrees. In the future, she plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering their study fees.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of the study fees

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a married man. He has four children. He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be drought, which affects the availability of feed. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy another cow. His business goal is to be a wholesaler of milk within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another cow.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has seven children. He describes himself as honest.

He operates a retail business where he sells movies. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are youthful. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more movies. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more movies

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy animal feed. His business goal is to own a dairy plant within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Edwin Javier

texts.es:
Edwin, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado, tiene 3 hijos de 17, 11 y 6 años de edad.


Edwin, es empleado en una alcaldía en el área de proyección social, es el encargado de realizar los diagnósticos sobre las necesidades que hay en las comunidades, tiene 2 años de trabajar en ese cargo, pero aparte de eso también se dedica a montar eventos, en los que presta todo el servicio con payasos, equipo de sonido, personajes, etc. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar un nuevo equipo de sonido, porque el que tiene está en malas condiciones y lo necesita para los eventos, con el préstamo podrá comprar su equipo de sonido y dar mejores espectáculos con el sonido nuevo.

Edwin, sueña con ver a sus hijos estudiar y que se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Edwin is 38 years old and studied up to high school.  He is married and has three children who are 17, 11 and 6 years old. Edwin works for the local government in the field of social outreach and is responsible for determining the needs that exist in the communities. He has been doing this for two years.

In addition to this, he also puts on events, providing services such as clowns, sound equipment, characters, etc. He will use the loan to buy a new sound system because the one he has is not working well and he needs one for his events. With the new sound equipment he will be able to put on better shows.

Edwin dreams of seeing his children study and be well-prepared academically.

loans.use: to buy new sound equipment.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso es un agricultor con excelentes  principios, se dedica realizar cultivos de maíz y frijol, actividad que realiza desde que era un niño y aprendió de su padre y sus abuelos, creció desempeñando estas actividades y a lo largo de su vida ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos y la que le ha servido para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposa y sus 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.
  

Narciso se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño, cuenta con mucho conocimiento y experiencia gracias a la enseñanza de su padre y su abuelo. En la actualidad se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, maíz y frijoles de esta forma él puede satisfacer las necesidades de su familia y apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos 

 
El dinero será utilizado para comprar insumos para los trabajos agrícolas y herramientas de carpintería, de esta forma podrá diversificar sus cultivos y tener un mejor ingreso económico el cual se sirva para cumplir sus compromisos crediticios.


Las metas que el señor Narciso tiene para futuro son las de tener un sistema de riego en sus parcelas para también trabajar en época de verano lo cual le facilite la plantación de cultivos.
texts.en:
Narciso is a farmer with excellent principles. He works growing corn and beans, work he has done since he was a child and which he learned from his father and his grandfather. He grew up carrying out this work and throughout his life it has been his main source of income and it has allowed him to support his family. His family is made up of his wife and his four children who go to the community school.

Narciso has been working in agriculture since he was a child and he is knowledgeable and has experience thanks to what his father and grandfather taught him. He is currently growing basic grains, corn and beans. This allows him to support his family and support his children's education.

The loan money will be used to buy agricultural supplies and carpentry tools. This will allow him to diversify his crops and have a better income to meet his loan commitments.

Narciso's future goals are to have an irrigation system in his fields so that he can also work during the summer season which will make planting crops easier.

loans.use: to buy supplies for agricultural work and carpentry tools.

loans.name: Fertilité Group

texts.fr: Mwengesyali est commerçante, trésorière du groupe de crédits «Fertilité», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un cultivateur, âgée de 43 ans, mère de 4 enfants tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de friperie dans une avenue du marché depuis 4 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en un ballon des cartables. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mwengesyali is a tradeswoman and treasurer of the credit group “Fertilité,” a client of the Hekima MFI. She is 43 years old, married to a farmer, and the mother of 4 children who are all in school.

She has been a second-hand retailer on an avenue at the market for 4 years. She will purchase a ball and bags. She would like to increase her income and school and feed her children.

In closing, she thanks Hekima for its support of non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase a ball and bags.

loans.name: Valerik

texts.en:
Valerik is a farmer from Agarak town, in Syunik region.

He lives with his five cows and 65 colonies of bees. The honey which he gets from his farm, Valerik sells in local markets.

This loan is very important for him; he wants to purchase one more cow and forage for feeding the livestock. Valerik has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions at that time, he wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, he was able to own a successful farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments.

Valerik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products.

Valerik hopes to receive lenders' support and expects successful cooperation with them.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Qamar Sultana

texts.en: Qamar Sultana is the age of 36. She is the mother of two children, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, and some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Qamar Sultana requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. for his general store. Qamar Sultana thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: Bibijon

texts.en: Bibijon is a strong woman who was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1962. She is married and has one child.  Bibjion teaches Russian language to students at secondary school #14. She has a dream to educate her daughter at a higher education institute. She hopes her daughter will be educated and could find a good occupation in the future. Her daughter successfully passed the entrance examination to the university. She is asking for financial support from IMON and Kiva to pay for her daughter’s education. She awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness and support.

loans.use: To pay her daughter’s higher education costs

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar, 39, is a Palestinian refugee and a married father of four children. He is the sole breadwinner for his family and since 1994 has worked hard to provide for them by painting houses.

Omar is determined that his children have an excellent education so they can benefit from a better future. His income, however, is barely enough to cover his family's increasing needs. So he has applied for a 600 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children’s school tuition fees.

In the future Omar would like to open his own retail painting tools and raw materials shop.

loans.use: to pay for his children’s school tuition fees.

loans.name: Ruyenzi Group

texts.fr:
Berchmans fait partie du groupe  Ruyenzi et  habite à  Bumbura. Il a 25 ans et est marié à Jacqeline,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 2 à 4 ans. 

Il a une boutique   depuis  6 ans. 

C’est son 3ème   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, ilva  augmenter son capital et acheter  des tissus pour coudre des uniformes à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  augmenter son capital et faire vivre ses enfants.
texts.en:
Berchmans is a member of the Ruyenzi Group and lives in Bumbura. He is 25 years old and is married to Jacqeline, a farmer. They have two children together, ages two and four.

He has had a shop for the last six years.

This is his third loan with Turame. With the loan from Kiva, he will increase his capital and purchase fabric to sew uniforms in order to sell them and make more money.

In the future, he would like to increase his capital and support his children.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase fabric.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married father of four children. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are loyal. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia manages a sari-sari (variety) store as her source of income in Batasan, Philippines. She is 44 years old and a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). Sari-sari is a Tagalog word which means “to have many choices.” It is a small type of a convenience store where items are much cheaper compared to supermarkets since you can buy items by piece, by the kilo or in volume.

Like any businesses, competition is one of the prime challenges. That’s why Lilia is always focused on handling the business and marketing strategies to attract customers. With the help of the Lord, Lilia’s greatest foundation, the business is able to survive on a daily basis. She is hopeful that CCT will grant the loan request of PHP 30,000. This amount will be used to buy additional grocery items for her sari-sari store business.

Being a long time member of CCT, Lilia has been consistently attending meetings of her CCT fellowship group that consists of 15 to 30 members. That's where she hears the Word of God and testimonials from partners. This has made her strong spiritually and dependent on God for every occasion.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María, de 52 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, debido a que su familia era muy grande y ella tuvo que trabajar para cubrir las necesidades de la familia; ahora está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen 3 hijos pero ninguno va a la escuela, porque se dedican a trabajar en la agricultura y otros al comercio en el mercado.

María, tiene 20 años de ser comerciante de verduras y frutas, la necesidad de llevar el sustento a sus hijos, la convirtió en comerciante y hoy en día lo hace porque le gusta, el mercado le queda a 8 cuadras desde su casa, es por eso que tiene que levantarse a las 4:00 de la mañana y trabaja hasta el mediodía, luego se traslada a la casa a seguir con los oficios del hogar.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar una plancha para hacer tortillas y comprar 5 sacos de maíz, porque le han vendido un local en el mercado y quiere vender tortillas junto a su hija esto, la plancha que tiene actualmente es prestada, por eso quiere comprar su propi plancha.

El sueño de María, es tener un negocio grande, donde puedan trabajar todos sus hijos y hacer una empresa familiar.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school because her family was very big and she had to work to help make ends meet. She is now in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture. They have three children but none go to school because they work in agriculture and others work as traders in the market.

María has been selling vegetables and fruits for 20 years. The need to support her children turned her into businesswoman and today she does the work because she likes it. The market is eight blocks from her home which is why she has to get up at 4:00am and she works until noon. She then goes to her home to do housework.

The loan she is requesting is for a griddle to make tortillas and to buy 5 sacks of corn because she was sold a stall in the market and she wants to sell tortillas with her daughter. The griddle she currently has is being borrowed which is why she wants to buy her own griddle.
