María's dream is to have a large business where all of her children can work and have a family business.

loans.use: to buy a griddle and five sacks of corn.

loans.name: Kanyange Group

texts.fr:
Christophe  fait partie du groupe  Kanyange et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 39 ans et est marié à Odette, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 3 à 14 ans, dont  3 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de l'huile  depuis  10 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  des palmiers à huile pour la production de l’huile de palme à vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Christophe is part of the Kanyange group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 39 years old and married to Odette, a farmer. Together they have four children aged 3 to 14, three of whom are in school. He has been selling oil for 10 years.

He is on his third loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan, he will increase his income by purchasing oil palm trees to produce palm oil to sell and earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to see his children go to school.

loans.use: to increase his income by purchasing oil palm trees to produce palm oil to sell and earn more.

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en: Soy’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Soy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Bismark

texts.en:
Bismark is aged 27 and supports two dependents. He has been running a business of a petrol station for 5 years. Right now his monthly income is ksh 25,000.

He is taking a loan of ksh30,000 to purchase a new lubricamb machine for fuel lubrication. He would use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and pay school fees.

This is first loan from Visionfund. His hopes and dreams for the future business is to open another petrol station and create a job opportunity to the community.

loans.use: to purchase a lubricamp machine for his petrol station

loans.name: Tohir

texts.en:
Tohir was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1996. He is single and lives with his parents. He is a gentle, active, communicable and fair person. He graduated high school with excellence and wants to enter university and get a higher education degree.

He wants to be helpful and support his native land with qualified specialists as he wishes to be. He appealed to Imon and Kiva lenders to get a loan to pay the tuition fee at university. He awaits your kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is married and has two children. He operates a barbershop that is located in a busy area where he has loyal customers.

Simon has applied for a 40,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner SMEP to buy more barbershop equipment. His five-year business plan is to have the best barbershop in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy more barbershop equipment.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as humble.

She operates a retail shop where she sells flour, bread, sugar, soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient capital.

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items.

Her business goal is to expand business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 45 year old married man with 5 children living in Fort Portal Uganda, a place that is known by its cool weather and a land that flows with milk and honey. He is a farmer growing food crops like tomatoes and bananas. He started the business with a hope of increasing his income base. He is facing challenges of price fluctuation that distorts growth of his profits.

Emmanuel is looking forward to becoming a financially independent person. He has asked for a loan to buy tomato herbicides for spraying his tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy tomato herbicides for spraying on his tomatoes.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Mère de cinq enfants, Ama est une veuve femme qui vit à Agoè. Agée de 52 ans, Ama produit de la farine de manioc appelé « Gari » à base des tubercules de manioc et le revend au marché. Pour s’approvisionner, Ama se rend trois fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de tubercules de manioc afin de gagner des bénéfices pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ama, 52 years old and the mother of five children, is a widow who lives in Agoè. She produces cassava flour called “Gari” from cassava tubers for resale at the market.

To acquire her supplies, Ama goes to the market three times per month. She will use this loan to order bags of cassava tubers to earn a profit to be able to provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of cassava tubers.

loans.name: Kemsreang's Group

texts.en:
Kemsreang, living in Kampong Cham province, is aged 41 years old and a mother of three children, two of whom are in school while the other one is too young. Growing rice and soy bean farming are the sources of her family’s income for twenty-three years. The main challenge of her farming business is drought, which causes her to earn a very low income.

Due to having not enough working capital, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan, which is her first loan cycle via VisionFund. She is willing to use her loan portion to buy seed and take the rest of money to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that this loan will help her to have a good crop and increase her income, which allow her to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seed for good crop growth and increase her income, which allows her to keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Roberto Armando

texts.es:
Roberto, de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no continuo por razones económicas, está casado, su esposa tiene un cafetín afuera de un colegio y con esto apoya a la economía del hogar; tiene 2 hijos, pero la mayor ya tiene su hogar aparte, mientras que el otro tiene 15 años de edad y estudia.

Roberto, es empleado en una gasolinera lejos de su casa, tiene más de 20 años de laborar en ese tipo de trabajo, él trabaja 5 días a la semana y los otros 2 días viaja a su casa y le apoya a su esposa a atender los clientes.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar gaseosas, galletas, dulces, pan, entre otros para el cafetin de su esposa, porque las ventas están creciendo y tiene que estar surtiendo cada semana.

Roberto, sueña con ver a su hijo preparado academicamente.
texts.en:
Roberto, age 56, studied until high school but couldn’t continue due to financial reasons. He is married and his wife has a snack stand outside a school. This business helps to cover the household expenses.

He has 2 children; the oldest one has a home of her own, and the 15-year-old boy attends to school. Roberto works at a gas station far from his house. He has performed this type of work for over 20 years.

He works 5 days a week and the 2 remaining days he goes back to his house and supports his wife with the customers.

The loan will be used to buy soda pops, cookies, candies and bread, among other products for his wife’s snack stand, since the sales have been increasing and they have to supply the business every week. Roberto dreams about seeing his son with a good academic degree.

loans.use: to buy soda pops, cookies, candies and bread, among other products for the snack stand.
